title: Cinematic Chautauqua Circuit
description: THE first motion picture I ever saw on a university campus was Potemkin. This was a quarter of a century ago, when I was an undergraduate at Princeton, and the history department had acquired a print which was projected on an institutional green wall in a tiny classroom before an audience seven people. The last picture I saw on a college campus, a year ago, was Singin in the Rain. The auditorium was filled with several hundred film majors, the equipment was in mint condition (there was eventalk of installing Dolby sound) and after the showing there was a panel discussion (for reasons that escape me, I was a panelist) on whether Gene Kelly or Stanley Donen was the true auteur of Singin in the Rain. (I can recall myself saying that there was merit on both sides.) The students were duly tested on their conclusions. I point this out to indicate that film scholarship has become a flourishing surrogate for a liberal arts education. The film department has in fact become academe in the 1970's what the psychology department was in the 50's  a way to legitimize trendy mediocrity with a bachelor's degree. Students illequipped for either the Job market or a rigorous baccalaureate can put themselves on hold for four years, preparing themselves for a lifetime in the dark. They graduate burdened with only one idea, namely JeanLuc Godard's claptrap notion that film is truth at 24frames a second.

title: Rutgers Volleyball:
description: NEWARK

title: Raquel Schuster Is Fiance of Stanley Herr
description: Raquel Schuster, a teaching fellow and candidate for a doctorate in Italian at Brandeis University, and Stanley S. Herr, a visiting scholar at the Harvard Law School, plan to be married June 17.

title: A Glossary of Nuclear Terms: Cladding to Zircaloy
description: Following are some of the terms used in describing operations and conditions in a nuclear power plant, as compiled by John Noble Wilford:

title: Four Got Overdose of Radiation, But Company Says They're Well.
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 31  While conceding that four employees at the nearby Three Mile Island nuclear plant had received overdoses of gamma radiation, power company officials insisted today that all were well and in no danger of suffering aftereffects. But the Metropolitan Edison Company officials refused to disclose the names or whereabouts of the four, adding to the growing uncertainties over the hazard of nuclear emissions from the damaged plant

title: China Displays Interest in World Nuclear Agency
description: VIENNA  China appears to be concerned about the nuclear capacity of Taiwan and is relying on international cooperation to curb it, according to analysts here involved in atomic matters.

title: Prior Restraint Becomes a Fact
description: A door to press censorship has been opened that some fear may never be closed. In prohibiting The Progressive magazine from publishing an article about how hydrogen bombs are made, Federal District Court Judge Robert W. Warren became last week the first Federal judge ever to issue an injunction imposing prior restraint in a national security case. The judge acknowledged that the case involved a basic confrontation between the First Amendment right to freedom of the press and national security, but said he believed the Government had shown that publication would violate sections of the Atomic Energy Act. (The Judge Has Ruled, Page 9.)

title: The GrassRoots Movement. Begins Here
description: HOW many of you baseball fans out there are aware of the debt you owe to C. Reed. Funk? For that matter, do you think that Reggie Jackson or Roy White  or Lou Piniella or Mickey. Rivers  know how much of what they do depends on C. Reed Funk? Do you think they care?

title: Easy to Grow, Colorful Gourds Are Decorative and Useful
description: GOURDS are afterthought plants. If people grow them at all, it's usually because they pick up one of the garden center's colorful seed packs at the last minute. Then the seeds are stuck in at the edge of the vegetable patch  or just as often forgotten because there's no room left in the garden. Now I'm not suggesting you plan to make gourds a major crop. But if you haven't been growing them, consider what you've been missing.

title: Oh Fed, Where Is Thy Sting?
description: Housing has traditionally borne the brunt of the restrictive monetary policy by which Washington fights inflation. Putting so much of the burden on one industry however, came to be recognized as unfair, and so the Federal Reserve took measures this year to protect housing from the money drought. Now the Fed is having wise second thoughts.

title: Norway Curling Victor
description: Bern, Switzerland, March 31 (AP) Norway won the world curling championship tonight, defeating Switzerland by 54 in the final before 10,179 fans. In the afternoon semifinals, before 7,000, Norway beat Canada, 63, and Switzerland downed West Germany, 95. The United States, which won the title in 1974, 1976 and last year; failed to reach the semifinals;

title: Vilas, Fibak in Final
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, March 31 (AP)  Guillermo Vilas of Argentina had to struggle to beat Heinz Guenthardt of Switzerland, 76, 75, today in the semifinals of a $75,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: Barbara Schoenberger to Wed
description: Dr. and Mrs. henry B. Schoenberger of Amherst, Mass., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Ann Schoenberger, to John William Killeen, son of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Killeen of Greenfield, Mass.

title: Miss McMennamin To Be Wed in May
description: Mr. and Mrs. G. Barry McMenamin of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Karen Foster McMenamin, to Jochen Christoph Bene, son of Mrs. Dieter Bene of Hamburg, West Germany, and the late Mr. Bene.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: HIGHgloss varnishes and enamels produce best results when they are applied to smooth, blemishfree surface, and when they are properly brushed out so that no runs, drips or brush marks show on the final coat. Careful preparation of the surface (sanding, etc.) is, of course, of primary importance, as is working in a dust free room so that airborne particles will not settle on the wet finish, but in addition to all this there are two other pointers that will help insure a smooth, glossy coating when the job is done:

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: UNTIL now, the state's Department of Environmental Protection has managed to find the bright side of bad news regarding the pollution of New Jersey's drinkingwater supply.

title: Strikers 2. Tea Men. 0
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 31 (AP)  Teofilo Cubillas, a Peruvian World Cup star signed just three weeks ago, scored a quick goal that was all Arnie Mausser needed to register his shutout as the Fort Lauderdale Strikers blanked the New England Tea Men, 20, tonight.

title: Debate on Safety of Nuclear Plants Intensifies in the Tristate Area
description: In New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, where nine nuclear plants are in operation, seven more are under construction and six more are planned, there has long been an intense debate over nuclear safety.

title: Sailing and Winning Govern Sinett's Life
description: Seymore Sinett is a man of singular purpose. He does not fish or ski in the offseason. For him, there is no offseason. He sails, and when he is not on the water, he is figuring out how to cross faster.

title: Other World Events
description: A Shuffle in Rumania

title: Mary Scully, Coat Buyer, Bride of Richard Bauer, Trader
description: In St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Garden City, LI., yesterday morning, Mary Jane Scully, ,daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Frederick Scully of Garden City, became the bride of Richard Henning Bauer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Joseph Bauer of Newburgh, N.Y. The Rev. James P. Swiader performed the ceremony.

title: CAMERA
description: I was tired of working in my basement, says John Manners, setting up my darkroom and working when everybody else in the family was asleep ... After awhile the idea of having to set everything up and then clean everything just turned me off. So I sent my film out for processing.

title: Groups to Campaign for Cleanup Of Hazardous Waste Sites in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (AP)  Six national organizations will undertake a campaign to increase the public's awareness of the need to clean up hazardous waste areas across the nation. They estimated that it would cost $44 billion to do the job.

title: Yale Women Triumph
description: PHILADELPHIA. March 31  Yale, the Eastern Intercollegiate champion, outrowed Pennsylvania by two lengths today in the season's opening women's eightoared varsity race on a calm Schuylkill River.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Zoot Suit, which has been brought from a successful run in Los Angeles to the Winter Garden, has its heart in the right place and its foot firmly lodged in its mouth. No question about its intentions. They're virtuous through and through. The collage of newspaper headlines, stopmotion street battles, snatches of verse and fragments of courtroom melodrama is loosely held together.. by remembered, and notorious, event of the 1940's. Seventeen young Mexican Americans, here reduced to a manageable four or five, were jailed, put through a transparently rigged trial and sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of member of a rival gang  though no witnesses were ever produced to say who might have done what. In effect, they were condemned because of their ethnic origins and because of the clothes they wore: The oversized reetpleat trousers that billowed in the winds as they walked, the glistening chains that looped to their ankles, the flatbrimmed hats they flaunted like a declaration of independence. In due time a Citizens Committee was formed to call public attention the flagrant injustice done, and, on appeal, the victims were freed.

title: New Soccer Season: More Stability Seen
description: The North American Soccer League has opened its 13th season with enough things going for It to overshadow the few shaky franchises among its 24 clubs.

title: Reproductions, Fine Woods and Efficiency
description: THE Bicentennial apparently created a little revolution of its own, stirring new interest in old things, or at the very least, reproductions that make up in authenticity what they lack in age. Preoccupation with the charm of centuries pastis evident in everything from wood stoves to wildflowers, but a demand for fine handworked woods is the most widespread.

title: NATURE'S TURBULENT TEST TABE
description: Three mysteries make up the riddle of Genesis: The origin of the universe, the origin of the solar system, and the origin of life. If we can resolve these cosmic mysteries, we will have science's answer to the ageold question of religion and philosophy: How is man to understand his place in the cosmos?

title: UNITED TRIES TO AID PATRONS IN STRIKE
description: United Airlines thousands of passengers scrambled to rework their travel plans yesterday as a strike of 18,600 mechanics and other ground workers shut dowp the carrier's operations.

title: TRIALS OF A ROOKIE
description: After burning up the International League last year, Garry (Muggsy) Allenson finds himself in a battle for a spot on the Boston Red Sox. Photographs by David Burnett.

title: DINING OUT
description: SMART ambition knows its limits. Which why Yolanda Hausler and Brenda Anderson, coowners of the delightful little Fabric Cafe in Pelham, keep their dreams in line with their capabilities. While it is the fantasy of many people to open their own little restaurant serving simple, fresh foods, the two women pursue that principle so well that the smallness of the menu becomes a virtue rather than a hindrance.

title: The Undoing of L.I. Shopping Centers
description: Yards away from a busy shopping center, home buyers debate the pros and cons of condominium living at an unusual redevelopment effort nearing completion in Massapequa Park, L.I. The shopping center is a pareddown version of one that used to cover 30 acres  now reduced to make way for the complex of condominiums.

title: Births
description: COOPER

title: Around the Nation
description: Jury in Otto Passman Trial To Start Deliberating Today

title: How to Help the Lawn Along
description: SPRING has arrived and the time has come to pay attention to the lawn? Right? Wrong. Those who have earned their master's degree in lawnsmanship know that the important time to think about the lawn is in the fall. From September on, the grass has the benefit of a cooler, moister growing season when new seed can grow, fertilizer can begin to accomplish something and the heatdevastated greensward can recover.

title: ART
description: ROSLYN

description: ELMSFORD Funny Girl. Tuesdays to Sundays. Through May 13. Best of Operetta. Tomorrow. Opens 6:15 P.M., buffet at 7, show at 8:30. Sundays one hour earlier. $17 to $20.35. Reservations. An Evening Dinner Theater, 11 Clearbrook Rd. 5922222.

description: SPRING has arrived and the time has come to pay attention to the lawn? Right? Wrong. Those who have earned their master's degree in lawnsmanship know that the important time to think about the lawn is in the fall. From September on, the grass has the benefit of a cooler, motster growing season when new seed can grow, fertilizer can begin to accomplish something and the heatdevastated greensward can recover.

title: Reviving the Dream: A Westport View
description: THE organization was born in a suburban home near Washington this March and, if it remains on track, it will soon touch the consciences of Fairfield County's affluent families.

title: Watson Leith by 8 With 69199
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., March 31  With Tom Watson sitting on a strong eightstroke lead, the finale of the 11th Heritage Golf Classic tomorrow should be a mere formality to complete the regulation 72 holes and determine the order of those trailing him.

title: Sir Charles and the Forte Succession
description: LONDON  For Americans, the story has familiar ring. An Italian emigr takes manual job in the United States and works his way up to foreman. He goes into business with his brother-in-law, and then brings in his son, who in turn works hard and expands the company.

title: Lotus Pool Offers Sound, Motion And Ultimate Relaxation
description: IF gardening is a joyful source of tranquility, then a garden pool must rank as the ultimate source of relaxation. There is a natural affinity that draws man to water, whether it's damming up rainspawned rivulets with the feet of childhood or walking along a stream or ocean beach.

title: The Thrill of Finding Your Own Name on a Budapest Street
description: More people than ever are making trips to find their roots, but I did it a little differently last summer. I had some of my roots presented to me by a tour guide without my even asking.

title: The Most Memorable Dolphins
description: Its 1979 season is yet to be played, but the National Football League al ready is assembling its 10 most memorable games of the 1970's. After being chosen by the Pro Foot ball Hall of Fame selectors, the games will be glorified next season in Pro! the program sold in N.F.L. stadiums. But the timing of the selection process is alarming. Judging by Commissioner Pete Rozelle's de cree not to wait for what happens in 1979, there apparently will be no memorable games next season. Equally shocking is that the list of 72 suggested games from N.F.L. head quarters omits the game that, in one man's opinion, was the decade's most memorable  the Miami Dol phins 147 victory over the Washing ton Redskins in Super Bowl VII to complete a 170 wonlost record, the only perfect season in N.F.L. history. tion process is alarming. Judging by Commissioner Pete Rozelle's de cree not to wait for what happens in 1979, there apparently will be no memorable games next season. Equally shocking is that the list of 72 suggested games from N.F.L. head quarters omits the game that, in one man's opinion, was the decade's most memorable  the Miami Dol phins' 147 victory over the Washing ton Redskins in Super Bowl VII to complete a 170 wonlost record, the only perfect season in N.F.L. history.

title: Robert Graves: The Lion in Winter
description: At the western end of the Mediterranean Sea lies the Spanish island of Mallorca (the tourist industry for some reason, prefers its alternative spelling of Majorca.) On the southwest coast of Mallorca stands the village of Dey, its scattered houses clinging to a steep semicircle of mountainside. Some half a mile out of Dey is a modestly sized house, not grand but comfortable and welltended, with a terraced garden stocked with flowers, vegetables and fruit trees, and a cool grotto that serves as a refuge from the blazing sun of summer: It is called Canelln. In the house sits an English poet who has been famous for more than 50 years.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Clark Banking On More Than Image
description: DICK CLARK, the television host, producer and  as of last week  manager of the troubled Westchester Theater, was asked recently what the 3,500seat Tarrytown music hall needed to turn it into a financial success. To serve the community. he said.

title: Sussex Is Resisting Metropolitan Status
description: WASHINGTON BECAUSE at least 6,000 residents of Sussex County, that wooded and rural haven in northwest New Jersey, coinmtrte to such urbanized areas as adjoining Morris County, Sussex now finds itself being identified by the Census Bureau as part of a metropolitan area.

title: Clockmaker To the World
description: WILTON

title: A Small Change, a Different Look
description: WITH scarcely a change in its basic structure, a 1940's Cape Cod house in Great Neck now has a different look. The big changes are inside and in back, where a Manhattan architect, Tod Williams, added a family room enveloped by the garden and lawn.

title: VOYAGER'S PROGENY
description: Two Voyagers were launched in 1977. The second will reach Jupiter this July and focus its attention on the moons of the planet before following Its twin to Saturn. One of the two Voyagers may be targeted for an encounter with Uranus later in the 1980's.

title: Moscow Days and Nights
description: THIS oddly ingratiating, oddly engrossing book about being an American in Moscow was written by a professor from California who, after doing studies of Conrad Alken, Nathanael West, Robert Lowell and Henry Miller, found himself transformed by the magic of international exchange into alecturer on American literature at Moscow State University. As might be expected, he sees his Moscow days and nights with something of the vision of Nathanael West, or rather, of Gogol. Less to be expected, he also found bawdiness worthy of Henry Miller and, in the current jargon, he shares his love affair(s) with us.

title: Red Wings 5, Kings 4
description: DETROIT, March 31 (AP)  Mike Murphy scored with 15 seconds to go as the Los Angeles Kings rallied to defeat the Detroit Red Wings, 54, tonight and clinch a playoff berth.

title: Hope Potter Bride on L.I.
description: In TrinitySt. John's Episcopal Church in Hewlett, L.I., yesterday afternoon, Hope Timpson Potter, daughter of Mrs. Andr O. Koehn and Lars S. Potter Jr., both of New York, became the bride of George Stedman Woodward 9th, son of Mrs. Woodward 3d of Cincinnati and the late Mr. Woodward. The Rev. Dr. Earle Pratt performed the ceremony. A reception was held at the Rockaway Hunting Club in Cedarburst, L.I.

title: Bruins 4, Capitals 1
description: LANDOVER, Md., March 31 (AP) Terry OReilly scored two goals in the second period to help the BostOn Bruins pull away from the Washington Capitals en route to a 41 victory tonight.

title: Patricia Cummings Engaged To Be Wed to G.R. Rossman
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward Cummings of Albany have made known the engagement of their daughter, Patricia M. Cummings, to Glenn R. Rossman, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Robert. Rossman of Massapequa Park, L.I.

title: Dallas to Dulles on the Concorde
description: The supersonic Concorde, once the plaything of highflying jet setters, has at last become a people's airplane.

title: Cross Is Burned Near Nightclub That Backed Fund for Black Boy
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 31 (AP)  A cross was burned last night outside nightclub that sponsored a fundraising dance for a 15yearold black youth sentenced to life for the shooting of a white dishwasher, the police said today.

title: IN THE NATION No Easy Answers
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.  Pumping 25 million tons of coal a year in a pipeline from the MontanaWyoming border to Houston, Tex., may sound like the kind of bigthink, cando project Americans need to break out of the energy crisis. In fact, this $1.8billion scheme more nearly suggests that there are no easy solutions to that crisis.

title: Bob Wesley Weds Iva Kugler
description: Iva Marcy Kugler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sol D. Kugler of Tenafly, N.J., was married yesterday to Bob E. Wesley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold B. Wesley of Fair Lawn, N.J. Rabbi Stanley Bramnick performed the ceremony at the Tower Suite. The couple are graduates of American University.

title: An Islamic Constitution Was Beine Drafted Last Week
description: TEHERAN, Iran  Clearly, the carefully lit space behind the desk of Deputy Prime Minister for Revolutionary ary Affairs Ibrahim Yazdi once held a portrait of Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, Shah of Shahs, Light of the Aryans; all such spaces did under the old regime.

title: Rowdies 2, Rogues 1
description: MEMPHIS, March 31 (AP)  Wes McLeod and Mirandinha scored a goal each in the first half tonight to give the Tampa Bay Rowdies a 21 victory over the Memphis Rogues.

title: At Health Fair the Wares Are Life
description: WHEN a car creaks and groans or fails to hug the road with assurance, the owner usually seeks the help of a mechanic. But when the human body does the same thing, sending out distress signals in many subtle ways, the owner is more likely than not to ignore the warning signs.

title: Gov. Brown and Rival Spar Over Nomination Of California Judges
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 31  Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. is expected to make 35 judicial appointments this weekend so he can go to New Hampshire without fear that Lieut. Gov. Mike Curb will make them.

title: PEOPLE
description: We Were a touch surprised, said a World Bank official, adding, but delighted. He was talking about the visit to the World Bank by the Soviet Ambassador to the United States. Anatoly F. Dobrynin made his first official visit to World Bank headquarters in Washington last week, at a reception for representatives of the Sovictbloc Comecon countries.

title: In Search of  the Vanishing Road Map
description: The free road map, long a takenforgranted symbol of service at gasoline stations throughout the United States, has virtually disappeared. If you need a map these days, it is likely that you will have to pay. And you are more likely to find what you need at a bookstore than where you fill up.

title: The Region
description: In his first 15 months in office, Mayor Koch has shaken the bureaucratic tree six times and six toplevel appointees have fallen out. In addition, three holdover appointees from the Beame Administration have been allowed to linger for a year or so and then resign. The Mayor would be the first to say that the shakedown has not been altogether smooth.

title: Marianne Klein, John Golieb, Law Students, Wed in Jersey
description: Marianne Sue Klein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Klein of South Orange, N.J., was married last night to John A. Golieb, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abner J. Golieb of Woodmere, L.I. Rabbi Alvin Marcus performed the ceremony at the Klein home.

title: 150 at Airport Seeking Flights to Coast for 99
description: BALTIMORE, March 31 (UPI) Nearly 150 people camped out today at BaltimoreWashington International Airport in hopes of obtaining 99cent and 69cent flights to Los Angeles and Dallas that leave Monday.

description: The marriage of Cindi Sherman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Sherman of Ridgewood, N.J., to Richard Korman took place yesterday at the Harmonie Club. description: The police reported that a stick of dynamite was found under a ramp on the Manhattan side of the Brooklyn Bridge early yesterday morning by a man who was walking his dog.

title: INVADERS IN UCANDA REPORTED REPELLED
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 31 (AP) Libyan troops fighting for President Idi Amin of Uganda have pushed Tanzanians and Ugandan exile invaders beyond artillery range of Kampala after three days of shelling, diplomatic sources said today. Radio Uganda said the enemy is in retreat.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Edwin M. Jones of Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Tina Jones, to Lee Will, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert S. Will of Bethesda, Md. The marriage is planned for June in Greenwich.

title: What They're Saying
description: Dave Cowens, playercoach of the Boston Celtics, who was told that John Y. Brown was considering selling his 50 percent ownership of the team: That's the best news I've heard all year.

title: When a Marriage Breaks Up: A Look at the fighter Side
description: A funny thing happened to one million American couples on their way through life last year. They got divorces.

title: The Art Lover
description: THE portrayal of Bernard Berenson found in most books is based almost entirely on the elderly connoisseur, the sage of I Tatti. Perhaps this is because Berenson's late years stretched over so long a period of time  he died in 1959 at the age of 94  or perhaps the traces of Berenson's youth were

title: 4 Arrested on White House Tour In an Antinuclear Demonstration
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI)  Secret Service agents arrested four men today for disrupting a White House tour by unfurling a banner in opposition to nuclear power.

title: Maple Leafs 6, North Stars 2
description: TORONTO, March 31 (UPI) Lanny MacDonald scored three goals tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs clinched a playoff spot with a 62 victory over the Minnesota North Stars.

title: Nehemiah Speeds Maryland to Victory
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., March 31 (AP)  Powerful Maryland, led by Renaldo Nehemiah and Dennis Ivory, won 12 of the 20 events and easily captured the team championship today in the University of Virginia invitation track meet.

title: President Is the Main Attraction For Day of Politics in Wisconsin
description: WAUSAU, Wis., March 31  The idea was born late last summer, and the campaign began last fall. The Wisconsin Democrats implored President Carter, beseeched Vice President Mondale, petitioned two Presidential aides, Hamilton Jordan and Tim Kraft, and pleaded with John White, the Democratic national chairman.

title: ART VIEW
description: CHICAGO The reopening of the Museum of Contemporary Art in Chicago is an event that casts an interesting light both on the dilemmas and ambitions of contemporary art and on the problems of museums that specialize in showing it. ale question that seems to hover in the air on this occasion is: What happens to the contemporary art museum when the art it is most intent upon showing us seems, because of its transitory of theatrical nature, to have entered a postmuseum phase of development?

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 31 (UPI) Vietnamese forces have begun a newof. fensive in Cambodia against the forces former Prime Minister Pol Pot, intelli. gence sources said here today.

title: How to Equate Injustices, Past And Present, And Be Fair?
description: WASHINGTON  Views differ on brow the Supreme. Court should decide the discrimination case brought by a Louisiana white man, but almost everybody hopes that the court will finally sort out the tangle that surrounds affirmative action programs.

title: Joyce Farley Bride Of Bruce Alspach, A Sales Engineer
description: Joyce Ann Farley and Bruce Edwards Alspach were married yesterday at SS. John and Paul Roman Catholic Church in Larchmont, N.Y., by the Rev. Joseph Piedmont.

description: BITTERNESS is growing in lower Fairfield County because the state's new downpayment loanassistance program  designed to provide young couples with the initial lump sum necessary for home ownership  is just not working out in the intended way.

title: The Most Awesome Achievement
description: THE recent unveiling of Cosima Wagner's diaries was accompanied by efforts to revive the myth of their centuryold inviolability. But Curt von Westernhagen, the author of this new life of Wagner, verifies that the complete manuscript had been entrusted to earlier

title: Sheila Nolan Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank W. Nolan Jr. of Essex Fells, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sheila M. Nolan, to Bernard C. O'Rourke, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clinton O'Rourke of Inniskeen, Dundalk, Ireland.

title: LETTERS
description: In Those Leading Indicators are Laggards, (February 11) Professor Leo Barnes makes two charges against the index of leading indicators prepared by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (B.E.A.): (1) that the weighting system used to value each of the component statistical series has ...masked the true twists and turns of the economy ... and (2) that .. the effective lead time of the index is too short for either business or Government to take suitable preventive economic action.

title: Favored Vencedor Scores at Aqueduct
description: Armando Cosme's favored Vencedor, the outstanding handicap performer of Aqueduct's winter meeting, opened his spring campaign impressively yesterday as he captured the $55,100 Westchester Handicap before crowd of 20,919.

title: Article 6 -- No Title
description: Governor of Kentucky. The only question is whether my offer is acceptable, and I think it's a fair one. I don't think there will be any problem.

title: Thais Vote Tough Narcotics Bill
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 30 (UPI)  The National Assembly unanimously adopted an antinarcotics law yesterday that authorizes the death penalty for convicted drug dealers.

title: For Israel: Rosy Visions Of Making the Deserts Bloom
description: JERUSALEM  President Carter, in persuading Egypt and Israel to conclude a peace treaty, reportedly emphasized that normal relations between the two countries would pave the road toward fruitful economic cooperation.

title: Idaho Lab Simulates Conditions at Nuclear Facility
description: IDAHO FALLS, Idaho, March 31 While officials in Pennsylvania labored over the Three Mile Island disaster, a group of Idaho scientists were working at the Idaho National Engineering Laboratory throughout last night and this morning simulating the conditions at Three Mile Island on a scale model reactor system in an effort to find a solution to the problem.

title: Music: Debuts in. Review
description: Rimma Sushanskaya, heard last Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, is a Soviettrained violinist who came to this country about a year ago. She is a graduate of the Leningrad Conservatory, and currently teaches at the Mannes College.

title: Utilities Offer a Legal Challenge To Connecticut's TaxRelief Plan
description: NEW HAVEN, March 30  A homeowners relief program that phases in propertytax increases over five years to cushion the impact of property revaluation has run into a concerted legal challenge from major Connecticut utilities.

title: WASHINGTON Fool In The News
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  It has long been suspected that the April Fool was not a mythological character but an actual person who lived in Washington and was indeed responsible for much of the foolishness that goes on here. But until now nobody has been able to find and interview him.

title: HIGHLIGHTS
description: Store wars break out in Canada ... Victor Posner and the Hunts defeated in separate encounters ... sale of Bankers Trust branch banks called off ... a possible suitor for Bache. This was some of the action last week as the mergers and acquisitions pot bubbled over.

title: Upward, Onward With Oil Prices
description: Fear over oil price increases last week reached such proportions that when the producer nations finally agreed on a 9 percent rise, the first response was a masochistic tendency to ask: Is that all?

title: Jon Gibson Offers Saxophone Recital
description: Jon Gibson's solo saxophone concert at the Paula Cooper Gallery on Friday night  there was a second perform ance last night  was simplicity itself. Using a sharply restricted number of pitches, rarely straying from an austerely lovely timbre, and following a series of carefully worked out permutative processes, Mr. Gibson, who has been a member of the Philip Glass Ensemble since its beginnings, demonstrated again that his musical approach and sense of discipline are wholly his own.

title: The Last, Vain Hope of Peace
description: THE Munich Conference of September 1938, which Britain and France allowed Hitler to occupy the Germanspeaking areas of Czechoslovakia, aroused more controversy among contemporaries and has attracted more attention among histo-

title: Home Alarm Use Still on the Rise In New York City
description: When Joanne Schechter went house hunting in Queens recently, she got an advance look at what it's like to be burelarized.

title: Jane Celeste Patrick Wed To William T. Stuchell 3d
description: Jane Celeste Patrick, a staff assistant on the Senate Subcommittee on Health and Scientific Research, was married yesterday to William Torrence Stuchell 3d, a sales representative in the Tex Tan Welhausen leather products divison of the Tandy Corporation. The Rev. Richard V. Landis performed the ceremony in St. Anne's Episcopal Church, in Annapolis, Md., where the couple will live.

title: The Imagery  of Wines
description: people, emotions, placesthe memories of things longforgotten can be evoked by wine. And wines can elic. it special feelings.

title: Wife of Slain Polygamist Granted Divorce From Her Legal Husband
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 31 (AP) Shirley Black, one of two wives of a slain polygamist, John Singer, has been granted a divorce from her leBal.husband, Dean Black, but has ben denied custody of the three children ,who .once lived on the Singer farm, her attorney says.

title: CONNECTICUT JOURNAL
description: ONE of the few points on which Mayor William A. Collins of Norwalk is in agreement with his predecessor, Jennie F. Cave, is an effort to discharge William R. Guarnieri, the city's enduring building inspector. Mayors come and go, but Mr. Guarnieri, like his father before him, has an absolute hold, so far at least, on the department that passes on construction in the city.

title: Where to Find Tasteful Statuary
description: SAY garden ornaments, and pink flamingoes may fly to mind. But even companies that sell plastic, wildlife often carry a few pieces of tasteful statuary.

title: Bill for Taking Abused Children From Parents Is Voted in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 30  A bill that would allow courts to take children permanently away from parents who abused them was approved overwhelmingly by the State Senate this week.

title: Nevada Test Site Experts Head For Stricken Pennsylvania Plant
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., March 31 (AP) Communications experts from the Nevada Test Site left here today for Pennsylvania to lend assistance in the crisis at the Three Mile Island nuclear plant.

title: A Dancing Playboy Is Coming From Dublin
description: John Millington Synge's The Playboy of the Western World is the most celebrated of Irish plays, the Chieftains are the most celebrated of Irish folkmusic groups, and although the Irish Ballet Company is too young to be celebrated, it is attaining that status within Ireland's shore north and south of the political divide. For play, musicians and dancers to come together in a stage presentation is an event of interest. It casts its appeal net wide, and in Ireland, at any rate, the catch of wildly enthusiastic partisans has been huge. The dance version of The Playboy was the runaway artistic and boxoffice success of the last Dublin Theater Festival. New York can give its verdict when the production opens for a limited run at the City Center on Wednesday, following a preview on Tuesday.

title: Suffolk: Keep the Status Quo
description: THE prospect is tempting. After its most recent term, a particularly vexing two years, opposition to the Suffolk County Legislature is swelling. The current comes from disgust, from political and financial considerations and even from a genuine belief that a return to yesteryear and a Board of Supervisors is the remedy.

title: The Existential Dane
description: SOREN is not as common a name in Denmark as the surname Sorenson. The reason is simple. One bearer of the given name became so notorious, so public a caricature of the sarcastic, the conceited, the precocious, the downright obnoxious that Danish

title: New Campaign Is Begun To Cut California Taxes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 31  Almost as. quietly as the fog crawls through the Golden Gate, the next round has opened in the battle over California's tax structure.

title: Bruce Bean to Wed Barbara B. Hunting
description: Barbara Bryant Hunting, an associate with the New York law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, and Bruce W. Bean, an associate with Patterson, Belknap, Webb & Tyler, New York lawyers, will be married May 13.

title: ACID GENERAL IS KEY IN PRETORIA SCANDAL
description: TWEEFONTEIN, South Africa  Do you want to talk about farming? If not, get away from here?

title: ABOUT CARS
description: WHILE the price of gasoline rushes toward $1 a gallon, the 55mileanhour speed limit, which was designed to save fuel, continues to be honored in the breach, according to enforcement officials. And for many drivers, the chief accomplice is a radar detector.

title: Signs: ThisWay To a Dispute
description: IF you travel on the Island's park ways, you may think your eyes are deceiving you when you glance at the signs that dot the roadway. But the fact is that the signs are getting Smaller. And if the State Department of Transportation has its way, those signs will continue to shrink over the next few years.

title: Physical Fitness As a Fringe Benefit
description: EVERY Sunday morning Peggy and John Feeley of Rye put on their running shoes and head out for a jog through the comfortable byways of their town. There's nothing too unusual about a husband and wife running together these days except that the Feeleys also run together on weekdays during working hours. In fact, they learned to run together at the General Foods Corporation in White Plains, where they work.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The attack on hunting  or the management of game species for hunting continues.

title: Editors' Choice
description: ALBERT CAMUS, by Herbert R. Lottman. (Doubleday, $16.95.) This first biography of a French writer who was more a cult than a man offers all the facts but renders no Judgments.

title: Accident Has Brought No Cutoff Of Power Supply in Plant's Area
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 31  The malfunction of the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant has not left homes and businesses in the area without power.

title: Concern Rises in South Carolina, Home of Many Nuclear Reactors
description: GREENVILLE, S.C., March 31  The wave of alarm rippling outward from the crippled Three Mile Island nuclear power station in Pennsylvania is generating special concern here in South Carolina, the home of the greatest concentration of nuclear generating facilities in the nation and the locus of three of the seven other Babcock & Wilcox reactors to be investieated for flaws.

title: Manila and Jakarta Offer Transit Plan for Refugees
description: MANILA, March 31 Along the coast of Malaysia, policemen and village officials are turning Vietnamese boat People back out to sea, telling them that certain islands of Indonesia and the Philippines will welcome them for transit and resettlement in the United States, France, Australia, Canada and other nations.

title: Events Today
description: Stamp and Coin Roundup: Exhibition and coliectiohs; A.M. to 5 P.M.; American Legion Hall, Greenwich Street and Marvin Avenue, Hempstead, L.I.

title: Collectors Of All That Glitters
description: WHENEVER I see a new highway being built or a little dirt tossed around a site, I always take the time to look, Harold Uhlin says. You can never tell what you might find of interest.

title: Basil Can Be Grown Indoors or Out
description: While many herbs are slow to start from seed, basil germinates easily. It can be grown indoors or out. The many varieties offer wide range of plant and leaf sizes and color and even , an assortment of aromas. Kept pinched back, the basils form a handsome summertime hedge or border.

title: Jersey Hospitals. Begin a Plan to Cut Energy Costs
description: NEWARK, March 30New Jersey's hospitals have begun a program designed to trim up to $8 million from their energy costs.

title: WESTCHESTER GUIDE
description: La Morte di Orlando by Aripso, the Italian Renaissance poet, takes on new. meaning when performed by fourfoothigh, 85pound puppets in armor. The eight remaining puppets crafted in 1903 by Sabastiano Cappala, the master puppeteer of Sicily, were rescued from oblivion 20 years ago when Jim Weil and Sal Macri of Stony Brook, Conn., joined forced on a visit to Italy and bought them.

title: A Onetime Teacher Stakes His Future On Hot Air
description: MOST people prefer to find hot air in a sauna, a greenhouse or on a tropical isle. Not balloonists. They want all they can get so they can soar majestically over trees, buildings and hills. You might say balloonists look down on conventional things.

title: Beauford Delaney, Painter, Dies; Portraitist of the Famous Was 77
description: Beauford Delaney, an American painter whose life appeared to symbolize the mythical artistic existence of privation and relative obscurity, and whose talent and free, open and outgoing nature engendered admiration from Henry Miller, James Jones, Georgia O'Keeffe, Darthea Speyer and his protg James Baldwin, died last Monday in St. Anne's Hospital in Paris. Mr. Delaney was 77 years old. He had been mentally ill for several years and had lived in France since 1953.

title: City Enjoys a Brain DrainFrom Ford Foundation
description: In New York, the generally accepted way to get an important job in city government was to join a political club, work in campaigns and hope a crumb of patronage would fall off the table. In the Koch Administration, the way to a job appears to be to work for the Ford Foundation, the richest foundation in the country, whose atrium headquarters on East 43d Street has replaced the clubhouse as the route to high places in city government.

title: The Seeds Of Friendship
description: THERE are three children in this family. If they were to confront a spiderweb in the community garden I belong to, each child would react differently. The first child would examine the web and wonder how the spider wove it. The second child would worry a great deal about where the spider was at that particular moment. But the third child would exclaim, as in fact he did one afternoon, Oh, look! A trampoline. One reality, three dimensions. True for the spiderweb, true for the garden.

title: Engagements
description: CASEYDISCH

title: Some New Rules for Growing a Better Corn Patch
description: The major problem in growing sweet corn in the home garden Is enough space. According to professional corn producers, it should be planted in blocks large enough for good pollination.

title: TV VIEW
description: Nathaniel Hawthorne, like most serious writers, had a gift for evoking what literary scholars often describe as the presentness of the past. Most television, however, concentrates on the vacuum of the present, frantically seeking out the trendy and the instantly salable. The past is

title: Jones Coming Home For Fight at Forum
description: At the time, the 1972 United States Olympic boxing coach predicted that the best American heavyweight from that class would be the kid who won the 1971 and 1972 New York Golden Gloves championships, Leroy Jones of Brooklyn.

title: At Home: Soothing a Writer, Age 7
description: WHAT do I tell him? my friend asked. His 7yearold son was not represented in the school magazine. He's been writing for three years, and I've always told him his stories were good.

title: Can Children's TV Workshop Recapture Its Youth?
description: After several years of producing poorly received adult programs, the Children's Television Workshop (CTW) returns tonight to the sort of entertainment that first brought it fame. At P.M., CBS will broadcast the initial dour of the workshop's twopart special, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, adapted from the first book of C.S. Lewis's The Chronicles of Narnia. After a cliffhanger ending, the concluding hour will be broadcast tomorrow night at the same hour. The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, the workshop's first fulllength animatedcartoon feature, marks a shift in direction for the decadeold company, which is finally facing up to the basic question of its survival: Can a nonprofit TV production company committed to high quality programming become selfsustaining in a world dedicated to commerce?

title: Zoning by Theoretical Lot Sizes...
description: Developers who are converting a 15story, former Young Women's Christian Association facility at 840 Eighth Avenue into a subsidized housing project for the elderly received permits from the Buildings Department last year for 635 rooms.

title: Who Pays for Government Services?
description: ARECENT article in The New York Times called the political movement taking place in our Federal system a tug of war.

title: DINING OUT
description: SATURDAY may be the most popular night for dining out but it's not considered the best. La Viola in Cedarhurst is no exception to that rule. There, on Saturday nights, the, management simply chooses not to make the same culinary effort as during the week, limiting the menu and charging, higher prices. Apparently tables will be taken no matter what.

title: ART Diversity Shines in Graphics Exhibitions
description: PRINTS are making a splash on the Island, with all the color and variety of a spring bouquet. Two outstanding shows, both continuing through the end of April, amply. illustrate that printmaking is an important mode of expression for area artists.

title: Georgetown Is Victor
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., March 31 (AP)The Georgetown women's varsity eight took an early lead and then held off Navy to win by one length in a regatta today on the Severn River. It was the first varsity race for a Navy women's crew.

title: Letters
description: First the good news: Corporate profits are up!

title: Cupano, Tadej Triumph
description: Sam Cupano of Little Ferry, N.J., and his partner, John TadeJ of Carteret, N.J., won the New York City regional dart tournament of the fifth annual national darts championship yesterday.

title: White House Rents Automobiles With Small Engines to Save Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI) The White House, trying to conform to President Carter's orders to save energy, is leasing 28 automobiles with smaller engines and greater fuel efficiency than those used previously, officials have announced.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Dances by Linda Tarnay
description: Linda Tarnay is a long, lanky dancer with a sunny stage presence. She tends to make pieces with long, flowing Imes and understated attack. If that made for an evening of rather softedged dance on Friday, when Linda Tarnay and Dancers presented a program of old and new works at the New York University School of the Arts Theater, it was still intelligently crafted work, danced by nine personable young dancers.

title: Challenging the Myths Of National Security
description: National security is a modern Mean. cation. As in any incantation the words have both power and mystery. In the name of national security, all things can be threatened. All risks can be taken. All sacrifices can be demanded. Breakins, wiretaps, deception of Congress, assassination attempts on foreign leaders  indeed, the Watergate coverup and the intervention in Vietnam  were all ordered in the name of national security.

title: AIR FOUND NORMAL IN MEW YORK TESTS,
description: With southwest winds crossing central Petnsylvania and blowing toward central New York yesterday, New York State officials were closely monitoring air samples for radiation. But tests. conducted Saturday showed that no excess radiation had reached New York from the nuclear power plant accident in central Pennsylvania.

title: Julia Parsons to Be Wed July 14
description: Mrs. John W. Soper of Old Saybrook, Conn, and Geddes Parsons of Roxbury, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Julia Geddes Parsons, to Mark Gregory Gengras, son of Mr. and Mrs. E. Clayton Gengras of West Hartford, Conn., and Indian Creek, Fla.

title: A Hong Kong-China Power Swap
description: HONG KONG, March 31 (UPI)  Hong Kong's China Light and Power Co. began delivering electricity today to adjoining Guangdong Province in China. Under an agreement signed Thursday, Hong Kong will supply about 50 megawatts of power a day to the neighboring province, of which Canton is the capital. China in turn will ship coal to Hong Kong.

title: NAVIGATORS WHO PROBE THE MYSTERIES OF DEEP SPACE
description: BEYOND JUPITERDespite the success of Voyager thus far, the Jet Propulsion lab is still struggling to obtain funding from Congress for future interplanetary missions.

title: A Nuclear Plane Crash Scheduled for MidApril
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI) Sometime in the next few weeks, Neva. da's Nellis Air Force Base will receive Mayday involving an impending nuclear peril  a message that a jet transport with six nuclear weapons aboard about to crash.

title: Harmony Is the Added Ingredient
description: MANY homeowners find it hard to trade upward in today's market as skyrocketing real estate costs shoot their castlesintheair down to earth. And when that happens, a backyard addition suddenly seems more attractive than the enviable house next door.

title: Bakhtiar Is in France, Envoy for Giscard Says
description: CLERMONTFERRAND, France, March 31 (AP)  Shahpur Bakhtiar, the Shah of Iran's last Prime Minister, who is being sought for trial by the Islamic revolutionary regime, is living 220 miles east of this central French town, a Government official says.

title: A Calm Returns to Middletown, But Some Continue to Lie Low
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., March 31 One of those huge Pennsylvania Dutch barns sits by the side of the road that leads to the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant, and on ,a hill next to that masterly piece of rural architecture, an artist labored this afternoon, catching the angles and spheres and the hint of green that is just coming to the Susquehanna Valley.

title: Chain Reactions
description: WASHINGTON  Twentyfive years ago, a group of American scientists, engineers and leaders in the political and business worlds joined in a dream: they would harness the energy of the atom to provide the world what they predicted would be a nearly endless source of cheap electricity.

title: Best Sellers
description: FICTION

title: Some Firsts for the Philadelphia Orchestra
description: One of the more immutable institutions of the concert world, it sometimes appears, is Eugene Ormandy and the Philadelphia Orchestra  they have been together so long, 43 years to be exact, that it is difficult to think of one without the other. In this day and age of jetpropelled conductors holding down any number of permanent associations simultaneously, often on different continents, Mr. Ormandy's singleminded devotion to his orchestra is almost unique. The only parallel that comes to mind is Herbert von Karajan's similar long association with the Berlin Philharmonic.

title: Schomburg Unit Listed as Landmark
description: Crippled by time, use and fiscal crises, the 74yearold building that houses the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture will be formally certified at ceremonies in Harlem today as having national historical and architectural significance with being listed in the National Register of Historic Places.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: A few points made by Michael Librach in his March 4 letter deserve a response. Mr. Librach, the treasurer of the Pleasantville Music Theater, stated that all over the county, community theater groups are dying for lack of funds, and that the groups he is associated with are desperately searching for funds to Just barely stay alive. While it is true that the financial condition of all arts organizations  in Westchester and nationwide  is a desperate one, I am not aware of any Westchester community theater that has ceased to exist for lack of funds.

title: Low Down Payments Do Exist
description: IF it weren't for his F.H.A.insured mortgage, said Eric Etheart, a Freeport homeowner, he and his wife Rene would still be living in an apartment, watching their dream of homeownership slipping further and further away.

title: CHESS
description: When I was preparing for the Interzonal Tournament in 1976, my second, Grandmaster Pal Benko, told me: Don't worry if you come up with an opening innovation that's not really as strong as it looks. Just the fact that it is new and playable already gives you the advantage.

title: Alydar Wins by 7 Lengths
description: MIAMI, March 31 (AP)  Alydar, obviously completely recovered from a broken foot bone suffered last August, galloped to a sevenlength victory in Hialeah's fifth race today in his 1979 debut.

title: Mailbox: A Penn Rooter Replies
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: ExExpatriate Finds Strife Is Everywhere
description: SEVEN years ago, Charles Lang, disgusted with the Vietnam war and the temper of the country under Richard M. Nixon's Administration, sold his house in rural Stanton, packed his belongings and moved his family to a whaling village in the Azores.

title: Page Hufty to Be a Bride May 19
description: Page Lee Hufty, an underwriting member of Llgyd's. of London, and Benjamin Howell Griswold 9th, a general partner and member of the executive committee of Alexander Brown & Sons, Baltimore investment bankers, will be married May 19.

title: Singer to Attend Amtrak Rally
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI) Arlo Guthrie, the folk singer, plans to ride the endangered Montrealer train to Washington Tuesday to sing about the disappearing railroad blues at a rally to protest plans to drastically reduce Amtrak service. The demonstration against the Department of Transportation's proposal is being sponsored by a group called Friends of the Railroad.

title: Israeli Arabs Ga th er for Ann ual Land Day in Galilee to Express Heightened Militancy
description: DEIR HANNA, Israel, March 30  A caravan of automobiles, tractors and pickup trucks rumbled through the lush, quiet farm valleys of the Galilee and up a narrow road leading to this Israeli Arab village.

title: Hitting Stressed in Bid to Leave Last Place
description: The New York Mets will open Year Two of their new era on Thursday with four starting pitchers who won a combined total of 24 games last summer  one game fewer than Ron Guidry won for the Yankees. This is the second phase of the new era, says Manager Joe Torre, a 38yearold optimist from Brooklyn. The goal is more consistency, and that's something you accomplish in stages. To become more consistent than the Mets of recent years does not seem too burdensome a goal. After finishing third in the sixteam Eastern Division of the National League for three straight seasons, they hit bottom in 1977 with 64 victories and 98 defeats. Then in 1978, they improved by two games, won 66, lost 96, and again finished last.

title: Anthony Takes Long Island Open Bowling
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I. March 31  Although Earl Anthony has won more tournaments and more money than any competitor in the history of the Professional Bowlers Association tour, his $8,000 victory in the $70,000 Long Island open the Garden City Bowl today amounted to a comeback for the 40yearold lefthander from Tacoma, Wash.

title: ANTIQUES
description: Loe Fuller, the toast of Paris in the 1890's, a teacher of Isadora Duncan and idol of dozens of artists, is now known better for her effect on others  including Henri de ToulouseLautrec and William Butler Yeats than on the history of the dance.

title: Pulling the Nuclear Plug
description: HARTFORD MILLIONS of consumers are paying more for electricity and facing stiffer competition for scarce oil this spring following the unexpected closing two and a half weeks ago of five atomic power plants because of concern over design calculations in key parts. Although other states face most of the burden, it is in Connecticut that the implications of such unprecedented closings cause the deepest shivers, because this state is the most heavily dependent in the nation on nuclear power, and it plans to become even more so.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: WHILE the price of gasoline rushes toward $1 a gallon, the 55mileanhour speed limit, which was designed to save fuel, continues to be honored in the breach, according to enforcement officials. And for many drivers, the chief accomplice is a radar detector.

title: Criminal Use of Fraudulent Driver's Licenses Reported to Be Rising
description: When Los Angeles police arrested a 33yearold woman last month on charges that she swindled the county of more than $48,500 in welfare payments, they found that she had used eight falsified driver's licenses over five years.

title: Record Set in Hammer Throw
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., March 31 (UPI)  Richard Olsen of the University of TexasEl Paso broke a meet record in the hammer throw today to win the KearneyRayburn trophy as the outstanding athlete in the annual Florida Relays.

title: The Filming Of Nijinsky
description: In the gilt and marble splendor of Budapest Opera House, a lone male dancer in headband and rehearsal tights practices at a barre to the side of the stage. Through the empty stalls a slight young girl cautiously walks to the stage and calls, in a tremulous voice, Mr. Nijinsky?

title: Passengers of Burned Liner Board Ships for San Juan
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I., March 31  As the cruise ship Carla C pulled away early this morning from the raging dockside fire aboard the adjacent Italian liner Angelina Lauro, her loudspeaker repeatedly warned the passengers watching on deck: Do not panic. Do not panic.

title: New Breed of Mountie Patrols Canada's Northland
description: STRIKERS PASS, Yukon Territory  Sergeant Preston of the Yukon is dead.

title: Hugh MacCraig, 86, Astrologer and Writer Of 2 Reference Books
description: Hugh MacCraig, a leading astrologer and author of reference books widely used by colleagues for the last three de. cades, died last Sunday of a massive heart attack in his home at the Lancaster Hotel on Madison Avenue at 38th Street. He was 86 years old.

title: Bucks Down Bulls, 10899, As Johnson, Winters Star
description: CHICAGO, March 31 (AP) Marques Johnson scored 26 points and Brian Winters added 17 to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 10899 victory over the Chicago Bulls tonight.

title: Wide Range of Courses Offered
description: STAGGERED by the high expense of fixing up a home, the shortage of available skilled labor, atld the everescalating cost of heating and cooling homes, thousands of New Jersey homeowners elect to take matters into their own hands, starting by taking basic courses in carpentry, home insulation, energy conservation, and even outdoor landscaping and gardening.

title: James Mason  Puts His Faith In a Broadway Play
description: BOSTON

title: FOOD
description: LAST December, instead of thinking about Hanukkah, Simi Rosenberg began planning for Passover. Mrs. Rosenberg is president of the Nassau region of Hadassah, the women's Zionist organization, and when she heard that Bloomingdale's in Garden City would be presenting an Israeli promotion in the spring, she offered her organization's help.

title: Government Tightens Price Guidelines
description: The Carter Administration tightened voluntary guidelines for price increases last week, introducing its first requirement for periodic reporting by corporations.

title: Easy to Grow, Colorful Gourds Are Decorative  and Useful
description: GOURDS are afterthought plants. If people grow them at all, it's usually because they pick up one of the garden center's colorful seed packs at the last minute. Then the seeds are stuck in at the edge of the vegetable patch  or just as often forgotten because there's no room left in the garden. Now I'm not suggesting you plan to make gourds major crop. But if you haven't been growing them, consider what you've been missing.

title: Lerner and Lane Make Music Again
description: There is nothing scandalous about this revelation, but Carmelina, the new musical due to open next Sunday at the St. James Theater. with Georgia Brown and Cesare Siepi, was involved in a Watergate collaboration in recent weeks.

title: Martha Swope
description: BIG AND LITTLEBarbara Barrie and Janni Brenn are in Botho Strauss's play. The Phoenix production opens tomorrow at Marymount Manhattan.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: WHILE the price of gasoline rushes toward $1 a gallon, the 55mileanhour speed limit, which was designed to save fuel, continues to be honored the breach, according to enforcement officials. And for many drivers, the chief accomplice is a radar detector.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: WHILE the price of gasoline rushes toward $1 a gallon, the 55mileanhour speed limit, which was designed to save fuel, continues to be honored in the breach, according to enforcement officials. And for many drivers, the chief accomplice is a radar detector.

title: The Last Time I Saw Paris... It Was in Rockville Centre
description: IKNOW it may sound funny, but in a time when everybody tries to get back to his own roots  be it across the Atlantic or up in the Bronx  I have to say that I really got back to my French roots by moving to Lone Island.

title: Americans in the Severn
description: Are you going to take a pilot?

title: G.O.P. in Suffolk Girds as Threats Of Scandal Mount
description: FACED with one of the most serious threats of scandal and turmoil in two decades, the troubled Suffolk Republican organization is trying to close ranks and confront headon the latest allegations of political favoritism and payoffs in the South West Sewer District.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Today, with the older and middle generations obsession with ballet's classics and the younger generation's predilection for works more involved with the attitudes of our time, there doesn't seem much room for the oneact ballet created by Fokine and Massine, which virtually set the seal on the whole of ballet in this century. So wrote Peter Williams, one of Britain's most respected critics and the editor of Dance and Dancer, when the Royal Ballet revived Leonide Massine's La Boutique Fantasque and Mam'zelle Angot in 1968. His article was titled The Case for Massine and concluded: Massine was a great innovator, a great man of the dance in the theater and as such, his works should be preserved in the repertories of companies with the machinery for preservation.

title: Britons on the Sound
description: Never mind, I consoled my wife, if the worst comes to worst, and we cannot manage the boat we can always use it as a bungalow and sit on board, and watch the world go by.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: The author is Lucian K. Truscott 4th. The book is Dress Gray, one of the most successful first novels of the season. Had it been written as originally conceived, it would have been a work of nonfiction and all its jackpot winnings bookclub, movie and paperback rights  probably would not have happened in such a big way.

title: Ground Down by U.S. Schools
description: WASHINGTON  Why do intelligent and competent Americans who have spent many years in a series of reputable educational institutions often appear to English people to be fundamentally uneducated?

title: Jamie Hunziker Bride of William W. Garner
description: In the Episcopal Church of the Heayenly Rest yesterday, Jamie Lauren Hunziker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick L. Hunziker of Livingston, N.J., was married to William Wesley Garner, son of Mr. and Mrs, Wesley H. Garner of De ere, Wis. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Seymour St. John, former headmaster of the Choate School, of which the bridegroom is an alumnus.

title: LETTER TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: In a recent Opinion Page article, Paul M. Roth, president of Local 1049, Retail Clerks Union, A.F.L.C.I.O., questioned the lack of labor education in the history curriculum of our high schools and colleges. We agree that the history of organized labor, not unlike the history of the black people, women, Indians and other ethnics, has been woefully shortchanged in the textbooks of our learning institutions.

title: Environmental Camps Set for Youngsters
description: More than 1,900 young people in New York State will have the opportunity of studying the environment at four education camps to be sponsored by the state's Department of Environmental Conservation in July and August.

title: Boys of Summer Return
description: From the new grass in Candlestick Park to the new carpet in Riverfront Stadium, regardless of Jim Palmer's aching back and Carlton Fisk's aching elbow, the baseball season opens Wednesday on the earliest date in major league history.

title: Singing Act Has a Man, Female Trio
description: Desmond Child and Rouge, who were at the Bottom Line on Wednesday night, have developed an act that is shamelessly conimercial and utterly contemporary. Mr. Child, who plays guitar and keyboards, writes most of the material and takes some of the lead vocals, is boyishly handsome and has a light, teenidol sort of voice. Rouge consists of Maria Vidal, Myriam Valle and Diana Grasselli, who sing and mug and act like sexy street urchins.

title: A Legal Dilemma For the Indigent
description: DO YOU know these people? The neighbor who lost his pension, the woman whose husband abandoned her with two children and without any support, the friend who was unfairly discharged and cannot get unemployment benefits, the family on public assistance that has been evicted, the wife, with no personal assets, who seeks a divorce after her 20year marriage has been shattered.

title: If Disco Seems Dull, Try a Little Theatrics
description: LEVITTOWN

title: Nigerian Flies Here to Join Search for His Brother
description: Very late on a bitterly cold Sunday night, Umar Hayutubeen, a 21yearofd exchange student from Nigeria, waved goodbye to a friend with whom he had atparty, stepped into the West 72d Street IRT subway station in Manhattan and vanished.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: If you've had a rude awakening lately, chances are that youown a burglar alarm system. While there is no denying its protective vale (we would not be without one), every securityminded family I know has a horror story to tell about the earsplitting mechanism going off in the middle of the night  catapulting the dazed household out of bed and into a frenzy.

title: Diane Norfleet To Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry F. Ayres Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Ayres's daughter, Diane Norwood Norfleet, toNicolas I. Quintana, son of Edith Seyburn Quintana of New York and Palm Beach, Fla., and Manuel I. Quintana of Buenos Aires.

title: A Feminist Sculptures Dinner Party
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 31When the feminist artist Judy Chicago embarked on an ambitious project five years ago to celebrate women, she decided to embrace women from all time. She invited them all, from Sappho and the primordial goddess Gaea to Susan B. Anthony and Georgia O'Keeffe, to a Dinner Party.

title: Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY  In the Feb. 27 primary here, Bruce R. Watkins, a black City Councilman, squeaked into the runoff for mayor with 23,853 votes, of which 17,400 came from the city's six predominantly black wards.

title: Diane de Cillis Becomes Bride Of Bruce Firkins of Citibank
description: Diane de Cillis, a marketing manager with Este Lauder Inc. in New York, was married yesterday to Bruce W. Firkins, a manager in the consumerservice group of Citibank. The ceremony was performed in St. Catherine's of Siena Roman Catholic Church in Riverside, Conn., by Msgr. Vincent E. Puma. He was assisted by the Rev. Dr. Bernard R. Brunsting of the Reformed Church in America.

title: BIKINIANS MAY MOVE FOR THE THIRD TINE
description: HONOLULU, March 31 (AP)  The people of Bikini Island, forced to move twice from their native land because of radioactivity, may be packing their bags once again.

title: THEATER
description: STAMFORD

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: OFFICER, I want to report a crime. Over 100 people have disappeared in my town in the last few years, vanished without a trace. I don't know their names, but we spent so much time together waiting for space at the town tennis courts, I'm sure I could pick out their faces from any missingpersons file.

title: Stuart Weisberg Fianc Of Elizabeth J. Krucoff
description: Dr. and Mrs. Morris Krucoff of Washington have announced, the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Jane Krucoff, to Stuart Elliot Weisberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Weisberg of Brooklyn.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Miss Hutton, Robert Felch Marry in Rye
description: Marianne Daniel Hutton, a Decembey graduate of Sweet Briar College, was married yesterday in Rye,. N.Y., to Robert Dean Fetch, an underwriter with Chubb & Son in Detroit. The Rev. Stanley Johnson, chaplain at the University of Pennsylvania, performed the ceremony in Christ's Episcopal Church.

title: Of Puppies and Love, But Not Puppy Love
description: THIS is a shaggydog story. It raises certain shaggy questions about love, responsibility, guilt and the sanctity of canine and/or human life.

title: Rubstic, at 261, Captures Grand National
description: LIVERPOOL, England, March 31 (AP) Rubstic became the first Scottishtrained horse to win the Grand National steeplechase when he beat Zongalero and Rough and Tumble in a stretch battle at nearby Aintree today.

title: Step by Step Toward Full Relations
description: The historic EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty signed at the White House on Monday March 26 sets up a timetable for phased Israeli withdrawal from the Sinai Peninsula and for establishment of full relations between the two countries. Together with clarifying annexes, agreed minutes and letters to President Carter from President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel, it will take effect when ratification documents are exchanged. The Israeli Knesset has already ratified the treaty, and action by Egypt's Parliament is expected early this month.

title: STAMPS
description: Octave Chanute, one of the foremost aviation pioneers at the turn of the century, and a major contributing influence to the Wright brothers success in achieving the world's first powered flight, has been honored by the United States with a pair of justissued 21cent airmail stamps.

title: Donald Kilpatrick And Karen Lavine Plan August Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward L. Lavine of Waban, Mass., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Karen S. Lavine, to Donald Gray Kilpatrick, son of Geoffrey MacBride Kilpatrick of Branchville, N.J., and the late Charlotte Gray Kilpatrick.

title: Clash Over a Nomination
description: GOVERNOR GRASSO'S nomination to the State Board of Education of Eva Hudak, a 62year old Torrington bail commissioner who dropped out of school when she was 19 during the Depression and who recently passed a highschool equivalency test, has created what

title: Lebanon Camp Reported Shelled
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 31 (Reuters)  A Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon was shelled by Lebanese rightwing militiamen and Israelis today, the Palestinian press agency WAFA reported. A spokesman for the joint Palestinianleftist command also reported intensive Israeli naval movements along the southern coast of Lebanon.

title: Hawkes and Barth Talk About Fiction
description: The following discussion took place before 500 people on November 2, 1978, during a Fiction Festival the University of Cincinnati. The Festival, which also included John Gardner, William H. Gass, Stanley Elkin and Tillie Olsen, was partially financed by the National Endowment for the Arts. The discussion was edited by Thomas LeClair, who teaches English at the University of Cincinnati. John Barth's most recent book is Chimera, and a new novel, Letters, will be published in the fall. John Hawkes's most recent novel is Travesty, and his new novel, The Passion Artist, will be published in the fall.

title: S.F. Burson Fianc Of Wendy Liebow
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Ely M. Liebow of Highland Park, Ill., of the engagement of their daughter, Wendy Faith Liebow, to Scott Foster Burson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Burson of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: ART
description: PURCHASE

title: Elizabeth Bradshaw Wed To Lee A. Patterson 2d
description: Elizabeth Scott Bradshaw and Lee Austin Patterson 2d were married yesterday afternoon at St. Stephen's Episcopal Church in Durham, N.C., by the Rev. Josh T. MacKenzie and the Rev. Warren Carr.

title: Her Heart Belonged to Mother
description: ATE STIMPSON'S first novel is very trim and selfpossessed. It never sags into the exhibitionism or selfindulgence that have marred much recent autobiographical fiction. Although the main character chooses to be lesbian, her homosexuality is less an issue than the process of selfdiscovery that took her there. In dealing with deep and disturbing passions, Class Notes never loses its poise. It written with more intelligence than spontaneity, and this has advantages and disadvantages.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores and supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This listing is based on computerprocessed reports from bookstores und representative wholesalers with more than 40,000 outlets across the United States.

title: LETTERS
description: For roughly a third of his review of my book Orientalism (Feb. 18), J.H. Plumb has unflattering things to say about my prose. All of what he has to say specifically concerns two things. He mentions a word, paradeutic, which he says clots my writing but which he cannot find in his dictionary. In fact the word is an invention of his, since it does not occur anywhere in my book. The second item is a passage quoted from page 92 of Orientelism. Yet in quoting this passage Mr. Plumb turns it into gibberish  purposely or not, I cannot tell  by changing my transmuted into his transmitted and my obliging into his obloquy. If he is going to make public criticisms of a book, he ought first to make sure that what he says about it is in it. That seems to me a minimum condition of serious discussion.

title: THE LIVELY ARTS Life and Death and Things Like That
description: EAST FARMINGDALE THE ultimate play about death will have to be written posthumously. In the meantime, there has been a spate of plays dealing with dying  a theme that has quickly become as tiresome as it is fashionable.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Photography is in the process of being recognized as art all over the world. But the process has not gone as far in other countries as it has in the United States. Magazine and newspaper photography still taken seriously by tastemakers in other countries. Photography intended primarily for the mu seum and gallery has not yet cleared every other kind out of its way. Consequently, it is not yet necessary to take a crash course in modernist esthetics in order to make sense out of most exhibitions of foreign photographs. It is still possible to get the same simple pleasure out of at least some of the photographs shown in such exhibitions as one gets from seeing photographs used as illustrations in newspapers and magazines.

title: OFFICIALS SAY NUCLEAR PLANT IS COOLER BUT STILL IN CRISIS; TRAPPEDGAS DANGER PERSISTS
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., March 31 Harold Denton, President Carter's chief troubleshooter overseeing safety measures at the Three Mile Island nuclear generating plant, said at the plant's control room tonight that measures to cool the damaged reactor were working, minimizing any danger that volatile gases inside the plant would explode.

title: The Other Arabs Gather In Anger
description: After five days of fighting and fuming that included a walkout by Arab militants, 18 Arab states and the Palestine Liberation Organization agreed to sever economic and diplomatic ties with Egypt to punish Anwar elSadat for signing a peace treaty with Israel. In the past, however, many agreements proclaimed in the name of Arab unity have foundered on the rock of real divisions between moderates and militants. Yesterday's Baghdad resolution could be similarly ineffective and shortlived.

title: The World
description: Long under siege, the British Labor Government's thin parliamentary defenses were blown apart in the House of Commons last week. Scottish nationalists yanked the lanyard, but Labor's own trade union constituency had loaded the cannon.

title: ART
description: MOST exhibitions of Oriental art in this country have been very specialized. They are usually devoted to specific cultures and are rarely mixed.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Dips, But Liberalization Talks With Tokyo Founder
description: The United States trade picture brightened last week with the report that the nation's massive deficit in February had been trimmed to the lowest level in nearly two years. But all was not blue skies. Efforts to liberalize trade with Japan, a nation responsible for much of that deficit, suffered a setback. And, as though to underline the difficulties with Tokyo, Alexander's Inc. pleaded guilty to customs fraud in the first case brought under the Government's investigation of dumping of television sets.

title: Landslide Victory for Khomeini Reported in Voting
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 31The twoday referendum to determine whether Iran will be an Islamic republic ended tonight, by all accounts an unsurprising landslide victory for Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: U. S. Envoy in Teheran Plans Washington Visit
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  William H. Sullivan, the United States Ambassador to Iran, will return to Washington in April for consultations and home leave, but no decision has been made on whether he will be replaced, Administration officials said today.

title: Traviata at City Opera
description: Verdi's La Traviata usually stands or falls on the performance of the soprano who sings Violetta. On Friday night, Rita Shane sang the part for the first time with the New York City Opera and more or less sustained the opera, but not with any real distinction.

title: Foul Odors Troubling Japanese
