description: TOKYO, March 31 (AP)  As Japanese cities spread into surrounding countryside, the Government receives more and more complaints of foul odors, the Environmental Agency has reported. It said yesterday that farms were the biggest problem. Residential neighbors of hograising farms, for example, filed 2,208 of the 16,676 foulodor complaints in fiscal 1977, the report said. It said factories were another major problem. The 1977 figure was a 4.3 percent increase over 1976.

title: Pamela Joan King To Be Wed June 10
description: Pamela Joan King, a staff writer for The Los Angeles Herald Examiner, and Albert Max Palitz, a thirdyear medical student at the University of Southern California, plan to be married June 10.

title: Five Photographers
description: LOTTE JACOBI contains the first monograph on this photographer's work, as well as an assemblage of her portraits, street scenes, theater, art and dance photographs. Her most important and memorable works are her informal photographs.

title: The Seeds Of Friendship
description: THERE are three children in this family. If they were to confront a spiderweb in the community garden I belong to, each child would react differently. The first child would examine the web and wonder how the spider wove it. The second child would worry a great deal about where the spider was at that particular moment. But the third child would exclaim. as in fact he did one afternoon, Oh, look! A trampoline. One reality, three dimensions. True for the spiderweb, true for the garden.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The major league season opens Wednesday with two games  San Francisco at Cincinnati in the National League in the afternoon and California at Seattle in the American League at night.

title: A Selective Strike Is Called By Teamsters as Talks Fail
description: ARLINGTON. Va., Sunday, April 1The International Brotherhood of Teamsters called a selective, strike against an unspecified number of trucking com, panies early today after contract talks broke down, with the union and the trucking industry divided on wages and other issues.

title: Columbia Head Seeking to Drop Campus's NuclearReactor Plan
description: The president of Columbia University said yesterday that he would ask the university's engineering faculty to drop plans to operate a nuclear research reactor on Columbia's Manhattan campus and that he expected the faculty to agree.

title: CRIME
description: It was only a few months ago that we had Robert Barnard's Death on the High C's, about murder in a British touring opera company that is getting ready for Rigoletto. Now comes MUSIC WHEN SWEET VOICES DIE by Chelsea Quinn Yarbro (Putnam's $9.95), and like the Barnard book, it is about opera. Furthermore again like the Barnard  it has been well researched. There is none of the sentimental blathering about music, not to mention technical mistakes, that one finds in so many novels about music and musicians.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: New Jersey PickIt906 Connecticut Daily532

title: A Proper Way to Live
description: OUR conversation is not about something casual, Socrates remarks in one of the Dialogues, but about the proper way to live. Every now and then a book comes along that contributes that conversation.

title: An Observer of Life Among Jews in U.S.
description: WHEN Rabbi Arthur Hertzberg went to Israel recently, he was bumped out of the hotel rooms h had reserved because of President Carter's visit. The rabbi didn't complain, however, because he was glad to be on the scene for such a historic occasion.

title: THE MOOD MAKERS
description: Today, the best seat in the house may be an armchair at home from which you can listen to whatever music suits your mood. The newest sound systems can make walls seem to recede and the music itself assume an almost tactile presence.

title: Whereto Find Tasteful Statuary
description: SAY garden ornaments, and pink flamingoes may fly to mind. But even companies that sell plastic wildlife often carry a few pieces of tasteful statuary.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: In This Proud Land is a very upbeat book. It is the story of an immigrant Mexican family, seven children and their parents, who are not illegal immigrants, do not live in an urban slum, and who, though they live

title: Kings Point Tops Marist
description: Kings Point overtook Marist College in the final 75 meters and won the feature varsity eight race in the Lord Pell regatta yesterday afternoon at Orchard Beach Lagoon in the Bronx.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: I AM standing at Nancy's doorstep for the first time, waiting for someone to answer the door. I almost hope that I am at the wrong house.

title: Terror, From Left and Right, Plagues Three Nations
description: MEXICO CITYAfter Christmas, the Presidents of Guatemala, El Salvador and Nicaragua and Honduras's chief of military intelligence conferred secretly on a farm near Guatemala City. In February, the bishops of the area traded notes during the Latin American Episcopal Conference in Puebla, Mexico. A few weeks ago, leaders of Central America's leftist guerrilla movements reportedly met somewhere in Honduras.

title: Clash Between Carter And Moynihan Slows Welfare Reform Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  Ten years after launching his career as a nationally recognized expert on welfare reform, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan is now engaged in a fierce dispute with the Carter Administration that both sides agree could seriously weaken the prospects for Congressional approval of any revisions In the welfare laws this year or next.

title: Linsey H. Corbin To Be Wed June 30
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harold H. Corbin Jr. of Falls Village, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Linsey Harlow Corbin, to Donald Edmond Pilon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert G. Pilon of Newington, Conn.

title: Lotus Pool QffersSound, Motion And Ultimate Relaxation
description: IF gardening is a joyful source of tranquility, then a garden pool must rank as the ultimate source of relaxation. There is a natural affinity that draws man to water, whether it's damming up rainspawned rivulets with the feet of childhood or walking along a stream or ocean beach.

title: Tailoring a House to Fit the Family
description: IT didn't fit. It was like a suit of clothes with the vest too tight and the pants too short. The dining room was too small, and the formal living room was dark and deserted. There was no good place for a party. All the same, the house was home. Barbara and Sheldon Turkish had put in a pool, landscaped the garden, finished the basement and ptit down their roots.

title: Frazier Takes Heavyweight Title In U.S. Golden Gloves
description: INDIANAPOLIS, March 31 (AP) Marvis Frazier, the 18yearold son of a former world heavyweight champion, Joe Frazier, outpointed Philip Brown tonight to claim the 1979 National Golden Gloves heavyweight championship.

title: New Talks About Yemeni Unity Were Held Last Week After the Latest Outbreak of Fighting Died Down
description: SANA, Yemen  For more than 100 years, the deepwater port of Aden at the southern tip of the Arabian peninsula was a vital stopover on the shipping routes linking Britain with India and Australia. Now it is the capital of Southern Yemen, the Arab world's only Communist state, and Moscow's strongest foothold in the Middle East.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Many persons have written asking the secret of my technique for not buying a new car. Aware that it could destroy the American economy and reduce the sheiks of OPEC to prowling the streets with pleas for baksheesh, I divulge it here with the greatest reluctance.

title: Ford Sued Over Pinto Crash
description: CLEVELAND, March 31 (AP)  A Cleveland couple, injured when their 1973 Ford Pinto caught fire after a rearend collision, has sued the Ford Motor Com pany and the other driver for $5.1 million. Mark and Deborah Wisniewski stated in the lawsuit filed yesterday that the crash caused their car to burst into flames, with Mr. Wisniewski suffering severe burns on his left arm and both hands and Mrs. Wlsniewski suffering back, head and other injuries

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: BRIDGEPORT  Festival of Contemporary Religious Arts, Thursday through Sunday, United Congregational Church, 877 Park Ave. Buffet Thursday 6 P.M. Information 3353108.

title: MOSCOWOSLO LINKS APPEAR TO IMPROVE
description: OSLO, March 27  Though a year of unusual tension between the Soviet Union and Norway now seems to be past, the return to calm provides no coherent explanation for a series of incidents in 1978 that appeared to be part of a pattern of increased Soviet pressure in northern Europe.

title: THE MARKETS
description: The stock market ended the final week of a moderately successful first quarter with a small gain heavy trading. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 2.43 points to 866.18 on volume of 154.6 million shares, compared with 160.8 million the week before.

title: An Accountant Is Not a Chairman
description: On Dec. 19, 1977, President Carter presented American industry with an early Christmas gift in the form of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977. One part of the act deals with illegal payments, the other with internal control. The latter section of the act, the subject of extensive discussion and confusion in boardrooms, incorporates language originally designed for quite different purposes; as a result, the section is so flawed that it needs to be returned, labeled defective, and reworked or at feast reinterpreted.

title: Cozumel 20 Years Later  A Mexican Island Comes of Age.
description: As my husband, David, and I settled into our seats at a Lincoln Center concert on our 18th wedding anniversary, he handed me the program in which in his own quixotic style  he had hidden my present: a roundtrip ticket to Cozumel, the Mexican island in the Caribbean where I had lived 20 years ago before getting married.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: BLOOMFIELD (Bloomfield College, Franklir and Fremont Streets)  Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, in an Actor's CafTheater production. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. Opens Thurs. day (through April 28). $3.50$5.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$4.50. (201) 4297662. Westminster Theater.

title: FactFinding Board Proposed
description: Since the Big A's 'arimutuel clerks have not had a meeting with theft. N.Y.R.A. employer for the last three weeks, a recommendation was made by State Mediator Joseph Neglia that a factfinding board be created to help end the strike. Neglia made his suggestion to State Mediator Commissioner Msgr. James Healey. The clerks have not worked at Aqueduct for more than six weeks.

title: IN BRIEF
description: The head of the Justice Departments's antitrust division, John H. Shenefield, last week ruled out the possibility of an indictment against American uranium producers on pricefixing charges, saying we could not win a felony prosecution. Two Democrats on the Senate antitrust subcommittee, Howard M. Metzenbaum of Ohio and Max Baucus of Montana, weren't satisfied. They urged Mr. Shenefield tolet the subcommittee question staff lawyers who had asked for an indictment.

title: John Hartley Weds Sara Jane Tsakonas
description: The marriage of Sara Jane Tsakonas, a planner with the New York Community Development Agency, to John Bryan Hartley, an architect with Davis, Brody & Associates in New York, took place in Brooklyn, Conn., yesterday. The Rev. Richard G.M. Chambers performed the ceremony in Old Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: Lake Placid Divides Tickets to Olympics
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., March 31 (AP)  Virtually all of the tickets available to the general public for the 1980 Winter Olympics here next February will be sold through brokers, who will charge additional commissions and probably package the tickets with transportation and housing arrangements.

title: St. Anthony's Takes AAA Championship
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., March 31  Mike Sheehan hit a jump shot from the top of the key with three seconds remaining to give St. Anthony's of Smithtown, L.I., a 3634 victory over Mount Vernon in the final of the Class AAA New York State basketball tournament tonight at the War Memorial Coliseum.

title: Italian Train Is Robbed in Style
description: ROME, March 31 (AP)  Fastmoving bandits halted a MilantoRome train about 60 miles north of here today, detached the last five cars and made off with sacks filled with postal money orders, the railroad police reported.

title: For Roe, All Roads May Dead to Trenton
description: COME next month, supporters of Representative Robert A. Roe of Wayne Township will pay $150 each to have dinner with him and, incidentally, help Mr. Roe to erase a $140,000 debt that he incurred during the Democratic gubernatorial primary last year.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: This Week:

title: Ideas &
description: A man's car is his castle. So drivers tend to assume. So, in effect, the Supreme Court held last week.

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: INVITATIONS for the more than 1,300 guests at Monday's state dinner honoring the Egyptian-Israeli peace treaty came from many sources, and for many reasons. Two of Westchester's invitees  there may have been others  were a case in point.

title: Many Courses Offered
description: WITH the arrival of spring, chances are that even the least handy among us is getting the fixit urge. Moldy wood, leaky pipes, small rooms that seem suddenly to beg for expansion  all are more apparent in the longer light and softer air of April. Outside, the lawn is brown and the garden is clammering for attention..

title: Topics
description: Beware of judges bearing jokes. After two and a half years of presiding over a complex case involving the collapse of the Franklin National Bank in 1974, Federal Judge Thomas Platt Jr. has felt compelled to disqualify himself. Last Halloween, the judge told in open court an elaborate joke involving many of the participants in the case. He reports, Everyone laughed and had a good time.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSMOrt, on March 31, 1979, husband of Dorothy H. Adams, son of Minnie Arons, father of Kenneth L. Adams, Winifred Adams Forks and Lynn Adams Falwell, brother of David. Lillian and Lee Arom, also survived by 5 grandchildren. Service and Interment private. In lieu of flowers contributions may be made to Multiple Sclerosis Society of Westchester.

title: NATURE WATCH
description: Color: Black crown (including eyes). White cheeks, back and breast. Greenish markings on head. Black underparts.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: EAST HAMPTON  Group Exhibtion; 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. Thursdays through Saturdays; through April 21; Gallery East, 257 Pantigo La. Reception 1 to 5 P.M. today.

title: INVESTING
description: A bewildering array of real estate investments are being offered the public these days, and although orange lights of caution are flashing from many directions  for relatively small investors have suffered serious losses in such celebrated debacles as the bankruptcy of the Investors Funding Corporation  the public's taste for real estate as an investment has apparently not been dimmed.

title: Miss Zayak of U.S. Takes Junior Figure Skating Title
description: AUGSBURG, West Germany, March 31 (UPI)  Elaine Zayak of the United States won the world junior girls figure skating championship today, but Manuela Ruben of West Germany broke the American phalanx that usually dominates the competition by placing second. Jacki Farrell of the United States placed third.

title: Jim Chapin, a Different Drummer, Sounds Off
description: JIM CHAPIN, a Sag Harbor resident, may be the most renowned nonfamous jazz drummer in the world. To the extent that he has inadvertently achieved fame, it is for what the noted jazz drummer Elvin Jones describes as a milestone in drum books, in which Mr. Chapin outlines a technique he calls coordinated independence.

title: Closing Arguments in Marvin Trial Set for April 10
description: LOS ANGELES, March 31  After more than 11 weeks, testimony in the trial of Lee Marvin has come to a close with lawyers for the actor and Michelle Triola, the woman he lived with for six years, still contesting whether they had ever entered into an oral agreement that they would share their earnings and the property they acquired over the sixyear relationship.

title: How to Help the Lawn Along
description: SPRING has arrived and the time has come to pay attention to the lawn? Right? Wrong. Those who have earned their master's degree in lawnsmanship know that the important time to think about the lawn is in the fall. From September on, the grass has the benefit of a cooler, moister growing season wnen new sees can grow, fertilizer can begin to accomplish something and the heatdevastated greensward can recover.

title: Miss McClure, R.S. Hatfield Set Wedding
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Charles N. McClure of Guilford, Conn., of the engagement of their daughter, Susan English McClure, to Robert Sherman Hatfield Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hatfield of Greenwich and Sherman, Conn.

title: Court Upholds a Curb On Policy Statements Put in Bills by Utility
description: WESTBURY, L.I., March 30  A Fed. eral Court judge today upheld the constitutionality of a ban by the New York State Public Service Commission on the use of bill inserts that contain information on utilities positions on controversial matters of public policy.

title: Companies Heed Sullivan Law; Public Yawns
description: Though the very idea produced an uproar in the business and legal communities when it was first espoused, the nation's pioneer plain English law, which went into effect last fall, has stirred little more than a yawn. Yet the

title: Judge Throws Out an Indictment Over Loophole in Marijuana Law
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 30  An apparent loophole in the Marijuana Reform Act of 1977, which removed criminal penalties for possession of small amounts of the drug forpersonal use, has resulted in the dismissal of at least two cases involving the possession and sale of large quantities.

title: Instant Camera War Developments
description: In 1948 Harry S. Truman squeaked into the Presidency, Citation took the Kentucky Derby and the first instant camera went on sale. Winners all. For nearly three decades the Polaroid Corporation rode its camera to glory and position as one of the nation's corporate giants  and then a bigger giant challenged. In 1976, the Eastman Kodak Company, the camera titan with sales five times those of Polaroid, brought out its own instant.

title: Music Notes: Casals Festival
description: Ever since the death of Pablo Casals the annual festival that he established in Puerto Rico has been going through a crisis of identity. Without the great cellist's magnetic presence and personal artistry, the event seemed to lose direction and glamor. It was kept going fora while by Casals's widow, Marta, and such good friends as Alexander Schneider, the violinist. But the disappearance of the founder also brought to a head local complaints abut the absence of Puerto Rican artists from the festival  almost all the soloists and orchestra members were imported. Mrs. Casals married Eugene Istomin, the pianist, and resigned as artistic director of the festival.'There was a radical change in the governing board, with no one quite sure what was going to happen.

title: A Fantasticks With Little Flight in Its Fancy
description: FOR its final offering of the season, the Hartman Theater Company in nearby Stamford, Conn., is presenting, through next Sunday, The Fantasticks, the musical that has been in continuous performance Off Broadway since shortly after Fort Sumter was fired on.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., March 31 (AP)  Barbie Myslak of California State University, Fullerton won two of four events in competition tonight in the Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women gymnastics championships.

title: THE MOOD MAKERS
description: Conjure up, if you will, a pair of rooms. They are both 20 feet long and 12 feet wide. They both have ninefoot ceilings, a fireplace in the middle of one of the long walls, a pair of double doors at one end and a wide bay window at the other. Each room contains a couch, a couple of end tables, three chairs, a coffee table and a piano, all of which are arranged in the same fashion in both places.

title: Miss Navratilva Upset;Chris Evert Gains Final
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., March 31  Di,. anne Fromholtz, who admitted that she had nothing to lose, put together a dazzling mixture of strokes today for a 75, 61 upset of the world's No. 1 woman player, Martina Navratilova.

title: 2 New Youth Job Projects on Tap
description: Private industry in New York City will be urged to hire thousands of the city's unemployed young men through two new Federal programs that will pay a part of some salaries or provide tax credits for employers.

title: Claudia Landegger To Be Wed June 16
description: Mr. and Mrs. Carl C. Landegger of Bronxville, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Claudia Noemie Landegger, to Ronald P. Malaya, son of Mrs. Joseph DiAngelis of New York and the late Louis Malaya.

title: Heyerdahl, With No More Ocean Frontiers, Retiring
description: After drifting in a balsalog raft from Peru to Polynesia, taking a papyrus raft across the Atlantic and sailing a reed ship through the Persian Gulf and around the Arabian Sea, Thor Heyerdahl says that he has decided to give up seafaring in craft modeled on primitive vessels.

title: Heat Your Pool With Sunshine And Save While You Swim
description: IF you have an unheated swimming pool in the backyard, you've probably noticed a cruel irony around June 1. The air tells you it's summer, time to take a dip. But dangle a foot in the pool, and the water tells you it's winter. Until recently, there was only one way to take that chill out of the water: investing about $500 in a conventional gas heater and $150 per month in fuel to power it. Now, though, there's a better way  a solar pool heater.

title: CRITIC'S VIEW
description: If the arts in the People's Republic of China are not exactly thriving yet, there is a feeling of renaissance in the air, and things are beginning to move. Certainly the interchange between Chinese cultural figures and the members of the Boston Symphony were on a much freer and more intimate basis than they had been in 1973, when the Philadelphia Orchestra made its trailbreaking visit. The Chinese have a great deal of catchingup to do; they have been handcuffed since the Cultural Revolution of 196676. Apparently they are determined to make up for lost. time. To this writer, who had made the 1973 trip and then returned for a week on March 12, the differences were startling. There now seems a real lust for a cultural rapprochement, and Old China Hands are shaking their heads in amazement. Chinese intellectuals are suddenly enjoying unprecedented freedom.

title: DINING OUT
description: UNDER the ownership of Ronald Mawn, Archers in Fort Lee has built a reputation over the last nine years for being flossy and expensive. Attitudes about good value will depend on one's own price/pleasure index. I found Archers flossy, expensive and good value because the chef, Serafino Mansueto, prepares excellent food.

title: WESTCHESTER HOUSING
description: HOW can one find out what house is worth? With the busy spring selling season approaching, a shortage of houses on the market and prices in Westchester going up as much as 16 percent a year, values change so rapidly that, said one real estate agent, an appraisal two weeks old is probably too low.

title: Whereto Find Tasteful Statuary
description: SAY garden ornaments, and pink flamingoes may fly to mind. But even companies that sell plastic wildlife often carry a few pieces oitsteful statuary.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS The Mideast Challenge
description: Though President Carter set out with courage and good faith to promote an overall settlement of the ArabIsraeli dispute, the constricting pressures of the negotiating process have so far produced a result reminiscent of Henry A. Kissinger's stepbystep strategy.

title: Characters in Search of a Difference
description: VOLUME of stories, bereft of continuity in plot and character, is often unified only by the writer's obsessiveness. A certain restlessness, a temporary energy takes over, a singing in the brain that is too intense to live with for the duration of a novel. That energy roams the lines of the story looking for a way out. James Joyce called that way out an epiphany, but in our time it is more like the quick release of passion than the stately illumination of the intellect.

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, APRIL 1, 1979

title: NEW JERSEY GUIDE
description: A special children's concert featuring Tubby the Tuba will be given at the Lawrenceville School, Lawrenceville by the Mercer County Symphonic Orchestra's Symphonette, composed of musicians selected from the larger orchestra. Dr. Gordon. Meyers, professor of music at Trenton State College, will narrate the perennial favorite. The concert will be held in the Kirby Arts Center at 2 P:M.

title: Beth Joan DiSesa Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. John J. DiSesa Jr. of Rye, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Beth Joan DiSesa, to Stephen FCC. Judge, son of Dr. and Mrs. Francis X. Judge 2d of New Rochelle, N.Y. A December wedding is planned. Miss DiSesa is an assistant business manager in the televisionproduction department of Doyle Dane Bernbach Inc., advertising agency. Her father is a television producer with the Young & Rubicam advertising agency in New York. The prospective bridegroom attends the Fairleigh Dickinson Graduate School. His father is an Orthodontist.

title: In Grand Prix, Change Means No Change
description: The scene is always the same at the Kyalami Ranch Hotel. Because it is just a halfkilometer from South Africa's challenging grand prix autoracing circuit, and because most teams choose Kyalami as their earlyseason test site, this resort hotel has been kept on by the Formula One circuit as one of the few remaining playgrounds in what has become an otherwise nononsense business.

title: Federal Regulatory Red Tape Proves a Sort of Gordian Knot
description: WASHINGTON  If the Carter Administration is to be believed, the legislation proposed last week would reduce, rationalize and streamline the nation's regulatory red tape. If businessmen, lawyers and private economists are to be believed, it would do little to ease a rapidly growing burden. If consumer advocates, environmentalists and social activists are to be believed, the legislation would impede progress toward a clean environment and a safe workplace.

title: The deeds Of Friendship
description: THERE are three children in this family. If they were to confront a spiderweb. in the community garden I belong to, each child would react differently. The first child would examine the web and wonder how the spider wove it. The second child would worry a great deal about where the spider was at that particular moment. But the third child would exclaim, as in fact he did one afternoon, Oh, look! A trampoline. One reality, three dimensions. True for the spiderweb, true for the garden.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: It has often been said that his tory is written by the winners. In this splendid book, Ben Mad dow has given us history as it was set down by the losers, the anonymous people who built the railroads, worked the mines and mills, tilled the land and were, in most cases, victims of the explosion of American wealth and power that reshaped the country between the Civil War and World War I.

title: The HomeBuilt House
description: I USED to be fond of telling our children the history of our home. See that corner, I'd say, that's where I fell off the scaffold. And keep your fingers off the wall, your father cut his leg with the Skil saw when he framed it.

title: Philippine Airline Raising Fares
description: MANILA, March 31 (AP)  The Governmentowned Philippine Airlines, the country's only domestic air carrier, is raising fares 35 percent to cover higher fuel costs, the airline said.

title: Carter Pledges to Retain Lucey As U.S. Ambassador to Mexico
description: MILWAUKEE, March 31  President Carter tonight ended speculation that he might replace Patrick J. Lucey as Ambassador to Mexico.

title: THE 10 INFERNO
description: The Voyager photographs of Io show a brightly colored surface with large fields of yellow, orangered and white. The yellow color may be produced by sulfur: the red is probably iron oxide, or rust, but could also be a sulfur compound or some unknown exotic material. The white suggests evaporites salts produced when water loaded with minerals wells upward and accumulates on the surface of a planet as a byproduct of volcanic activity. On airless Io, the water would evaporate immediately, leaving the deposits of white salt on the surface.

title: Riessen Scores Upset
description: DAYTON, Ohio, March 31 (UPI) Marty Riessen continued to be the surprise of a Grand Prix tennis tournament as he toppled secondseeded Tim Gullikson, 63, 75, and reached the final today.

title: Housing for the handicapped. Page 12.
description: WHEN Karen Molinari was almost 16 years old, she broke her neck in a diving accident and emerged a quadraplegic. Now 25, she has been living in a geriatric nursing home for the last four years, since her parents could no longer attend to her needs at home.

title: NEW ITALIAN CABINET DEFEATED IN SENATE
description: ROME, March 31  The 11-day-old Government of Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti lost.its first parliamentary test tonight as th Senate defeated a confidence motion by a vote of 150 to 149.

title: Andretti Seeking First Victory This Year
description: Next Sunday's Grand Prix auto race in Long Beach, Calif., will be the ideal place for Mario Andretti to post his first victory of the 1979 Formula One season because he will be competing in front of his countrymen.

title: BRIDGE
description: When Samuel Goldwyn gave birth to one of his greatest Goldwynisms  in two words, impossible  he might have been talking about South's task on the diagramed deal. Looking just at the NorthSouthhands, there appears no chance to make nine tricks in notrump. Even studying all four hands, with the cards particularly wellplaced for the declarer, it is not easy to see any road to nine tricks after the opening lead of the club jack.

title: 40 Are Held Hostage, Then Freed at a Brooklyn Store
description: Three gunmen, thwarted in their attempt to rob a Brooklyn supermarket, held about 40 shoppers and employees hostage for three and a half hours last night before surrendering.

title: Easy to Grow, Colorful Gourds Are Decorative  and Useful
description: GOURDS are afterthought plants. If people grow them at all, it's usually because they pick up one of the garden center's colorful seed packs at the last minute. Then the seeds are stuck in at the edge of the vegetable patch  or just as often forgotten because there's no room left in the garden. Now I'm not suggesting you plan to make gourds major crop. But if you haven't been growing them, consider what you've been missing.

title: OPEC: How Vulnerable We Are
description: WASHINGTON  Once again, the cartel of oilexporting governments has flexed its muscles, marked up prices and reminded the United States and other oilhungry countries how vulnerable they really are.

title: Crime in Suburbia Bringing Wariness
description: EDISON

title: Why Paint Peels And How to Stop It
description: WHEN paint cracks, blisters or peels prematurely, the failure is occasionally due to the fact that a poorquality paint was used, or that the wrong type of paint was used for that particular job  but, more often than not, the paint's failure was due to neither one of these two reasons.

title: Stephen Marshak to Marry Kathryn Gollin
description: Prof. and Mrs. Richard Gollin of Rochester have announced the engagement of their daughter, Kathryn Ann Gollin, to Stephen Marshak, son of Dr. Robert Marshak, president of City College, and Mrs. Marshak of New York. A May 27 wedding in Rochester is planned.

title: Miss Canteros, Pianist
description: Arminda Canteros made her New York debut two seasons ago at the age of 65, and Friday night she returned to Alice Tully Hall for a second piano recital. A native of Argentina, Miss Can. teros might have played here earlier in her career, but a bus accident in 1956 left her with a broken spine, and the road back to complete recovery has evidently been a long and difficult one.

title: Package Trips in China Are Offered to Chinese
description: PEKING, March 31 (Reuters)  The Chinese are being given a chance to see their own country, with the start of package tours to scenic spots.

title: Why Paint Peels And How to Stop It
description: WHEN paint cracks, blisters or peels prematurely, the failure is occasionally due to the fact that a poorquality paint was used, or that the wrong type of paint was used for that particular job  but, more often than not, the paint's failure was due to neither one of these two reasons.

title: LongResisting New York Lawyers Will Begin Annual Registration
description: New York has more lawyers than any other state, but unlike most other states, no one knows precisely how many. The best guess is 70,000, about 10,000 more than in California. And it is not known who they are or where they live and practice.

title: CAROL WELD
description: Carol Weld, a former foreign correspondent who worked for various news organizations in Paris for many years, died yesterday in Miami, where she had been living since retiring. She was 65 years old. Mrs. Weld was born in New York City and worked on the local staffs of the old New York American and The New York Herald Tribune before going to Paris in the early 1930's. While abroad, Mrs. Weld worked for The Universal Service, International News Service and The United Press. She was a founding member of the Overseas Press Club.

title: Letters: Singles Weekends, Then and Now, in the Catskills
description: To the Editor:

title: England in the 50's
description: The 1950's feel as if they happened about 300 years ago, quainter and further off than the 40's, 30's or 20's; and to English readers (Americans may scarcely even have registered it), the most poignantly distant moment of the decade was the Coronation of Elizabeth 11

title: Mt. Vernon's Public Library: It Could Write a Book
description: LATE last year a group of authors, seeking to recapture the camaraderie and experiences they shared in courting the muse in the Frederick Lewis Allen Memorial Room of the New York City Public Library, established their own writers room on 41st Street, just a block away from the site of their early inspirations. It was a recognition of sorts that the library was an important step in the process of creation.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: HIGHgloss varnishes and enamels produce best results when they are applied to a smooth, blemishfree surface, and when they are properly brushed out so that no runs, drips or brush marks show on the final coat. Careful preparation of the surface (sanaing, etc.) is, of course, of primary importance, as is working in a dustfree room so that airborne particles will not settle on the wet finish, but in addition to all this there are two other pointers that will help insure a smooth, glossy coating when the job is done:

title: Mary Jane McCabe Is Wed to John Belt
description: Mary Jane McCabe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Thomas McCabe of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour yesterday to John Hewlett Keyes Belt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Banks Belt of Glen Cove and Southampton, LI. The Rev. John McCann performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: 40 Held Hostage in Brooklyn
description: Forty people were held hostage three and a half hours in a Brooklyn supermarket by wouldbe robbers, who finally surrendered to police. Page 35.

title: New York Syndrome: Fear and Unconcern
description: The eastbound E train, speeding through Queens, was filled with Aqueductbound horse players hunched over their Daily Racing Forms.

title: Giving Food its Due
description: Good food is a blessing anddeservesacelebration  thus it merits an appropriate setting. And that in turn puts one in the proper mood to enjoy the good food.

title: Taste of Doomsday In Pennsylvania Nuclear Accident
description: Whatever the mathematical odds against a serious accident in a nuclear power plant, theory went out the window last week for about one million residents of four Pennsylvania counties. The worst nuclear accident in the country's history occurred at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant about 11 miles south of Harrisburg, Pa., the state capital. Apart from its immediate effects, the accident instantly intensified the debate over the safety of nuclear power and seemed almost certain to prompt a moratorium on moving the nation toward greater reliance on nuclear energy.

title: What's Doingin YORK
description: ORIGINS The English city of York was founded by the Romans as a garrison town in A.D. 7174. Their withdrawal in 380 was followed by an unrecorded gap until the seventh century, when the AngloSaxons settled.

title: Robert A. Jackson Is Dead at 82; ExPresident of Ward Baking Co.
description: Robert Arnold Jackson, a retired former president and board chairman of the Ward Baking Company, a subsidiary of Ward Foods of New York, died Thursday at his home in Ponte Vedra, Fla. He was 82 years old.

title: How to Help the Lawn Along
description: SPRING has arrived and the time has come to pay attention to the lawn? Right? Wrong. Those who have earned their master's degree in lawnsmanship know that the important time to think about the lawn is in the fall. From September on, the grass has the benefit of a cooler, moister growing season when new seed can grow, fertilizer can begin to accomplish something and the heatdevas tated greensward can recover.

title: U.A.W. Chief Asks Single System Of U.S. Unemployment Insurance
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., March 31 (UPI)  Douglas Fraser, president of the United Auto Workers union, has said that the nation's unemployment insurance system of 50 separate programsone for each state  should be replaced by a single Federal program.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Of Special Interest

title: Pollini's Modern Pianism.
description: Maurizio Pollini, the celebrated Italian pianist who will perform tomorrow night at Carnegie Hall, does not at first glance seem an especially likely subject of controversy. At the key board, his manner is not flamboyant or imperious or even very distinctive. And his playing, far from taking issue with the text or exploiting it, clearly strives to avoid exaggeration or selfish display.

title: Radiation Cited in Cancellation
description: ERIE, Pa., March 31  Stephen Stills, the rock musician, said after a concert last night at Edinboro State College that he would not make a scheduled appear ance tonight at Pennsylvania's Indiana State College because of th radiation leaking from Three Mile Island nuclear power plant, 150 miles away. He said he had never canceled a concert before, but that there was too much confusion for him to take his band and stage crew into the area.

title: Scent
description: The elusive presence of a natural fragrance in a room creates its own invisible imagery and subtle impressions.

title: Rabies Shots Ordered for 10
description: PAOLI, Ind., March 31 (AP)  At least 10 persons in southern Indiana's Orange County are taking rabies shots after coming into contact with animals that were rabid or were attacked by other rabid animals, the authorities say. The State Board of Animal Health put all dogs on a sixmonth quarantine this week after rabies tests on several dead animals  a cow, a horse, a skunk and a raccoon proved positive.

title: Rutgers Dominates Columbia in Regatta
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 31  Columbia's varsity lightweight crew prevented a clean sweep by the Rutgers heavyweight and lightweight crews today in the opening regatta of the 1979 intercollegiate rowing season.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: Some people think of the Yale Center for British Art as landlocked in the period between van Dyck and J.M.W. Turner. But regular visitors to that celestial building in New Haven will know that it has more than once looked with affection at High Victorian painting and will present as of April 14 a retrospective of paintings and sculptures by Kenneth Martin, still active at 74 and a key figure in the history of British abstract art.

title: Some in Taipei Feel It's Time to Talk With Peking
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 28The telephone operator at the Grand Hotel here was excited. There was a call from Menachem Begin, Prime Minister of Israel.

title: Swift, Unhappy Shortstop
description: Garry. Lewis Templeton is a switchhitting shortstop with exceptional range, rare speed and a fine arm who has made the league's allstar team wherever he has played baseball. He passed his 23d birthday a week ago yesterday. Three days later he announced that he did not intend to play hard for the St. Louis

title: Plan for Antlerless Deer Season Sparks Controversy in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., March 31 Spurred by a dismal deerhunting season last fall, the State Fish and Game Department is lobbying hard to wrest control of the herd from the Legislature, charging the Legislature with mismanagement.

title: United Buys New Engines for Old Jets
description: United Airlines last week became the first airline to order new engines for old aircraft to comply with Federal anti noise regulations. The new French American turbofan engine, for which it placed a $400 million order, will mean a considerable fuel savings as well.

title: Amy Diamond to Wed May 5
description: Amy Diamond, an assistant personnel director at Barnard College, and Davis Laing Barnes, an alumnus of American University in Washington, plan to be married May 5 at the Fox Hill Inn in Brookfield, Conn. Their engagement has been announced by Evan Diamond of Plainfield, N.J., and Jean Diamond of Hillsborough, N.J., parents of the bridetobe, an alumna of William Smith College. Mr. Barnes is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Mortimer P. Barnes of Old Greenwich, Conn.

title: Enfield Ponders The World's Ills
description: ENFIELD MARJORIE WILRINS is not a demonstrative person I'm the one who always sits in the back row az)d the protest she has joined over the fourthgrade socialscience program in this ruralsuburban town where the Connecticut River heads into Massachusetts has had a jarring impact on her life. The school program deals with the sometimes harsh realities of how people live around the world.

title: Solution for U.S. Olympians
description: There is a fine line between intelligent concern and emotional overreaction. For track and field in the United States, I think intelligent concern has won.

title: More Care Given Employees' Psyches
description: Is the care and feeding of a worker's psychea corporate responsibility? The Kennecott Copper Corporation, for one, thinks so, and has been operating counseling program for eight years. But the International Business Machines Corporation, for another, declines to set one up, saying succinctly: It's not the business we're in.

title: At UConn, Changes At the Top
description: HARTFORD THE time is past when funds were readily available to us, said John A. DiBiaggio, named last week as president of the University of Connecticut. In his first speech as president, he was reciting what is almost a universal refrain among college presidents. But Dr. DiBiaggio has some ideas that are relatively untried by UConn on how to get money from private sources, and those ideas may begin to change the emphasis of the university in the next few months from that of a centralized school for young people to a statewide institution serving students of all ages, many of whom study parttime.

title: EXUBERANT CROWDS HAIL SADAT IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, March 31  President Anwar elSadat came home today to an exuberant welcome from tens of thousands of Egyptians who turned out to demonstrate support for the peace treaty he signed with Israel.

title: Justice Department
description: A NEW system for handling bankruptcy cases is going to be tested around the nation, and there is a job in New Jersey, one of the 10 pilot sites, for a new Federal official  a bankruptcy trustee.

title: Evangelist Fights Cancellation of TV Show
description: DALLAS, March 31  James Robison, the evangelist, says he was only preaching the Bible when he said on his Sunday morning television show that homoseauality was despicable.

title: Company Cites Testing of Nuclear Reactor
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., March 31 A senior official of the company that designed and built the reactor in the Three Mile Island nuclear plant near Harrisburg, Pa., said today that the company had made plans to cope with an accident of the kind that has occurred there.

title: Lotus Pool Offers Sound, Motion And Ultimate Relaxation
description: IF gardening is a joyful source of tranquility, then a garden pool must rank as the ultimate source of relaxation. There is a natural affinity that draws man to water, whether it's damming up rainspawned rivulets with the feet of childhood or walking along a stream or ocean beach.

title: Inspectors Shopping for Agent Orange
description: FEDERAL and state inspectors are roaming through the stores of Long Island this week, but they are not looking for bargains. Instead, they are searching for herbicides and pesticides that contain Agent Orange, a chemical that can cause cancer, tumors, liver ailments, birth defects and genetic defects. The search is not confined to stores but also includes nurseries and golf courses. search is not confined to stores but also includes nurseries and golf courses.

title: Law
description: CHICAGO  Perhaps other Federal judges have been as reluctant to make a decision on a Constitutional issue as Robert W. Warren was in imposing prior restraint on The Progressive magazine to prevent it from publishing an article about the hydrogen bomb, but surely few have agonized more publicly about it. The ruling made Judge Warren the first Federal judge to grant a preliminary injunction against publication for reasons of national security.

title: A Correction
description: The beneficiary of An Evening With Isaac Asimov, held last Thursday in Great Neck, was identified incorrectly in last week's On the Isle column. The event was a benefit for the National Paraplegia Foundation.

title: Anatomy of Atomic Plant Mishap
description: About 4 A.M. Wednesday a series of mishaps began in the cooling system of the reactor at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania that have snowballed into the most alarming accident to date in the American atomic energy program. Detailed knowledge of what happened still lies hidden in the steamy, lethally radioactive chamber that houses the reactor.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: Today  Irish Setter Club of Long Island specialty and obedience, Holiday Inn, 80 Clinton Street, Hempstead, L.I.; 8:30 A.M.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: In Matthew L. Wald's article, [Plan to Dredge in Connecticut Roils Long Island Officials, March 9] Congressman Jerome Ambro's spokesman, Daniel Driscoll, is quoted as saying that the East Northport legislator recently urged the Federal E.P.A. to prohibit the disposal in Long Island Sound of 75,000 cubic yards of obstructing muck which the Corps of Engineers plans to remove from Stamford Harbor.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 9 A.M. (Channel 7) Interface: Welfare's Catch22.

title: 2 Experts in Warning On Alcohol and Youth
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI) Two specialists say that teenage drinking seems to have leveled off since the mid1960's, and they warn polIcymakers against overreacting in dealing with alcohol and youth.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: HIGHgloss varnishes and enamels produce best results when they are applied to a smooth, blemishfree surface, and when they are properly brushed out so that no runs, drips or brush marks show on the final coat. Careful preparation of the surface (sanding, etc.) is, of course, of primary importance, as is working in a dustfree room so that airborne particles will not settle on the wet finish, but in addition to all this there are two other pointers that will help insure a smooth, glossy coating when the job is done:

title: Extending an Original's Character
description: THE first lesson of remodeling is to remember what you liked about the house when you bought it, said Herbert Newman, a New Haven architect who remodeled his own home. The original appeal can be lost in careless additions.

title: Hell on Wheels? Ask a Bus Driver on; the New York. Run
description: SMOKERS are Ethel Ordway's enemy and buses are her battlefield. And, although Miss Ordway's fight to uphold the sanctity of the No Smoking sign is not helping her popularity, it may be winning back some of the Wew Jersey bus riders who have defected since 1970.

title: OutofState Banks Meet Hostile Forces at Border
description: WESTPORT

title: Wall Street Meets a Scrap Dealer
description: DES MOINES, Iowa  On a Sunday morning last June, directors of the Bache Group gathered for an emergency meeting at the firm's Manhattan headquarters. The only item on the agenda: the threat of takeover attempt.

title: Appel Plays Harpsichord
description: Andrew Appel, heard Friday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, impressed as a thoughtful, generally skillful harpsichordist. In a French and German program, he approached all the music at hand with obvious affection, as well as a lively appreciation of stylistic distinctions.

title: Black Parents in Capital Suburb Say Busing Plan Harms Children
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., March 31  A tentative agreement to modify a sixyearold school desegregation plan, reached by the school board and the president of the Prince Georges County N.A.A.C.P. chapter, has aroused bitter controversy.

title: Puerto Rican Bank Failure Brings On Federal Suit
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., March 31  The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has filed a $103 million suit against the directors of Banco Credito y Ahorro Ponceno, charging them with acting carelessly negligently and with blatant disregard of their duties.

title: Miss Lopez Leads Coast Golf by 2 Strokes
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., March 31 Nancy Lopez, seeking her third straight tour victory, shot a oneoverpar 72 today for a 54hole total of 211 and gained a twostroke lead in Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament.

title: Will Wonders Never Cease?
description: IT'S a long way from the Great Sphinx in Giza to the Great Falls in Paterson, but the two greats have something in common. The Egyptian sphinx is one of the seven wonders of the ancient world and the falls has been voted one of the seven natural wonders of New Jersey.

title: Notes: Montreal Claims Disco Crown
description: Many Montrealers claim that long before Saturday night Caught fever, their city danced. While the rest of the world remembered discothques as a fancy passed by in the 1960's, they say, the world's second Iargest French city kept time to the music. Spokesmen for the city have picked up the beat, asserting that it has more offerings in the rainbow world of disco than most other. major cities. And the city's New York office has put together a list of them.

title: Bell Phone Lifts Limit on Calls
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 31 (AP) Bell Telephone of Pennsylvania has lifted a request to limit calls into the region covered by the 717 area code because the number of calls since the accident at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant has slackened, a Bell spokesman said today.

title: CENTO Pact: Demise Nears
description: Tucked away on the inside pages of the newspapers recently was a small item announcing that the Secretary General of the Central Treaty Organization was taking steps to dissolve it.

title: A Tennis Ace Who Stayed Home
description: PEOPLE began noticing Pete Bromley around Westchester tennis courts when he was 13 years old. He played an aggressive game, fighting for every point and never giving up. Everybody in his family was into tennis, and there were predictions that he would go far with his powerful lefthanded serve, topspin forehand and stinging volley.

title: Colleges Feeling Squeeze
description: HARTFORD GOVERNOR Grasso simply does not understand the high cost of sheep hearts, according to Edward Leadbetter, the chairman of the Biology Department at the University of Connecticut.

title: Funeral for a SadFaced Clown: Emmett Kelley Buried in Florida
description: SARASOTA, Fla March 31 (UPI) Mourners who knew Emmett Kelly as a circus clown and as a neighbor said a last goodbye today to both the man and Weary Willie, the sadfaced hobo figure Mr. Kelly made famous.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Scary times. Two years ago this week the average price of the paperbacks on our massmarket Best Seller List was $2.10. A year ago it was $2.38. This week it is $2.56. Almost all the big books announced for this summer will bear price tags of $2.95. Small wonder that we've received a number of letters from readers asking whether the publishers aren't getting greedy.

title: Pakistan Moves to Nonaligned
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 31 (Reuters)  Pakistan announced today that it had applied for full membership In the 88nation nonaligned movement after breaking with the Central Treaty Organization.

title: It's O.K. to Be Mixed Up in Gym
description: IN one long gym at White Plains High School, strung from end to end with badminton nets, students bat shuttlecocks back and forth, or, seated around the edges of the gym, chat while awaiting their turns.

title: Alyson Rea Haley Plans June 2 Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. John C. Haley of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Alyson Rea Haley, to Arthur Vernon Woodworth 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Woodworth Jr. of Dover. Mass.
