title: Noreen Royce Finke Engaged
description: Announcement has been Made by Mr. and Mrs. Howard D. Finite of South Orange, N.J., of the engagement of their daughter, Noreen Royce Flnke, to Jeffrey M. Punta, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Punta of West Orange, N.J. The wedding is planned for June 16.

title: Yanks, Mets Set for Openers
description: Reggie Jackson has played for two of baseball's most irrepressible owners and two of the game's best teams in recent years. He sees similarities in the owners and, by extension, the teams  the Oakland A's that won three straight World Series from 1972 through 1974 and the Yankees, who will try to win their third straight series this year. This ball club, has the same kind of unyielding character as we did in Oakland, Jackson said the other day at the Yankee camp in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. It doesn't give in. You can't intimidate this club. This club does the intimidating. It doesn't lose its poise. These guys play for keeps. They're money players.

title: Asphalt Contract May Go to Out-of-Town Concern
description: In an unusual action, the Board of Estimate will be asked this week to award lucrative asphaltsupply contract to Newark company, even though the contract would ordinarily be given to a local company Under bidding rules favoring New York City suppliers.

title: On Language
description: One of those bedrock rules that we always thought kept civilization from slipping its moorings was that Q is always followed by U. You could be a terrible speller, but when you got to Q, you knew what the next letter was.

title: ART
description: TWO shows now at UConn in Storrs are of characters so opposed as to cause speculation about their relative effects on the students. One concerns Robert Motherwell's use of black in his work of the last 30 years (William Benton Museum); the other is PhotoRealism: Some Points Of View (Jorgensen Auditorium). The juxtaposition alone is a subject worth discussing but there is space only to note that it implies not just stylistic change but a cultural split worthy of sociological investigation. Under discussion here (the Motherwell will be covered in a future review) is Photorealism, embodied in the work of 14 artists chosen to demonstrate the various ways in which the technique can be used (through April 10).

title: Reasons for Lost Knick Season: Let Us Count the Whys
description: The Knicks were eliminated from the National Basketball Association playoffs Friday night, and it would take almost all the fingers on both hands to list the reasons for it.

title: Giscard's Foreign Policy Is More Gaullist Than de Gaulle's
description: PARIS  While the United States has been going through a series of dramatic foreign successes and setbacks, France has developed a foreign policy which is bringing it warm if not necessarily rewarding relations with practically everybody, including mutual enemies.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
description: With minor variants, then, the political players and social conditions in these countries are similar: All have long been ruled by conservative armybacked regimes which, except in Honduras, have resorted to torture and murder to quell protest. All have tiny elites and impoverished majorities. All have growing popular movements and, again with the exception of Honduras, significant armed leftist bands. All, too, have powerful groups of radical Roman Catholic priests involved in labor

title: Caroline W. Trevor Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bronson Trevor of New York, Mill Neck, L.I., and Paul Smiths, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Caroline Wilmerding Trevor, to Peter Eckart Salas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Saturnine L. Salas of Haddam, Conn.

title: Realty News World Trade Center Getting New Tenants
description: The World Trade Center has acquired several new tenants, including a major brokerage concern that will return to lower Manhattan after a decade's sojourn in midtown.

title: Questions/Answers
description: I want to plant blueberries in my gar den this year and want to acidify my soil organically. I have been told that used coffee grounds are excellent acid com post material. Could I just mix them right into the soil? Ms. E.S., Bronx, N.Y.

title: More Aid Money, Or Just a Wish?
description: WASHINGTON THE Federal agency directly involved has expressed some astonishment over Long Island reports of a major breakthrough in negotiations between Long Island and the Federal Government that would mean millions of dollars in additional Federal aid for Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: Lotus Pool Offers Sound, Motion And Ultimate Relaxation
description: IF gardening is a joyful source of tranquility, then a garden pool must rank as the ultimate source of relaxation. There is a natural affinity that draws man to water, whether it's damming up rainspawned rivulets with the feet of childhood or walking along a stream or ocean beach.

title: The Seeds Of Friendship
description: THERE are three children in this family. If they were to confront a spiderweb in the community garden I belong to, each child would react differently. The .first child would, examine the web and wonder how the spider wove it. The second child would worry a great deal about where the spider was at that particular moment. But the third child would exclaim, as in fact he did one afternoon, Oh, look! A trampoline. One reality, three dimensions. True for the spiderweb, true for the garden.

title: More Foreigners Flee Uganda as Kampala and Entebbe Are Shelled
description: MALABA, Kenya, March 31A steady stream of diplomats and other foreigners crossed the tiny bridge over the muddy Malaba River here today, carrying a few suitcases of belongings and conflicting tales of the fighting in Uganda.

title: Health Fair 79 To Offer Free Tests
description: WHEN a car creaks and groans or fails to hug the road with assurance, the owner usually seeks the help of a mechanic. But when the human body does the same thing sending out distress signals in a 100 or so subtle ways  the owner is more likely than not to ignore the warning signs.

title: Other Ideas & Trends
description: Ireland gets almost a third of its electricity from peat. The city of Leningrad uses peat to produce 17 percent of its power, and other parts of the Soviet Union depend to varying degrees on that primitive fuel. Now a preliminary study for the Office of Energy Resources in Maine has found that the state may have 1.8 billion tons of buried peat, reportedly enough to supply all the electricity the state needs for 200 years. But John Joseph of the energy office said last week that is not known if turning the peat into power would be economically feasible. And there may be environmental tradeoffs, he said. Many of the peat bogs are in places that have been sprayed with pesticides, and environmentalists are afraid that draining them might pollute streams and lakes.

title: Why Paint Peels And How to Stop It
description: WHEN paint cracks, blisters or peels prematurely, the failure is occasionally due to the fact that a poorquality paint was used, or that the wrong type of paint was used for that particular job  but, more often than not, the paint's failure was due to neither one of these two reasons.

title: Free Potatoes Prompt a Near FreeforAll in Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 31  The plan was to drive eight trucks loaded with potatoes into a parking lot, dump the load and open the gates, allowing anybody who wanted free potatoes to pick them up. But it didn't quite work out that way.

title: Food for Thought: Vegetables
description: AS SOON as the ground is in shape, a goodly number of New Jersey homeowners will begin work tin their first vegetable garden.

title: Nancy Ellen Sabert And John E. Rand Set June Wedding
description: The engagement of Nancy Ellen Sabert to John Edwards Rand has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. George Sabert of Chappaqua, N.Y., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Marcell N. Rand of Darien, Conn.

title: The RochesA Highly Promising Pop. Trio
description: The Roches, which will be released on the Warner Brothers label later this week, is the best pop record of 1979 thus far. In fact, it's so superior that it will be remarkable if another disk comes along to supplant it as best album of the year.

title: Light
description: Nothing makes or mars a mood as effectively as correct or incorrect lighting. But all too often it's the least thoughtabout part of interior designin spite of the fact that it can create virtually any desired effect.

title: Graebner Changing Another Net Game
description: The big, solidly built man swatting the ball at the national platform tennis championships had a familiar look. Yes, he was Clark Graebner, still sort of stiffbacked and wearing glasses, still making the big shots.

title: A New Report Shows the City's Finances Are Worse Than Expected
description: HARTFORD  With little success, officials of this city have been trying to focus public attention on its pressing needs. But they have been given an assist with the publication last month of a study of 66 American cities that showed that Hartford was even worse off than they feared. Hartford, the survey showed, is in deeper financial trouble than any other city in the country with a population between 50,000 and 900,000 people.

title: Wary and Ironic
description: Peter Porter's title, The Cost of Seriousness, suggests an issue Important to Geoffrey Hill and Jon Staliworthy as well. All three, as British poets, inherit a tradition chastened by the wary irony of Auden and Larkin.

title: Martha Swope
description: BIOGRAPHY: A GAMEGeorge Morfogen and Pamela Burrell play out a variety of gambits in the comedy by Swiss playwright Max Frisch. The Chelsea Theater Center production will be the play's New York premiere, Thursday at the Westside Theater.

title: Heat Your Pool With Sunshine And Save While You Swim
description: IF you have an unheated swimming pool in the backyard, you've probably noticed a cruel irony around June 1. The air tells you it's summer, time to take a dip. But dangle a foot in the pool, and the water tells you it's winter. Until recently, there was only one way to take that chill out of the water: investing about $500 in a conventional gas heater and $150 per month in fuel to power it. Now, though, there's a better way  a solar pool heater.

title: Letters TO THE EDITOR
description: Joseph Wershba's excellent piece on Murrow vs. McCar thy: See It Now (March 4) brought back vividly and mov ingly that turning point in a terrifying period of our na tion's growth. It was reassur ing to have it pointed out that Edward R. Murrow's coura geous act was, indeed, the pivot on which others found it possible to turn and mount an effective reaction to the man who seemed to be frightening everyone into inaction. What a remarkable man Edward R. Murrow was!

title: McEnroe, Alexander Reach W.C.T. Final
description: MILAN, Italy, March 31 (UPI) John McEnroe and Australia's John Alexander fought their way into the final of a World Championship Tennis tournament today with straightset semifinal victories.

title: Presenting the Amazing Shuberts  Bernie & Gerry
description: I ?? unlikely that any two people dominate that part of the of the entertainment business as thoroughly as ?? Schoenfeld and Bernard B. Jacobs, Mr. Schoenfeld and Mr. Jacobs, the chairman and president respectively of the Shubert Organizaton on practice the title are interchangeable and therefore mean ungless) lower over the world of commeticial theater. Coffectively, they are known as the Shuberts and individually on ?? part of Boalway, as Bernad and ?? way day ?? flourishing and while they ?? essarily take all the credit for the ?? that Broadway flourishes with them, they do not ?? it, either ?? and Broadway's they suggest beat as one.

title: A DutchFrench Island With Appeal for the Whole Family
description: Like most of the tourists I know who vacationed on the island of Sint Maarten/St. Martin this year, we have already made our reservations for next year  a place to stay, a car to drive, even dinner reservations at a superb restaurant. We planned ahead in selfdefense: it was the only way to secure the best room and board on the dates of our choice for one of the most popular islands in the Caribbean. In 1977, tourism there broke all previous records with 269,545 visitors; last year, it increased almost 10 percent .

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: A Medley of TalentAnd Responsibility
description: AS flattering as it is to be asked to lecture or teach or perform or give demonstrations or do workshops or be active as a public presence, said Judith Lang Zaimont, our main responsibility is to write music. Composers may be America's leastdevelopednatural resource because our energy is so dissipated in these various demands.

title: Correction
description: In the issue of Mar. 25 Daniel Lang's A Backward Look was ascribed to the wrong publisher. The book was published by McGrawHill.

title: Headliners
description: The second Adlai Stevenson, twice a Presidential candidate, was often accused of indecisiveness. Suth is not the case with his son, Senator Adlal E. Stevenson 3d, who announced last week that he would not seek reelection to a third term next year, and indeed had made that decision two years ago but waited a while before announcing it. Senator Stevenson's motives were not altogether clear, and he sent word through his press secretary that he would not answer questions until Mqpday. But he is felt to be slipping among his home voters in Illinois, and, in any case, he said in February the Senate can'e a distraction for serious public servants.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Why, Stanley, I said, you look terrific. Where've you been? Sunning yourself a tar paper roof?

title: Easy to Grow, Colorful Gourds Are Decorative  and Useful
description: GOURDS are afterthought plants. If people grow them at all, it's usually because they pick up one of the garden center's colorful seed packs at the last minute. Then the seeds are stuck in at the edge of the vegetable patch  or just as often forgotten because there's no room left in the garden. Now I'm not suggesting you plan to make gourds a major crop. But if you haven't been growing them, consider what you've been missing.

title: Births
description: STEIN

title: Robb Gets 3 Goals In Victory by Fury
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 31 (AP) David Robb, who scored more than 100 goals during a career with Aberdeen in Scotland's First Division, scored three goals today to give the Philadelphia Fury a 30 victory over the Rochester Lancers.

title: To Suburban Readers
description: Every Sunday, hundreds of additional suburban real estate offerings will be found in the classified advertisement columns of this section forHighspeed computer printing technology enables us to bring you these zoned advertisements  special for your area  interspersed among the fullrun offerings.

title: Miss Blazejowski Leads Victory by Allentown Five
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., March 31 (AP)  Carol Blazeiowski continued her high scoring today in the 52d annual Amateur Athletic Union women's national basketball tournament. She poured in 44 points in leading the Allentown Crestettes to a 10087 triumph over the 20th Century Blazers of Philadelphia in the loser's bracket final.

title: Islanders Beat Sabres, 20; Resch Is Standout in Goal
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 31 At time when Buffalo was playing as well as it had in the last four seasons, it looked as if the New York Islanders would have a difficult time against the Sabres tonight in the Nassau Coliseum.

title: The Nation
description: The White House last week backed off its shotgunwedding approach to a new teamsters contract and decided instead to offer its blessing to a settlement that would exceed the 7 percent wage increase guideline.

title: Radio
description: 77:30 A.M., WBLS: Tenant Survival Program.

title: Let's Forget Spring
description: CONGRATULATIONS, Long Island. Spring has come at last! Wet, dingy drizzles. Screaming kids. The I.R.S.

title: Army Officials Alarmed by Drop In Number of Women Recruits
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (AP)  For the first time, the Army is failing to enlist enough women to meet its recruiting objective, and Army officials, alarmed at the development, say that there may be major problems in maintaining an allvolunteer force if the trend continues.

title: ... Zoning by Closing Rooms
description: I was shaking, said Margie Jones, a resident of 2 East 82d Street. It was like The Cask of Amontillado  my God, we're going to be bricked in.

title: Democrats in Iowa Organize Group to Back Kennedy
description: DES MOINES, March 31  A band of dissident Democrats, drawn largely from labor ranks and mostly enthusiasts of Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts, met here today to express their disappointment in the Carter Administration and ended up forming an Exploratory Committee for a Democratic Alternative.

title: Kuwait Tries to Revive Parliamentary Democracy
description: KUWAIT  Ever since the revolution in neighboring Iran, efforts have been made to revive Kuwait's democratic system.

title: A Mamaroneck Bookshop That's Just the
description: FOR Elaine Feiden of Mamaroneck, it began in Greenwich Village in the early years of her marriage, when she habitually browsed in the book shops and street stalls of the neighborhood. A small volume illustrated by Dore caught her eye one day and she was off on the kind of treasure hunt that enchants bibliophiles.

title: Legislators Must Alter SchoolAid Formula, Carey Tells Teachers
description: DIX HILLS, L.I., March 31  Governor Carey took his campaign for a revision in local school financing to a meeting of leaders of a teachers union today, saying that the Legislature must act to equalize educational spending across the state or face being told to do so by the courts.

title: Heat Your Pool With Sunshine And Save While You Swim
description: IF you have an unheated swimmidg pool in the backyard, you've probably noticed a cruel irony around June 1. The air tells you it's summer, time to take a dip. But dangle a foot in the pool, and the water tells you it's winter. Until recently, there was only one way to take that chill out of the water: investing about $500 in a conventional gas heater and $150 per month in fuel to power it. Now, though, there's a better way  a solar pool heater.

title: Television in Canada Details the Activities Of Underworld There
description: TORONTO, March 31  Miltions of Canadians got a startling peek into their country's criminal underworld this week through a dramatic television documentary that featured heavy use of hidden cameras and microphones.

title: Canadiens 5, Penguins 3
description: MONTREAL, March 31 (UPI) Guy Lafleur reached the 50goal plateau for the fourth consecutive season tonight as the Montreal Canadiens defeated Pittsburgh, 53, snapping the Penguins 10game undefeated streak.

title: Where to FindTasteful Statuary
description: SAY garden ornaments, and pink flamingoes may fly to mind. But even companies that sell plastic wildlife often carry a few pieces of tasteful statuary.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: By mandate of the Legislature in Olympia, the State of Washington's Department of Social and Health Services set up a tollfree telephone hot line on July 1, 1976, and promised anonymity to any citizens who reported suspected cases of welfare fraud. Critics, including the American Civil Liberties Union, protested that any program that encouraged neighbors to inform on one another smacked of Gestapo tactics.

title: Paula Burstein Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Burstein of Riverdale, the Bronx, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Paula Burstein, to Leonard G. Kamlet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Kamlet of Brooklyn. The wedding is planned for June 9 in Hempstead, L.I.

title: Full of Promising Material
description: ENRY B ROM ELL, whose first collection of stories, The Slightest Distance, was an understated and highly promising achievement, seems to have come up with about 132 pages of inchoate material in this new collection. Some of it is clotted

title: Toward SALT: America the Vulnerable
description: Any day now, SALT II will be before the country, triggering the fiercest debate in a decade about America's military posture and relations with the Soviet Union. President Carter has promised that the complicated arms control agreement will be safe and in the national interest. He will be opposed by a large faction that deems the accord dangerous or useless, lulling the country into a position of permanent strategic inferiority. He will be opposed also by a smaller faction that finds the treaty marginally helpful but not worth the price of the massive new weapons buildup that he must promise to win its ratification. The air will be thick with facts about the unknowable. But the principal issues are not hard to define.

title: Theresa Corsentino Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Corsentino of Brookville, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Theresa Marie Corsentino, to Angelo A. Leone, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Leone of Glen Cove, L.I. The wedding is planned for Oct. 7.

title: Can Consolidation Help Our Schools?
description: THE specter of school consolidation has appeared once again in New Jersey. In a letter to the State Board of Education, Governor Byrne urged that it should . consider the advantages and disadvantages of combining school districts and ... recommend ways to en courage such consolidation of districts or services.

title: L.M. Thayer Fianc Of Natalie Rogers
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Harrison Rogers 2d of Cincinnati of the engagement of their daughter, Natalie Titus Rogers, to Louis Miller Thayer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Thayer, also of Cincinnati. The wedding is planned for Sentember.

title: Navy Bars Recruiting To Beat of Disco Tune
description: SAN DIEGO, March 31 (AP)  The Navy has decided that it will not be recruiting to the beat of the hit disco tune In the Navy, recorded by the Village People.

title: A Sense of Urgency Rides County Roads.
description: ALBANY FOR a number of reasons, both political and practical, the future of the East Hudson Parkway Authority and the network of county parkways it has maintained over the last 19 years is emerging as a priority issue not only for the Westchester County delegation in the State Legislature, but also for the legislative leadership.

title: Peking Placing a Ban on AntiCommunist Posters
description: PEKING, March 31 (Reuters)  The rnunicial authorities announced a prohibition today on antiCommunist propaganda and a crackdown on some political activists in reaction against the freer public debate of recent months.

title: In Frigid Siberia, Even U.S. Machines Fail
description: NERYUNGRI, U.S.S.R.As this decade opened, the Russians had a dream: Western investment and Western technology would help them to open the riches  Coal, oil, natural gas, minerals from under the endless forests of Siberia. At the end of the decade the dream seems fragile in the vastness of the land and shrunken by its frigidity.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The first circulating silver dollarsize coin was struck for the Archduke Sigismund of Tyrol in 1486. This granddaddy of all large silver pieces was also the first in the field with its type of dating. The coin is part of the current exhibit at the Smithsonian's National Museum of History and Technology in Washington.

title: ATOM POWER CURBS PRESSED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  The nuclear accident at the Three Mile Island reactor station in Pennsylvania prompted demands today for new laws and regulations tightening Federal control over the operation of atomic reactors and brought suggestions for new emphasis upon coal as an energy source.

title: For Egypt: Aid Not Trade Is the Priority For Peace
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian official chuckled when he was asked about peacetime prospects for economic cooperation with Israel. The Israelis are a deficit country like we are. We are two beggars, he quipped.

title: CHINA REVEALS FATE OF PURGED LEADERS
description: HONG KONG, March 31  In a break with its tradition of secrecy on the fate of leaders purged from office, China has disclosed that when Peng Dehuai, a Defense Minister and military hero, was ousted in 1959 he was confined to an old village in Peking's western suburbs.

title: S.E.C. SUIT EPOR1ED ON PERILED CONCERN
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  The Securities and Exchange Commission is preparing to file suit against the International Systems and Control Corporation, the Houstonbased construction and engineering company that has already acknowledged making more than $20 million in questionable payments abroad, according to sources close to the company.

title: A QuarterCentury in a HomeBuilt House
description: IUSED to be fond of telling our children the history of our home. See that corner, I'd say, that where I fell off the scaffold. And keep your fingers off the wall, your father cut his leg with the Skil saw when he framed it.

title: Fatal Fire in Jersey City Still Under Investigation
description: The cause of a tenement fire in Jersey City that killed five persons on Friday night was still under investigation yesterday, fire officials reported.

title: Margaret Stroock Bride Of Andrew Low, Lawyer
description: The marriage of Margaret Mary Stroock, a lawyer with the New York firm of Webster & Sheffield, to Andrew Martin Low, a lawyer with Rogers & Wells of New York, took place yesterday in Jackson, Wyo. The Rev. John Hannah, an Episcopal clergyman, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Strook of Casper, Wyo., and Jackson. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Low of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y.

title: A Corner of Islam in Paris
description: Tourists in Paris who want a taste of Islamic life may wish to visit La Mosque de Paris, a white stucco building near the Jardin des Plantes that is a center for the city's Moslem life.

title: Michigan Rejects Suit On Man's Hospital Stay
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., March 31 The Michigan Attorney General's office formally stated this week that there was no reason why the state should pay $3 million in damages to Jack Smith, 54 years old, who has spent almost his entire life in institutions because he was diagnosed as mentally retarded at birth.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: If you ask Morton N. Cohen, whose twovolume edition of Lewis Carroll's letters will be published by Oxford in May, how long he has been working on it, he'll say, Forever. Forever turns out to be 20 years, but an outsider can get an idea of the magnitude of the task from a register that Carroll (pen name of Charles Dodgson) kept in the last 37 years of his life recording the letters he sent and received: The last figure is 98,721.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: THE president of the Bar Association of Nassau County, Edwin J. Freedman, recently expressed deep concern with the legal profession in general and with his association.

title: A Congressional Genration Gap Emerges on Role of Government
description: WASHINGTON, March 31  Representative Carl D. Perkins, a veteran Democrat from Kentucky, wants more money for vocational education when that program comes up for renewal this year. We have to hold fast to programs we've enacted in the past, he said, and make sure they're not hamstrung because of lack of funds.

title: Blues and Jazz and Pop
description: THIS latest collection of profiles by Whitney Ballieu, jazz critic of The New Yorker, focuses on singers he describes as American nonclassical. He uses this term to describe those who sing blues and/or jazz or pop, as the latter term is applied to the work of George Gershwin, Jerome Kern, Cole

title: DINING OUT Middle Eastern Food Without Zing
description: DANBURY

title: Nassau: Missing Numbers
description: I AM pleased that the recent article by two of my former students, Messrs. Salant aid Fleisher, has sparked in these columns a discussion of county legislatures. I found especially valuable Ms. Eleanor Berger's lettr reminding us of the League of Women Voter's unsuccessful struggle to have Nassau's system of a weightedvoting Board of Supervisors declared unconstitutional. There is, however, one ironical fact that I would add to her account  a fact that, as far as I can tell, has never. been publicly acknowledged: It is that the League of Women Voters and the Nassau Democrats might well have been successful in their court battle if only New York's highest court, the Court of Appeals, had not made an egregious error in arithmetic.

title: LastMinute Petitions For Bhutto Are Filed, Against His Objection
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 31Against his wishes, political associates of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto filed lastminute appeals with President Mohammed Zia ulHaq today to spare the life of the former Prime Minister. He has been sentenced to be hanged for conspiring to murder a political opponent in 1974.

title: Why Paint Peels And How to Stop It
description: WHEN paint cracks, blisters or peels prematurely, the failure is occasionally due to the fact that a poorquality paint was used, or that the wrong type of paint was used for that particular job  but, more often than not, the paint's failure was due to neither one of these two reasons.

title: ARABS A6REE TO CUT ALL TIES WITH EGYPT BECAUSE OF TREATY
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, March 31  The forelgn ministers of conservative and radical Arab countries adopted a series of resolutions today calling for the severing of all economic and diplomatic relations with Egypt in retaliation for its signing of a peace treaty with Israel.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: CHARLES DICKENS: His Tragedy and Triumph, by Edgar Johnson. (Penguin, $1.95.) A revision and abridgment of a twovolume study that was hailed as the definitive biography when it was published 1952. It thoroughly covers Charles Dickens's 58 productive years as novelist, editor and public figure, offers competent readings of his writing but never quite finds the inner man.

title: 250-Year-Old Church Recalls Its Queen
description: WHEN a group of English settlers established a congregation in Setauket in 1723, they decided to name the church after Caroline of Ansbach, Queen of England. Hardly bashful about their intentions, the British subjects then asked the Bishop of London if the Queen could send them a gift in return for the honor. The Queen responded by sending a silver communion service, which is still in the possession of the Caroline Episcopal Church of Brookhaven in Setauket  now the second- or thirdoldest Episcopal, church building in continual use in the Colonies, and now celebrating the 250th anniversary of its construction.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A frontal band of clouds embedded with showers and thunderstorms can be seen extending from New England through the Ohio Valley and into Texas. Low level clouds stretch from the lake region to the Southern Plains States, while broken clouds cover the Northern Plains States.

title: Home Bodies
description: For nights at home, a shift to easy clothes induces a feeling of relaxation.

title: ANTIQUES
description: SPRING is here, and so is a fresh bouquet of antiques shows. Among them is Newark Academy's fourth annual Antiques Show and Sale, which the school's Mothers Association is holding for the benefit of the academy. It opens next Saturday and runs through April 9.

title: Meat Your Pool With Sunshine And Save While You Swim
description: IF you have an unheated swimming pool in the backyard, you've probably noticed a cruel irony. around June 1. The air tells you it's summer, time to take a dip. But dangle a foot in the pool, and the water tells you it's winter. Until recently, there was only one way to take that chill out of the water: investing about $500 in a conventional gas heater and $150 per month in fuel to power it. Now, though, there's a better way  a solar pool heater.

title: The Industrial State  A Persistent Myth
description: THE term industrial Northeast rolls off the tongue easily and seems to require no thought. Everybody knows that manufacturing is heavily concentrated in the industrial Northeast, with New Jersey a prominent part of the region.

title: ON THE ISLE
description: Libraries used to be strictly for reading. Suburbia, though, changed them into allpurpose cultural shrines. Just how allpurpose is evident from a sampling of activities that will occur this week as the Island's libraries celebrate National Library Week. For example, in Bellmore there's a Musical History of Jazz lecturedemonstration today at 2:30 P.M. (2288 Bedford Avenue), while in another musical vein, the Syosset Library (225 South Oyster Bay ROad) will present the Long Island Chamber Ensemble at 8:30 P.M. Saturday.

title: Cannibals of the Imagination
description: The ubiquitous belief in cannibals just beyond the borders of one's culture is timehonored.

title: International Baton Twirlers Give Venice a Whirl
description: VENICE, April 1  To the utter astonishment of the Venetians, tourists and pigeons in the Piazza San Marco this afternoon, some 200 baton twirlers from nine nations strutted their stuff here, giving many of the 10,000 onlookers their first glimpse of this curiosity born in Small Town, U.S.A.

title: Tokyo Dollar Rate Hits 9Month High
description: TOKYO, April 1 (AP)  The dollar reached a ninemonth high on the Tokyo foreignexchange market today, opening at 209.80 yen. In hectic early trading, the dollar continued last week's rally, moving to 210 yen compared with Friday's close of 209.275 yen. Dealers said the announcement of a drop in the United States trade deficit for February gave the dollar strength.

title: Precautionary Evacuation Plan Is Studied for a 25Mile Radius of Nuclear Plant
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 1City and county civil defense directors across central and eastern Pennsylvania were briefed today on the details of a precautionary evacuation plan said to be capable of relocating in one day as many as 300,000 people.

title: Tanzania Bombs Entebbe Airport, Damaging Runway
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April 1Tanzanian jets bombed Uganda's international airport at Entebbe early today, damaging the main runway, reliable diplomatic sources in East Africa said.

title: Issues in Walkout by Teamsters
description: Parties: About 1,700 American trucking companies are covered by the national Master Freight Agreement The industry is represented in the negotiations by Trucking Management Inc.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: Jones, an American League pitcher, is so good a hitter that he bats for himself. During the game he is taken out for another pitcher. Can he remain in the game as the designated hitter for the new pitcher?

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Just when everybody seems convinced that the corporate world is the sole province of managers and technocrats, up pops a maverick businessman who doesn't fit the mold. Often that person is Thomas Mellon Evans. After having acquired some 80 companies, he still seems never to have heard about the managerial revolution.

title: Elinore Bachman, Artist, Married to William Thompson
description: Grace Episcopal Church in Brooklyn Heights was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Elinore Bachman of Brooklyn, widow of Ed. ward K. Bachman, to William H. Thompson, a widower, of Menlo Park, Calif. The Rev. F. Goldthwaite Sherrill performed the ceremony.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN a book called The Russian Mind, the Oxford historian Ronald Hingley discusses the concept of vranyo, which he calls the national brand of leg pulling, ribbing or blarney. To accuse someone of vranyo, he says, involves little more than the affectionate charge of possessing a lively imagination: You're kidding. In addition to vranyo, there is zaviratsya, which he translates as to prevaricate oneself into a condition of trance.

title: Relative Asks Mercy for Bhutto, Raising Hopes of His Supporters
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, April 1  A half sister of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto has filed a petition asking presidential clemency for the condemned former Prime Minister, another member of the family disclosed today.

title: Chicago Vote Tomorrow; Jane Byrne Big Favorite
description: CHICAGO, April 1  With the campaign for Mayor of Chicago droning through its final weekend, a leading political pollster here said he could see no prospect of change in the trend that has made Jane M. Byrne, the Democrat, an overwhelming favorite to defeat her Republican opponent, Wallace D. Johnson, in Tuesday's voting.

title: Republicans Seek to Regain Seat Of Slain Representative on Coast
description: SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO, April 1 Hundreds of thousands of travelers have seen California's 11th Congressional District in splendid basrelief. The view comes on takeoff from San Francisco on a clear day as the jet breasts the west wind pouring in from the sea along the edge of the San Bruno Mountains.

title: Supplementary OTC Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Khomeini Declares Victory in Vote For a Government of God in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 1  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini declared an overwhelming victory today after a twoday referendum on whether Iran should be an Islamic republic, and he proclaimed April 1 the first day of a Government of God.

title: Chinese Remove Wall Posters and Activists Condemn Policy Change
description: HONG KONG, April 1  Chinese authorities today ordered workers to remove posters from walls in the center of the capital, backing up their decision to halt the brief experiment in greater freedom of expression.

title: Details of Fuelteck's Stock Offering Clarified
description: Last Jan. 30, Fuelteck, a company in Deer Park, L.I., made an initial public offering of 200,000 shares at $1 each, and those shares subsequently traded as high as $16 a share before trading was suspended on March 1 for 10 days by the Securities and Exchange Commission. In an article March 2, Business Day incorrectly reported that 90 days after that public offering, the seven original shareholders would be free to sell a small portion of their holdings.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: T.P.R.: Islanders Are No. 1
description: This week's team power ratings, The New York Times's final computerized evaluation of National Hockey League clubs for this season, finds the Montreal Canadiens out of the No. 1 spot fur the first time. The new occupants are the New York Islanders, who had a wonlosttied record of 502 in the two weeks ended last Monday, the final evaluation period. The Canadiens, meanwhile, were 330 in their fall to second place.

title: Around the Nation
description: CLEVELAND, April 1 (UPI)  Anthony (Tony Lib) Liberatore, one of the Federal Bureau of Invesigation's Ten Most Wanted suspects, was arrested by F.B.I agents and local policemen early today 13 months after his indictment in the carbomb killing of an underworld rival.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: JOHN M. SHERIDAN

title: Jazz: Preservation Hall Band
description: IT must be April because the Preservation Hall Jazz Band was at Avery Fisher Hall yesterday afternoon. Like the swallows at Capistrano, the annual arrival of this septet of New Orleans veterans is an unfailing harbinger of spring, and an enthusiastic full house as well.

title: Music: Two Guests Join Tarr Brass Ensemble
description: THE Edward Tarr Brass Ensemble was founded by an American 11 years ago and has since won itself a place among the leading brass groups in Europe. Yet the group has never toured the United States before. Now it is doing so, and on Saturday afternoon eight brass players of the ensemble, with an organist and a percussionist in tow, showed up at Alice Tully Hall.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Resources Management Corporation, an oil exploration and real estate company, has named David M. Kennedy, former Secretary of the Treasury, as a director.

title: Piano: Bennett Lerner
description: BOSENDORFER pianos have been turning up with increasing frequency at New York recitals. Typically, they, are mellow instruments that offer a distinct alternative to the more brilliant Steinways one normally encounters.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A band of frontal cloudiness with showers and thundershowers extends from New England through the Ohio Valley to Texas. Broken to overcast low and middle level cloudiness covers the Plains States, the Rockies and the Pacific Northwest. A narrow band of cirrus cloudsatretches from the Southern Plains States to western Texas.

title: Prices Rise For Metals
description: Asarco Inc., the big metals producer, has announced a 2centapound increase in the price of zinc, effective immediately. The new price will be 39.50 cents a pound for prime western zinc. At the same time, the company said it was cutting the price of its electrolytic copper by 2 cents to $1 a pound, effective immediately.

title: Jane Cobb Berry Dies; Writer of Girls' Novels And Magazine Stories
description: Jane Cobb Berry, author of short stories and children's books, died Saturday in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital, She was 64 years old and a lived in Weston, Conn.

title: WALKOUT IS STARTED BY TUGBOAT CREWS
description: A union of 2,800 tugboat, barge and tanker crewmen on the Eastern Seaboard, with most of its members in the New YorkNew Jersey metropolitan aria, went on strike yesterday.

title: Cluett Completes Merger
description: Cluett, Peabody & Company said that it had completed its acquisition of Duofold Inc., a maker of doublelayer underwear and turtleneck sportswear.

title: CAREY SEEKS POWER TO MERGE 11 COURTS AND SELECT JUDGES
description: Governor Carey plans to ask the Legislature today for legislation that would merge 11 types of trial courts in the state into one statewide court and would empower him to choose the several hundred, judges involved.

title: Mexico Promotes Steel Process
description: PUEBLA, Mexico  On a dusty plain adjoining this largely agricultural town east of Mexico City stands one of those anomalies that makes Mexico so unpredictable: a steelmaking facility that is among the most advanced in the world.

title: Precautionary Action Urged
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 1 Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California today asked the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to temporarily close the Rancho Seco nuclear plant near Sacramento as a precautionary measure in light of the accident at a power plant in Pennsylvana.

title: Commodities
description: WHAT does soybean have to do with a barrel of Arabian oil? great deal, because soybeans are an important export for the United States.

title: Bullets Motta Notches 500th Triumph
description: Because Dick Motta believed that college coaches often fail in the National Basketball Association, it was with some apprehension that he left Weber State in 1968 to become coach of the Chicago Bulls. But now Motta is in his 11th pro coaching season and has won a championship with his second team, the Washington Bullets. He earned his 500th victory yesterday when his team defeated the Denver Nuggets, 10589, at the Capital Centre in Landover, Md.

title: Notes on People
description: For years, he had worked to bring the Greek Orthodox Church closer to other Christian denominations and different faiths, so nothing less than a joyous ecumenical service would have been fitting to commemorate Archbishop lakovos's 20th anniversary as the church's Primate in the Americas.

title: Cargo Volume Up 10% In the Port During 1978
description: The Port Authority's foreign oceanborne cargo trade rebounded sharply last year, according to a study by the agency.

title: Danielle B. Scores at Aqueduct
description: A display of her usual early speed paid off big for Our Precious Stable's Danielle B. yesterday at Aqueduct. The 3yearold daughter of Don B. jumped into the lead at the start of the $55,000 Rare Perfume Stakes and set the pace for the rest of the race.

title: Waits Victor at Dayton
description: DAYTON, Ohio, April 1 (UPI) Butch Waits served 21 aces today as he posted a 63, 64 victory over Marty Riessen in the final match of the Dayton pro tennis tournament.

title: John Mercado, Realty Aide, Weds Robin Lisa Anderson
description: Robin Lisa Anderson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Anderson, was married yesterday afternoon to John Mercado, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carlos Mercado. Both families live in the Bronx. The Rev. Clifton E. Gatewood performed the ceremony in the Mount Calvary United Methodist Church in Manhattan.

title: Europe Toughens Stand Against Japan's Exports
description: PARIS, April 1  The Common Market is taking an increasingly tough stand against Japanese exports just days before representatives of the nine member nations are scheduled to give final approval to a trade liberalization package worked out in Geneva.

title: $750,000 Jewelry Theft Called Inside Job
description: An estimated $750,000 in gold and silver was stolen Saturday from the Greenwich Village loft of one of the world's largest manufacturers of religiously symbolic jewelry, according to the police, who believe the burglars had inside help or information.

title: Bridge:
description: A major upset marked Grand National Team play at Montvale, N.J. yesterday afternoon. The topseeded group  Ron Gerard and Monroe Ingberman of White Plains, Gene O'Neill of Verona, N.J., and Bill Pollack of Teaneck, N.J.  lost by 1 international match point after leading by 27 points at the midway stage in the quarterfinals of the New YorkNew Jersey district.

title: Sporting Gear
description: You say racquetball's a great game  for the winter? How about racquetball in the summer, outdoors and without walls? If this sounds impossible, you haven't heard of Racquetball Without the Walls, a new game and training device. R.W.W. consists of two regularsize racquets and a ball attached by a 12foot stretch band to a weighted base of slightly less than two pounds. The ball is of the same weight and dimensions as an official one, but it is made of tougher material to withstand rough surfaces. Players take turns hitting it, on one or two bounces, and the rebound action is similar to that of a ball coming off a front, side or back wall or the ceiling. The price is under $35 at Sears and J.C. Penney, or on an order directly to Jokari, 4 Lemmon Park East, Dallas 75209.

title: TV: The Scarlet Letter Begins on Channel 13
description: THE Scarlet Letter represents an important project for public television. It is the system's first serial production of a classic novel, marking a much needed step in the direction of an area seemingly monopolized by the British. And it is a bigticket item, requiring a considerable financial investment from a broadcasting entity that is perennially strapped for funds.

title: UNITED LAYING OFF 13,300 IN WALKOUT
description: CHICAGO, April 1 (AP) United Airlines announced today that it was laying off 13;300 pilots, attendants and other crew members because of the strike that has grounded all its daily flights.

title: Opening Ritual Of Trout Season
description: FOR the second year in a row, soft, warm breezes and excellent water conditions greeted anglers throughout much of New York State yesterday on the opening of the trout season.

title: Evangelical Group Offers Campus Lectures
description: RUSTON, La., March 29  A group of evangelical Christians has found a new way of reaching collegeage Americans  by offering classroom lecturers in a broad variety of subjects.

title: Watson Is 5Stroke Victor
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., April  Tom Watson took a leisurely walk in the warm South Carolina sun today to go through the formalities of winning the 11th Heritage Golf Classic. Hereally won it yesterday, when he finished the third round with an unassailable eightstroke lead. But the rules require 72 holes for a tournament, so he completed the final round today with a relaxed, easygoing, norisk 71, par for the elegant Harbour Town Golf Links.

title: New York and Jersey Report No Excess Radioactivity Despite Pattern of Winds
description: Health and environmental officials in New York and New Jersey said yesterday that continuing tests had disclosed that no excess radiation had drifted over the two states from the crippled Three Mile Island nuclear power plant near Middletown, Pa., despite a generally eastward flow of surface winds over the weekend.

title: Italians Consider Spring Elections
description: ROME, April 1  The 82yearold President of Italy, Sandro Pertini, was reported today to be consulting by phone with political leaders on whether Italy should hold national elections this spring, as Austria, Britain and Luxembourg will.

title: Opera: Ashley Putnam Is.Daughter of Regiment
description: DONIZETTI's The Daughter of the.Regiment returned to the City Opera's repertory yesterday afternoon and received a captivating performance. Fortunately the current proceedings bear little resemblance to the coarse, vulgar travesty that Lotfi Monsouri directed in September 1975 when this production first came to New York.

title: CORRECTION
description: A Market Place column in Business Day on March 2 incorrectly reported certain facts concerning the Fuelteck Corporation and its initial public offering of common stock. A corrective article??ppears on Page D4.

title: Miss Sullivan Wed To David Gardiner
description: Elizabeth Anne Sullivan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard C. Sullivan of Villanova, Pa., was married yesterday to David McLane Gardiner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Gardiner of Manchester, Mass. The Rev. Kenneth Blindenbacher performed the ceremony at St. David's Episcopal Church in Wayne, Pa.

title: Maple Leafs 6, Sabres 3
description: BUFFALO, April 1 (UPI)  Lanny McDonald scored three goals, including the 200th of his career, and assisted on another tonight to lead the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 63 triumph over the Buffalo Sabres.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: With Inflation soaring and with credit demand rising, the bond markets last week nevertheless managed to move higher in price and lower in yield. To some industry analysts, this puzzling behavior seemed the most significant development of the week, and a few asserted it might set the overall trend for fixedincome securities this spring.

title: Seena Mufson Is Married To Thomas Peck, Broker
description: Seena Mufson, communications projects manager of the J.C. Penney Company in New York, and Thomas S. Peck, a vice president of Freeman Securities Inc. in Jersey City, were married at noon yesterday. The ceremony was performed in the Watteau Suite of the St. RegisSheraton by Rabbi David Seligson.

title: A Tribal Rite for Pious Idiots
description: IT WAS night and rain was falling in hissing sheets when a car pulled into the darkened town of Roscoe, N.Y., where the Beaverkill and Willowemoc meet in the Junction Pool to form the Big Beaverkill. Gentlemen, Sparse Grey Hackle said, remove your hats. This is it.

title: ESSAY
description: MONTREAL  An election campaign has begun that will determine how soon Canada breaks up into its English and French components.

title: Chinese Stage a New Production Of Play About the Life of Galilee
description: TOKYO, April 1 (AP)  The Life of Galileo, a play by Bertolt Brecht, opened in Peking yesterday, the first contemporary foreign play to be staged in China since 1966, the New China News Aaencv said.

title: Hawks 109, Nets 98
description: ATLANTA, April 1 (AP)  Dan Roundfield led a 209 surge in the fourth quarter that gave Atlanta a commanding lead, and the Hawks withstood a late New Jersey rally tonight to capture a 10998 victory over the Meta

title: Backlog Clouds Bond List
description: The credit markets financing schedule this week is still indefinite because of a backlog of more than $16 billion of Treasury security offerings postponed by the failure of Congress to raise the ceiling on the national debt.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Chinaglia's GhostDaunts roman Star
description: ROME

title: Toward SALT: Missile Hide and Seek
description: In our discussion of American nuclear strategy yesterday, we left America's landbased Minuteman missiles vulnerable in their underground silos, at least theoretically open to a Soviet surprise attack after 1983. Our weapon builders, to be sure, are rushing to the rescue with new designs. The experts concur that another arms control agreement with the Soviet Union will be acceptable only if the Administration also undertakes a major improvement in our land missiles. The question now is how to overcome the vulnerability without undermining further arms controls.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: EAST BERLIN  Music with a political theme is unlikely to rise to the level of art, but in at least one case it reaches the sublime. That is Beethoven's Fidelio, with its theme of freedom. Who, seeing that opera, can remain unmoved when the prisoners shuffle out of their cells into the sunlight and sing O Freiheit, Freiheit? To hear Fidelio at the German State Opera in East Berlin is an extraordinary experience. Did the prisoners chorus have a special meaning for many in the audience the other night, or was that only the political reaction of a Western visitor? In any event it was a superb performance, the prisoners compellingly gray and Brechtian.

title: Sports World Specials
description: And everybody thought that Leo Durocher was the manager whom baseball umpires would most like to see staked to an anthill.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Energy

title: Survey Sees Steady Pace For Job Creation in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 (UPI)  A survey of 6,000 companies indicates that more than 1.5 million American workers will join the ranks of the employed from April through June, Manpower Inc., the private temporaryhelp agency, reported today.

title: No Title
description: Deaths

title: Newspaper in Argentina Reports That Shah Wants to Settle There
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 1 (AP)  A newspaper here said today that Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi wants to settle in Argentina and that friends of the former Iranian ruler have been in touch with Government officials here to find out whether he would be welcome.

title: A Sunday Drive In Search of Gas Taking Longer
description: Drivers hunting for fuel in the metropolitan area yesterday had to drive a little farther than usual, because many gasoline dealers in the area were closed for the day.

title: Farm Family Keeps One Eye on Nuclear Power Plant, the Other on Dairy Herd
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., April 1  Last Friday, the Holsteins on the Lytle Farm started acting kind of touchy, lining up side by side at the fence and staring south. That was two days after the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant, five miles due south as the cow stares, started generating fear instead of electricity.

title: Congressman Shifts on Plant
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 1 (AP)  A formerly staunch advocate of nuclear power, Representative Edward P. Beard, Democrat of Rhode Island, withdrew his support today for a proposed nuclear power plant in Charlestown, R.I. Mr. Beard said in an interview that he changed his mind after reading about the accident at the Three Mile Island plan.

title: The U.N. Today
description: April 2, 1979

title: Despite Their Ruinous Effect on Economy, Political Favors Are Way of Life in Greece
description: ATHENS  A father fears that his son has not done well in the civil service examination and wants to insure that he will be hired anyway. A farmer wants to alter the path of a proposed road that would cross his land. A mother wants to find a good secretarial job for her daughter. A high school student flunks a course and wants his grade changed. A teacher wants to be transferred from her as signed post in a village school to a more cosmopolitan area.

title: Umpire Asks Peers to Settle
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., April 1 Paul Pryor, who broke ranks with his fellow umpires last weekend, called today for quick settlements in the labor dispute so that we can begin a new season.

title: 700 Headstones VandalizedAt Jewish Cemeteries on S.I.
description: Nearly 700 gravestones were found overturned, damaged or defaced at two Jewish cemeteries on Staten Island over the weekend, and Borough President Anthony R. Gaeta said yesterday that plainclothes police officers would be immediately assigned to these and other Jewish cemeteries .mi. Staten Island to prevent further episodes.

title: Test to Vent Gas Bubble In Simulator Is a Success
description: MUD LAKE, Idaho, April 1  After testing a proposed method of diluting a hydrogen gas bubble that is endangering the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania, scientists set off for Harrisburg from the simulation laboratory here to coordinate their efforts with those of officials there.

title: Split Among Jersey Cubans Is Pointed Up by Bombings
description: UNION CITY, N.J.  Bergenline Avenue is a bustling oneway street whose shops, smells, sounds, people and language speak of Cuba. The bustle comes from the revival of this city just across the Hudson River from midtown Manhattan, which has taken its life again and again from waves of immigrants.

title: PROTECTION IS GIVEN WILDLIFE IN DANGER
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, March 31 Delegates from 31 nations meeting here in the cause of preserving the world's endangered wildlife concluded a twoweeklong conference yesterday after approving protective regulations affecting more than 130 species of plants and animals ranging from orchids to whales.

title: The Older WomanYounger Man Relationship: A Taboo Fades
description: Not so long ago, an older womanyounger man relationship was generally spoken of in whispers, punctuated by smirks. Most people assumed the younger man was boxing for a motner figure, the older woman for a youthful lover. It will never last! the couple's friends usually pronounced, while the couple's families hoped, and even prayed, that the friends were right.

title: Auctioneers Court New Buyers
description: Art and antiques auctions have become a booming business in recent years, with prices rising, sales increasing in numbers and size, and new houses opening to meet the demand. Lately, New York's uptown auction houses have acted to attract buyers of more moderately priced wares.

title: It's Coast to Coast In Cannonball Race
description: The Cannonball Baker SeatoShining Sea Memorial Trophy Dash is back.

title: CARTER VISITS NUCLEAR PLANT, URCES COOPERATION IN CRISIS; SOME EXPERTS VOICE OPTIMISM
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa. April 1  President Carter toured the Three Mile Island nuclear plant today, was told that conditions there were stable, and urged residents of the area to cooperate if emergency measures became necessary.

title: Israeli Cabinet Backs Treaty and Begin's Cairo Trip
description: TEL AVIV, April 1The Israeli Cabinet ratified the peace treaty with Egypt today and then unanimously approved a state visit to Cairo tomorrow by Prime Minister Menachem Begin.

title: Abortion Snag Expected In StateBudget Passage
description: ALBANY, April 1  So pervasive is the ennui of this legislative session that the legislative leaders and Governor Carey's administration are, in effect, relying on it to break the budget impasse that is expected to develop this week over the use of Medicaid funds for abortions.

title: Lem Is Serene, HardDrinking And Loved
description: HE has been in baseball 41 years. He has grown up in it and grown old in it. He has played and scouted and coached and managed in it, and the only other job he ever held was the only. job he ever hated.

title: Mrs. Carver Is Victor in 5Way Playoff
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., April 1 JoAnne Camer won a fiveway sudden death playoff today to capture the $22,500 first prize in a $150,000 Ladies' Professional Golf Association tournament at the 6,134yard Mesa Verde Country Club course.

title: CARTER URGES CALM IF A MOVE IS NEEDED
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 1  President Carter indicated today that a precautionary evacuation of peoples. living in the vicinity of the stricken Three Mile Island nuclear plant might be ordered when a procedure has been selected to bring the plant to a cold shutdown state.

title: Hypothermia: Springtime Peril
description: THE 25knot northwesterly wind was pushing up twofoot seas in Long Island Sound. Too rough for racing, decided the skipper and crew. They were returning to port in Long Island's Huntington Harbor when their 22foot sloop was knocked down and they were thrown into the 45degree water with no life jackets.

title: Dineen Is Dismissed as Coach of W.H.A. Whalers
description: HARTFORD, April I (AP)  Bill Dineen was dismissed today as coach of the New England Whalers and was replaced by Don Blackburn, head scout of the World Hockey Association team.

title: Regulator of a Nation's Reactors
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., April 1  Politicians and reporters, even the President of the United States, have tried to explain to a concerned public what the nuclear accident here is all about. But in the end, they have all fallen back on Harold Ray Denton for the real story.

title: Sarah Vaughan Appears With Count Basie Band
description: SARAH VAUGHAN completed her cycle of three concerts within 10 days at Carnegie Hall on Friday evening with a program that she shared with Count Basie and his orchestra.

title: Molly Picon Is the Star Of Own Birthday Show
description: MOLLY PICON, who Is 81 years old, was honored for her 80th birthday yesterday at the Eighth Annual Sholem Aleichem Festival of the Jewish Arts at Queens College in Flushing and this would seem to mean that they still owe her one, a celebration that, if it matches yesterday's, will be one of the most charming interludes available for aficionados of Yiddish.

title: Advertising
description: IF ever there were a round peg snugly set in a round hole, it is Eugene Secunda, head of the J. Walter Thompson Company's Entertainment Group.

title: Mexico Postpones Setting Oil Price
description: MEXICO CITY, April 1  Mexico has postponed setting a new price for its crude oil exports pending clarification of international market conditions, the state oil monopoly, Petroleos Mexicanos, announced today.

title: Guide
description: THEIR DAY It's that time again  the annual spring dog assembly, including some of the nation's finest, at the Manhattan Savings Bank, with the public invited to look over some rare breeds, to watch a demonstration of obedience training for canine pets and to consult experts on all aspects of general dog training and care. The place is the lounge of the bank branch at 47th Street and Madison Avenue. The event begins today and continues through Friday; hours are noon to 1:30 P.M.

title: Flyers Rout Rangers, 73
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 1  The Philadelphia Flyers were the hungry team tonight, skating faster, shooting more and checking better than the sluggish and unaggressive Rangers. So the 73 victory for the Flyers was no surprise.

title: Obituary 4 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNOEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY DE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:00 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 1:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) NHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470600; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 0691600; CONNECTICUT (203) 3467767.

title: 2dQuarter Recession: Long Shot
description: For the last year, economists have been warning of, and business executives have been hedging, against, phantom recession that could strike the economy in any quarter. This year's first quarter was believed to be extremely vulnerable because of the acceleration of inflation, the troublesome winter weather and the likelihood of a sharp drop from the extraordinary growth rate in last year's fourth quarter.

title: Fibak Upsets Vilas in Final
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, April 1 (AP)  Wojtek Fibak of Poland upset the topseeded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina in a fourset final today and won the $75,000 Stuttgart Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: The City
description: About 1,000 striking clerks and cashiers of the Offtrack Betting Corporation vowed yesterday to defy a court order and not return to work today, a union spokesman said.

title: Weicker Urges a Plan On Saving Fuel to Bar Selling Out of Israel
description: Senator Lowell P. Weicjcer of Connecticut, a declared candidate for the Republican Presidential nomination, called yesterday for a national fuelconservation program coupled with the deregulation of fuel prices to prevent selling out Israel for a gallon of gas.

title: McEnroe Victor In W.C.T. Final
description: MILAN, Italy, April 1 (AP)  John McEnroe defeated John Alexander of Australia, 64, 63, today in the final match of a World Championship Tennis tournament.

title: Babcock & Wilcox Worried
description: The accident at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania last week means that the nuclear solution to this country's energy problem is in jeopardy  at a time when no other options look any more promising.

title: A Triumph for Miss Evert
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., April 1  Chris Evert got a present today from Dianne Fromholtz, 16 days before her wedding.

title: Free Leads Clippers Over Knicks, 126116
description: SAN DIEGO, April 1 (AP)  Lloyd Free scored 28 points and Nick Weatherspoon added 24 today as the San Diego Clippers snapped a fourgame losing streak with a 126116 National Basketball Association victory over the New York Knicks.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BONN  The relationship between the United States and West Germany is built on a strong foundation. Despite press reports and commentary that the relationship has eroded, both Governments know that their mutualsecurity commitment is firm and that economic interdependence and shared values provide reliable bonds.

title: TV SPORTS
description: TODAY

title: Mets Send Down Norman
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., April 1 The New York Mets made one of the surprise cuts of spring training tonight when they sent Dan Norman, the powerhitting rookie right fielder, back to their Tidewater farm club in the International League.

title: The Region
description: ATLANTIC CITY (AP)  An agreement between Joseph P. Lordi, chairman of the New Jersey Casino Control Commission, and officials of Resorts International to test new table minimums at the Resorts casino was made without the full commission's knowledge and is therefore unenforceable, Commissioner Albert Merck charged yesterday.

title: Dance: Yakshagana From India
description: YAKSHAGANA, the form of dancedrama from south India that the Asia Society's Performing Arts program presented Saturday night at Carnegie Hall, differs markedly in impetus from the other Indian dance styles seen here previously.

title: Utility May Tap Jersey Park Site For Its Methane
description: SECAUCUS, N.J.  New Jersey's largest utility has expressed interest in a venture to extract methane gas as a salable fuel from beneath 656 acres of garbage dumps scheduled to become a major state park near the Meadowlands Sports Complex.

title: College's Quest for Philosophy Teacher Provides a Lesson in Academic Hiring Process
description: CRAWFORDSVILLE. Ind.  Alan Berger has decided to give up city life in Manhattan for this cornfieldfringed town in central Indiana. Wabash College had offered him something he could not find in the New York area or, for that matter, anywhere else: a fulltime job teaching philosophy.

title: Events
description: BIG AND LITTLE. by Botho Strauss, Phoenix Theater, Marymount Manhattan Theater, 221 East 71st Street, 6:45.

title: British Hope to Protect Eagles
description: LONDON, April 1 (AP)  Volunteers began a twomonth vigil today to protect four rare golden eagles that flew south from the Scottish Highlands to the Lake District of northwest England. Conservationists noted that the last time such eagles ventured into the Lake District they lost their eggs to nestrobbers.

title: Miss Hearst and ExBodyguard Are Wed Amid Intense Security
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 1  Two months after her release from prison, Patricia Campbell Hearst was married today in a Navy chapel to her former bodyguard, Bernard Shaw, a 33yearold policeman and divorced father of three.

title: Amin's Hopes Now Rest on Libyans' Help
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April 1  Col. Muammar elQaddafi of Libya is making good his threat to intervene on President Idi Amin's side in his desperate stand against invading Tanzanians and Ugandan rebels. The question now is: Will Libya's support be enough to keep the Ugandan dictator in power?

title: Accident Has Brought No Cutoff Of Power Supply in Plant's Area
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 1  The malfunction of the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant has not left homes and businesses in the area without cower.

title: SATELLITES TO GUIDE AIR TRAFFIC BACKED
description: HONOLULU, April 1  Congress should use some of the $3 billion Airport. and Airway Trust Fund to enable civilian] aircraft to use a sophisticated satellite based air traffic control system, a House subcommittee was told at hearings this weekend.

title: Hostages Tell of Strange Siege at Store
description: The pistol came in first, said Ronald O'Neill, the security guard at the Waldbaum's supermarket in the East Flatbush section of Brooklyn where 40 shoppers and workers were taken prisoner by three wouidbe armed robbers at 6:45 Saturday night. He asked, Can I use the phone?

title: Bruins 3, Canadiens 3
description: BOSTON, April 1 (AP)  Rod Langway's third goal of the season at 14:35 of the third period gave the Montreal Canadiens a 33 tie with the Boston Bruins tonight.

title: 1 Mark Buys Iron Foundry In Germany
description: BONN, April 1  Early last January, in response to press inquiries, the United States Steel Corporation announced that it had sold its majority interest in a 500,000tonayear West German iron foundry to a West German lawyer.

title: Proposed TV Series Includes Audience Discussion
description: It is at first blush a fairly typical situation comedy. The husband and wife return somewhat merrily from a trip to a business convention and exchange standard sitcom badinage with. their likable and highspirited daughters.

title: Chess:
description: Two rooks are the equal of a queen plus one pawn under normal conditions. Normal conditions can be taken to mean that both kings are secure, there are no weaknesses in either pawn position and there are no immediately decisive tactical shots. The equivalency, men, aepenaing as neav ily as it does on these positional factors, is fragile and easily disrupted.

title: A Yellow Light for Economic Policy
description: The major problem undermining the President's antiinflation fight is not the oil crisis or the beef shortage, but the failure of the United States economy to slow down so that the guidelines have a chance. The guidelines were never meant to hold back wage and price pressures in a boom time, like the present, when industrial capacity and prime labor markets are stretched tight and shortages force up prices. The guidelines were designed for a slack time, when they could help moderate inflation by encouraging large unions and companies to hold down wages and prices.

title: After 46 Years, Local Politicking Stirs a Corner of Spain
description: SALAMANCA, Spain  On the wintry, empty plains, in the poor villages and small towns, a spirit of political renovation is stirring in this neglected province of northwestern Spain.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON

title: The Editorial Notebook Politics, Unlike Tustice. Needs Vision
description: When New York's Mayor Koch insists, as he often does, that he treats all groups the same, he is borrowing Justice's blindfold and wearing it at City Hall. Blindfolds are misplaced there; City Hall needs vision.

title: Reactor Builder Has Local Support But No New Installation Contracts
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., April 1  In a nondescript, twostory brick building here in the shadow of the Blue Ridge Mountains, engineers and technicians are working around the clock to come up with an answer. Already a dozen or so have flown north to be at the scene of the crisis at the Three Mile Island nuclear plant in Middletown, Pa. More are on their way.

title: Will a New Market Street Mean a New San Francisco?
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Dance: Ohio Ballet Shows Its Wares
description: THE Ohio Ballet has appeared in the East at the New York and Jacob's Pillow summer dance festivals, but a threeperformance stint last weekend at the Brooklyn College Brooklyn Center for the Performing Arts gave New Yorkers their first chance to see this young 18member company in a full program of dance. It was a happy first meeting.

title: Distillers Sue To Keep Tariff
description: United States distillers sued in Washington yesterday to stop the Government from removing duties on Scotch whisky and other imported liquor. In exchange, other countries would end trade restraints on American farm products.

title: Trucking Leaders Call for Lockout Of 300,000 in Strike by. Teamsters
description: WASHINGTON, April 1  Trucking industry leaders called today for a nationwide lockout of 300,000 teamsters union drivers and warehousemen as a response to the union's divideandconquer tactics.

title: French and West German Inspection Teams Are Sent to Harrisburg
description: PARIS, April 1  The Governments of France and West Germany, both nations with major nuclear facilities, said today that they had sent scientific teams to Harrisburg, Pa., to Investigate the causes of the nuclear accident near there.

title: No Agreement Near With the Umpires
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 1  With no settlement in sight in its dispute with major league umpires, baseball will apparently begin its season this week with a mixture of minor league and amateur substitutes.

title: News Summary
description: President Carter toured the Three Mile Island nuclear plant and was told that conditions were stable. The President urged residents to cooperate if emergency measures became necessary. Later, officials expressed cautious optimism that the problems were easing and that the possibility an evacuation would be necessary was diminishing. [A1:6.]

title: And Now, a Second Opinion on Second Opinions
description: Letters

title: Amin Disputed by Rebels
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, April 1 The recently formed Uganda National Liberation Front today denied President Idi Amin's assertion that Tanzanian and Ugandan rebel forces had been driven out of artillery positions overlooking Kam pala and Entebbe.

title: No Title
description: Deaths

description: CLEARWATER, FLA.

description: Morning

title: Cosmos Win in Overtime
description: SAN DIEGO, April 1  The roadweary New York Cosmos needed a goal in suddendeath overtime last night to open the defense of their North American Soccer League championship with a 21 triumph over the San Diego Sockers at San Diego Stadium. The crowd of 16,396 was the largest ever to see the Sockers at home.

title: Synagogue Fire Linked to Arson
description: An fire yesterday at Congregation Beth Jacob, a synagogue at Broadway and Rodney Street in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, was probably the work or arsonists, according to authorities. Damage to the twostory building was described as light. Chief William Jones said the blaze had been declared suspicious because firefighters found three separate fires going at once when they arrived.

description: INVESTORS who are seeking high current income and capital gains may want to combine two of the more popular investment strategies of the day.
