The police said the accident happened about 9 P.M. on Route 82, about 17 miles east of this southwestern Louisiana community.

title: Music: OldTime Strings
description: THE difference between Martin, Bogan and Armstrong, the oldtime black string band that was at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Saturday, and any white group playing a comparable repertory is an interesting difference indeed.

title: The Teamster Contract Is No Bargain
description: The Administration has risked the further erosion of its antiinflation program by cheering so loudly for the tentative new contract between the Teamsters and the truckers. The cheers are premature. The union's members will not vote on the settlement until later this month, and then they will look extra hard at any deal that has the Administration's guideline guardians dancing down Pennsylvania Avenue.

title: Leonard H. Meyers, 47; Was Physicist and Artist
description: Leonard H. Meyers, a physicist and lecturer at the Center for Interdisciplinary and Innovative Science in the School of Natural Sciences at San Francisco State University, died Friday at his home in San Francisco after a long illness. He was 47 years old.

title: Iranian Foreign Minister Quits Post
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Monday, April 16 Iran's Foreign Minister, Karim Sanjabi, resigned his post, it was announced this morning by Radio Iran.

title: Wright Steps Up Attack on Police In Guest Sermon
description: Judge Bruce McM. Wright stepped up his attack on the New York police yesterday, referring to the head of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association as skunk and to three white policemen found not guilty of killing blacks as killers and enemies:

title: TV: Cheerleading Champions
description: AT Ivy League football games, in which it often seems that neither side is capable of winning, the cheerleading is apt to be correspondingly diffident and the crowds quietly contemplative.

title: The Region
description: GREENWOOD LAKE, N.Y. (AP) Liquids leaking from a garbage dump here contain several toxic organic compounds that could jeopardize the source A drinking water for almost a million persons, the United States Environmental Protection Agency reported.

title: Market Place
description: INVESTORS in bank shares have been concerned for years that underlying values are act reflected in the market price of their holdings.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets, which have just come through a weeklong slump that raised longterm Treasury bond yields to their highest levels in history, hope to get some definite information this week about whether the Federal Reserve is going to make money more difficult and expensive to borrow.

title: The City
description: Beth Israel Medical Center has filed suit against the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, charging it with illegally hampering a $52 million modernization program and thereby blocking a saving of more than $26 million in healthcare costs.

title: Unaccredited Law Schools Face Scrutiny on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, April 15  California, which has more unaccredited law schools than any other state, is considering a proposal by the California Bar Association that would eliminate the schools in five years unless they upgraded their faculties and curriculums to meet the accreditation standards of the state and the American Bar Association.

title: Call It Women's Glib
description: Women's liberation is probably the most successful pestilence since Prohibition, a movement that was likewise under feminine stewardship. It thrived, nourished as it was by the major philosophical current of modern America, namely selfinterest, improperly understood.

title: Borg Tops Gerulaitis In Monte Carlo Final
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, April 15 (UPI)  Topseeded Bjorn Borg of Sweden crushed Vitas Gerulaitas, 62, 61, 63, in the final of a $175,000 World Championship Tennis tournament today.

title: Basques Demanding Home Rule Stage March in 4 Spanish Cities
description: BILBAO. Spain, April 15 (Reuters) About 200,000 Basque nationalists, calling for home rule and shouting slogans against the Spanish and French Governments, marched today through four northern Spain provincial capitals  Bilbao, San Sebastian. Pamplona and Vitoria.

title: Melissa Greene Is Married to Donald Samuel
description: Melissa F. Greene, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald A. Greene of Kettering, Ohio, was married yesterday to Donald F. Samuel, son of Howard D. Samuel, Deputy Under Secretary for International Affairs in the Labor Department, and Mrs. Samuel of Chevy Chase, Md.

title: Morris Davidson Dead; Artist and Teacher, 80
description: Morris Davidson, an artist and teacher of art, died Friday of a heart attack at his home at Orchard Terrace, Piermont, N.Y. He was 80 years old.

title: Command Chain of Afghan Revolt Is a Network of Exiles in Pakistan
description: SHAMKHAN, Pakistan, April 12  An effectively functioning network of selfexiled Afghans in refugees camps in the semidesert tribal areas of Pakistan's remote Baluchistan Province appears to be running the growing revolt against the yearold proSoviet Government in Afghanistan.

title: Stage: Don Juan Legend
description: THE one thing that no play centering on the Don Juan legend should do is to play the music from Mozart's opera. It is letting the sun rise on candlelight.

title: U.N. Lebanon Force Feels Frustrated as Armed Factions Step Up Activity
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 15  Israeli armed forces have returned openly to southern Lebanon, rightwing Christian militia groups move about freely with heavy arms, Palestinian and leftist guerrillas have increased attempts at infiltration, and the United Nations peacekeeping troops can do nothing.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. La Jongleuse, Moszkowski; Sonata for 4 Recorders, Paisible; Romance, Kreisler; Marche des Fusilliez. LullyHotteterre; Lachrimae antiquae, Dowland.

title: Three Mile Island: Notes From a Nightmare
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa.  The people living near the 372foottall cooling towers of, the nuclearpowered electric plant on Three Mile Island had learned to coexist with the raucous sound of venting steam.

title: Deaths
description: NEVINSTheodare C. Of 33 Stone bridge Road. Montclair, N.J., on Thursday April 12, 1979. husband of the late Audrey Classon Nevins, father of Mrs. William D'Aniou and Theodore C. Nevins Jr., also survived by four grandchildren. Service will be held at Arthur K. Brown Inc. (Home For Services). 56 Park Street at Claremont Avenue, Montclair, N.J. Tuesday morning at 11. Friends may call Monday 2-4 and 79 P.M. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be sent to Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N.J.

title: Chess:
description: In a typical countergambit, such as the Greco (1 PK4, PK4; 2 NKB3, PKB4) or the Albin (1 PQ4, PQ4; 2 PQB4, PK4), Black sacrifices a pawn to remove a white pawn from the center, thus clearing the way for the buildup of a superiority there. The ultimate objective, once Black has established a strong pawn center, is to constrict the white position and develop an attack, usually against the king.

title: O.E.C.D. Posts Rise in Prices
description: PARIS, April 15 (UPI)  Consumer prices in the 24 countries that are members of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development rose by eighttenths of 1 percent in February, underlining continued strong inflationary trends since the beginning of the year, the O.E.C.D. reported.

title: Ugandans Feel Free Now to Talk
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, April 15 After eight years of silence and fear, the people of Uganda are beginning to feel free to talk again.

title: Popular Pamphlet Helps Nigerians Going to Britain
description: KADUNA, Nigeria  The booklet is called Bridging the Gap, and its popularity extends far beyond the readership for which it was intended: the 5,000 Nigerians who go each year to study in Britain, about a fourth the number of Nigerians attending school in the United States.

title: Suns 101, Blazers 91
description: PHOENIX, April 15 (AP)  The Phoenix Suns outscored the Portland Trail Blazers, 3315, in the fourth quarter and went on to a 10191 victory today. The Suns captured the firstround National Basketball Association playoff series, two names to one.

title: Kuwaiti Dinar Seeks International Role
description: KUWAIT  The banking community in this tiny sheikdom believes 1979 will be the year when the Kuwaiti dinar becomes the first oilbacked currency to play an international financial role.

title: Consumer View Turns Gloomy
description: Signs are increasing that consumers, whose buying has fueled the economic recovery since the 1974 recession, have turned sharply pessimistic. Their changed outlook could signal an imminent economic slowdown, some economists warn.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Sapelo White House
description: JEKYLL ISLAND, Ga., April 15 President Carter emerged this morning from the secluded villa where he has been vacationing and joined in a rousing, handclapping Easter service with some 200 black parishioners of the First African Baptist Church on nearby Sapelo Island.

title: Smiles Bring Sunshine to Easter Parade
description: Welcoming an elusive spring, with or without the Jay's touches of finery, 50,000 people turned out for the city's centuryold Easter Parade on Fifth Avenue.

title: Letters
description: TO SCIENCE TIMES:

title: Islanders Win by 62; 3 for Bossy in Opener
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 16  The New York Islanders, with Mike Bossy scoring three goals, routed the Chicago Black Hawks, 62, in the opener tonight of their fourofsevengame Stanley Cup quarterfinal series in the Nassau Coliseum.

title: 4Story Escape Down Drainpipe
description: A 25yearold man was in serious condition yesterday in Beekman Downtown Hospital after sliding down a building drainpipe to escape two gunmen in holdup of the Sung Que Athletic Club, at 177 Canal Street. on Sunday. The injured man. James Tong, lost his grip on the drainpipe and slipped down four stories.

title: STATES STEP UP AID TO AILING LOCALITIES
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  In the last year or so, the states have vastly increased their help to the distressed communities, urban and rural, that they once were accused of neglecting.

title: Companies
description: Scott Paper announced lower selling prices for some products and said it would defer or modify some price increases that it had planned. The company said the decisions came after consultation with the Council on Wage and Price Stability, which had denied Scott's request for consideration under the Government's alternative profitmargin test for price increases. [Page D1.]

title: Briton With a Sense of Dj Vu Calls Ruins Home
description: ARABA EL MADFUNA, Egypt Om Seti may or may not have lived 3,200 years ago as a temple waif in the 19th Dynasty under Seti I and Ramses II. It is certain, however, that the elderly Englishwoman feels at home only among the renowned pharaonic ruins that she began seeking as a child.

title: About New York
description: It sounds like the longrumored city apocalypse, but the case of the Tree of Life versus the Urban Development Corporation is actually a struggle for a lively corner in Harlem, where the vibrations are very heavy, to quote the identical enthusiasms of Brother Ernest and Dr. Moore.

title: Professor at Brown U. Named Amherst Head
description: AMHERST, Mass., April 16 (AP) Dr. Julian H. Gibbs, a Brown University chemistry professor, has been named president of Amherst College effective July 1. He succeeds John William Ward, who announced last November he would resign this July.

title: Bankers Trust: Corporate Focus
description: Alfred Brittain 3d, the chairman of the Bankers Trust Company, recently invited the treasurer of a multinational corporation to lunch, hoping to snare at least a small piece of the company's banking business. He was surprised to learn his bank already had a substantial niece.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. STUDY ON LANCE COMPLETE
description: ATLANTA, April 16  A Justice Department review of the investigation of Bert Lance is complete, and prosecutors have been given permission to seek indictments. but it may be more than a month before a Federal grand jury here takes action, sources familiar with the case said today.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The National Westminster Bank of London purchased the National Bank of North America yesterday from the C.I.T. Financial Corporation.

title: Wrigley Fights Rivals Harder
description: CHICAGO, April 16  'The Wrigley Company, a Chicago businessman observed years ago, does nothing but make chewing gum and money.

title: Charges of Police Corruption and Misconduct Up 17% Over 1978 Figure
description: Complaints of corruption and serious misconduct against New York City police officers increased 17 percent during the first three months of this year compared to the same period in 1978, according to Police Department report submitted yesterday to Commissioner Robert J. McGuire.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., April 16 (AP)  Strikers throwing bottles confronted police officers at the Newport News shipyard today, resulting in more than 50 arrests and several injuries, officers said.

title: The Doctor's World
description: THE word cure is one that doctors seldom use. Although as students they may have great hopes learning to apply medicine's newest advances cure diseases, they later find in their practices that they can actually eradicate just a tiny fraction of the thousands of human ailments.

title: Marathon's Colorful Characters
description: BOSTON, April 16  McAvoy Layne wanted to accomplish two things in today's marathon: to finish in less than three hours and to go out in style. This was his sixth and final marathon performance, said Layne, who dressed for the occasion of his retirement in tuxedo, complete with pleated shirt and satin bowtie.

title: Wide Police Surveillance Abuses Reported in a Study by Quakers
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  A threeandahalf.year study by the American Friends Service Committee maintains that police surveillance of groups and individuals for political purposes is continuing on a vast scale in the nation.

title: 12 Are Implicated in Moro Slaying
description: ROME, April 16  Officials in the Italian judiciary said today that substantial new evidence had been found that implicated 12 people in the kidnapping and murder of former Prime Minister Aldo Mom last year.

title: Mayor's Game Ends At 11 in 5th
description: Who said the Yankees don't take the Mayor's Trophy game seriously?

title: Ballet: Two Works New to New York
description: AMERICAN Ballet Theater opened its spring season last night at the Metropolitan Opera House with a good mix of favorites and two works new to New York.

title: The Third Culture
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  In 1959, C. P. Snow published The Two Cultures and the Scientific Revolution. As he saw it, the scientists did their thing, complicated and inhumane, getting better at it all the time, while the humanists went their blissful, harmless, peaceful way, knowing little of science. Both cultures sought truth, but in their own terms.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Deaths
description: GROSSMAN  Regina (Nee Goldman). Beloved wife of Gustave, dr voted mother of Betty Anne & Barbara Dear sister of Gertrude Kreisberg. Ida Kreisberg & Claire ShePiro.Services today 2PM Park. side Bronx. Jerome Avenue 170 St.

title: Hanging Is Bitter Issue for South Africa
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, April 15 When Solomon Mahlangu, a 22-year-old black convicted of complicity in a murder, went to the gallows here this month, South Africa was enveloped anew in controversy over its policies toward blacks, in particular its record as one of the most frequent practitioners of legal execution.

title: Archbishop Molloy Victor In Private Schools Track
description: Archbishop Molloy won the team title, in the Athletic Association of Private Schools track and field championships yesterday at Randalls Island.

title: Koch's Criticism Of Judge Wright Draws New Fire
description: Mayor Koch's criticism of a bail decision by Criminal Court Judge Bruce McM. Wright was called highly inappropriate yesterday by an official of the 25,000member metropolitan council of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: Time Runs Out
description: Things were busy yesterday at the Internal Revenue Service office on Church Street in Manhattan. New Yorkers of all walks of life, who had a day of grace because April 15 fell on Easter Sunday, were busy gathering forms, seeking help and attempting to complete their returns for mailing before the midnight deadline last night. The scene might have been much the same around the country  except for those lucky enough to have their taxes mailed to the Internal Revenue Service headquarters in Andover, Mass. They have an extra day because the office was closed for Patriots Day, a Massachusetts holiday.

title: Events Today
description: WHOSE LIFE IS IT ANYWAY. by Brian Clark: directed by Michael LindsayHogg; starring Tom Contl and Jean Marsh. At the Trafalgar Theater, 208 West 41st Street, 6:15.

title: Aid for Problems of Homosexuals Reported by Masters and Johnson
description: A decadelong study by Dr. William H. Masters and Virginia E. Johnson, the pioneering sex researchers, has found that the sexual problems of homosexuals, including the unfulfilled desire by some to function as heterosexuals, can in many cases be effectively treated in two weeks of intensive therapy.

title: Disbarments to Stand For Podell and Brasco
description: WASHINGTON. April 16  The United State Supreme Court let stand today without comment disbarment orders against two former Brooklyn Congressmen.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The difficulty of getting SALT If ratified in the Senate is becoming clearer every day. Unfortunately, the issues involved are not. The most important debate of the Carter Administration is in danger of bogging down, before it officially opens, in technicalities, exaggerated fears and irrelevancies.

title: MISSISSIPPI CAPITAL BATTLES FLOOD RISE
description: JACKSON, Miss., April 16 (AP)  The worst Pearl River flood in history continued to inundate Jackson today, sending water to the eaves of some homes in the suburbs and forcing officials to seal off the downtown area.

title: Teamsters' BacktoWork Order Defied by Striking Steel Haulers
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  In defiance of the backtowork order of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, several thousand steel haulers are continuing to strike for better contract terms.

title: Dr. S. Zalman Yovely, Jewish FolkArt Expert
description: Dr. S. Zalman Yovely, a consultant on Jewish folk art, antique Hebrew books and manuscripts, died Saturday in Metropolitan Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Less Resistance Seen on Mortages
description: Consumer resistance to mortgage rates that are approaching 11 percent appears to be weakening, Sharon Stieber, Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation economist, said yesterday after analyzing the Government agency's latest purchase of home mortgages.

title: Network Says Court Will Rule Against Journalists
description: WASHINGTON, April 16 (AP)  The American Broadcasting Company said tonight that the Supreme Court will soon rule that journalists facing libel suits may be forced to tell what their state of mind was while they prepared the contested news reports.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: For Edward F. Gibbons, the chairman and chief executive officer of the F.W. Woolworth Company, 1979 was supposed to be a year of celebration. The big chainstore corporation, the country's fourthlargest retailer and long a household name, reported a 52 percent rise in profits last year, celebrated its hundredth anniversary in February and was looking forward to further progress in the forthcoming months.

title: Farmers Plan 7% Rise in Soybean Plantings and 1% Cut for Corn
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  Farmers intend, as of today, to increase their soybean plantings by 7 percent and to reduce the amount of corn they will soon plant by only 1 percent, according to the Agriculture Department.

title: The Bang for the Buck in Congress
description: Money, everyone knows by now, is the mother's milk of politics. What is not so well known is how much of it is now required to run for Congress  and the extent to which politicians are now suckled by special interests. Hence the most important bill before Congress this year may be one labeled, with apt ceremony, H.R. 1, to provide partial public financing of Congressional campaigns. This one reform could have an impact on legislation  and the reputation of Congress for years to come.

title: PhysicistPainter Captures Iridescence in Liquid Crystal
description: IN the innovative tradition of Leonardo da Vinci, a Canadian physicist has discovered a way in which artists can reproduce the shimmering iridescence of a butterfly's wing or a beetle's shell, an effect beyond the reach of any conventional paint.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Herbert Stanley Dunn, 87, Dies; Played Cisco Kid in Silent Films
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., April 16 (AP) Herbert Stanley Dunn, who played the original Cisco Kid in silent pictures from 1913 to 1915, died of a stroke Saturday. He was 87 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE more World War II gets idealized as the last conflict in which the issues of right and wrong were clearcut, the more our view of that war stays the same.

title: Loose Bruce and Looser Rhetoric
description: The strident and exaggerated criticism of Judge Bruce Wright's recent bail decision has now been matched by his responses  and by heated comments from almost everyone else. There can yet be a constructive result; the flareup could teach the public something about the principles of bail. To understand them is to recognize that the Judge's original ruling in New York City's Criminal Court might have been defensible. But understanding can't begin until everyone cools down.

title: Prosecutors Say Philadelphia Police Veil Actions
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 16  Mayor Frank L. Rizzo and top police administrators keep this city's Police Department shielded from public scrutiny, according to witnesses who testified today before the United States Civil Rights Commission.

title: Israel Reports a Clash On Lebanese Border; 6 Arabs, 1 Israeli Die
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, April 17  Six Arab guerrillas and an Israeli soldier were killed last night in a clash on the Lebanese border, the military command here announced this morning.

title: With Inflation the Special of the Day, Diners Are Finding a Different Menu
description: A simple dinner for two in a Greenwich Village restaurant costs me $35, said a New York bachelor. That's more than 30 percent over a year or so ago. Unfortunately, my salary hasn't kept pace.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNEMENT OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION IN REGIIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. MEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (514) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO (516) 7170903; SUFFOLK CO (5I6) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3437767

title: Japanese Gives Central Park 150 Tokens of Peace
description: Beneath a spray of pale pink blossoms, a Japanese industrialist yesterday gave the city 150 flowering cherry trees and a promise of continuing friendship between his country and the United States.

title: Recital: Bert Lucarelli on Oboe
description: BERT LUCARELLI'S oboe recital Sunday night at the 92d Street Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association seemed decidedly more attractive after the Intermission than before it, and this was both because of the music and how he played it.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Mazeppa, excerpt. Tchaikovsky; Nocturne in E. Chopin; Variations on The Last Rose of Summer. Ernst.

title: Kampala's Signs of Life: Parasol for Baby in Lace
description: KAMPALA. Uganda, April 16  This morning a woman strolled down Parliament Avenue, where the stores are gutted, carrying a bright red parasol in one hand and a baby swaddled in lace in the other. She passed a group of Tanzanian soldiers lounging on a street corner, smiled and continued on, picking her way lightly over shards of glass as if she were stepping over daisies in a meadow.

title: TV: Transplant, a True Drama
description: WHEN a man has a heart attack in a drama called Transplant, there can hardly be any doubt about where the script is heading. One problem with tonight's presentation on CBSTV, at 9 o'clock, is that the time spent getting there seems interminable.

title: Market Place
description: LATE last year, when Servico Inc. announced plans to go private, some knowledgeable people on Wall Street expressed surprise. While it is true that the company, a hotel and motel operator, lost $220,000 in 1977 and otherwise gave the appearance of a business in trouble, the company had major assets that the Wall Streeters believed were inadequately reflected in the tender price of 3. In going private, the company would offer to buy Servico shares back from their public holders.

title: Science Watch
description: Some bacteria have an internal compass that apparently aids navigation, scientists in New England have discovered.

title: Sketches of Winners of the Pulitzer Prizes in Journalism, the Arts and Letters
description: A physical fitness buff, he could not be reached for hours yesterday by his editors because he was running in the Boston Marathon . . . 27 years old . . . born in Jersey City . . . graduated from Fairleigh Dickinson University in 1973 . . . a high school teacher before joining The Lehighton (Pa.) TimesNews as reporter . . . joined The Pottsville Republican in January 1978 . . . won Pulitzer for yearlong investigation along with Elliot G. Jaspin of the demise of the Blue Coal Corporation, once a leading producer of anthracite . . . known for his tenacity and his good humor . . . married . . . lives in Lake Hauto. P3

title: Shearson's Net Up for Quarter
description: Shearson Hayden Stone, a leading investment firm servicing United States and foreign securities and commodities markets, yesterday reported a net income of $3.6 million, or 75 cents share, for the third fiscal quarter ended March 31, more than triple the $1.1 million, or 25 cents a share, reported in the comparable three months last year.

title: World News Briefs
description: COPENHAGEN, April 16 (AP)  Helicopters and fishing boats rescued 44 people, including women and children, from the 6,000ton Polish freighter Reimund tonight as it burned in the Baltic off the Danish island of Bonaholm, the Maritime Rescue Center reported.

title: Marine Seems to Harbor Bitterness for North Vietnamese
description: GREENSBURG, Ind., April 14  It was like being locked in a closet for 14 years  locked in and forgotten, Pfc. Robert Russell Garwood said, crushing the Marlboro he had just smoked down to the filter and lighting the next of a chain.

title: EDUCATION
description: BOSTON NEW ENGLAND will finally have its own school of veterinary medicine this fall when the first class of 35 students, now being selected from among 500 applicants, are admitted to a new branch of Tufts University.

title: City in Nicaragua Is Left Shattered
description: ESTELI, Nicaragua, April 16 (AY) Broken glass and spent cartridge cases littered the streets and bloodstained sidewalks of Esteli, and residents accused President Anastasio Somoza's army of atrocities during the weeklong fight to take the city from leftist guerrillas.

title: Hanover Bank's Net Up; Continental Also Gains
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corpo ration reported yesterday that its net operating income had risen more than 18 percent in the first quarter of this year compared with the corresponding period a year earlier.

title: Deaths
description: COOPERDora. We mourn the loss of our esteemed member of long standing whose beneficence helped us immeasurably in the building of the Greater Shame Torah.

title: Japan Lifts Rate to Cut Inflation
description: TOKYO, April 16  The Bank of Japan, the country's central bank, decided today to raise its official discount rate for the first time in nearly five and a half years in an attempt to thwart a renewed inflationary surge that could cripple the Japanese economy.

title: Advertising
description: THE McGrawHill Publications Company, its eye on the golden almond cookie in the sky, has exercised its option to acquire 49 percent of the American Industrial Report, a controlledcirculation trade publication that is distributed in China.

title: How One Dealer Reached Price of 99.9 a Gallon of Gas
description: Robert Hinkley is the comptroller for Capitol Service Stations, whose Texaco station is on the corner of 37th Street and First Avenue in Manhattan. In the last few weeks, the posted price for premium gasoline in that station  99.9 cents a gallon  has been the highest, and probably the most highly publicized, price in Manhattan.

title: Deaths
description: SCHREIBERLouis J., Shulamith School for Girls expresses its sincerest condolences to Mrs. Evelyn Schreiber, Mr. Avram Schreiber, CoTreasurer, and Aaron Schreiber, supporter and friend and to the entire Schreiber Family upon the loss of beloved husband, father. grandfather and brother, devoted friend and supporter of Shulamith for many years. May the family no Ionper know of any sorrow and be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Israel.

title: Umpire Hendry Joins His Brothers
description: Richie Phillips, the Philadelphia lawyer who is ringmaster of the major league umpires in their strike for more money, looks like an umpire, dresses like an umpire and talks like a Philadelphia lawyer. If umpires were as punctual as he, they wouldn't have jobs to be unhappy about.

title: Scott Bows To U.S. On Pricing
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 16  Under pressure from the Carter Administration, the Scott Paper Company announced today that it would roll back prices on certain items and defer or modify some planned price increases.

title: C.A.B. Law Judge Backs Merging 2 Coast Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  A Civil Aeronautics Board judge today urged the approval of a proposed merger between Continental Air Lines and Western Airlines providing they keep their promise to cut fares after the consolidation.

title: Theater: Homeland, A Comedy With Maids
description: IN Homeland, a Modern Times Theater production at the New York Theater Ensemble, an innocent black maidservant visits America with her white South African employers and meets a suburban family's worldly black housekeeper, or as she prefers to call herself, a household technician.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Reflecting last week's rise in interest rates, sixmonth Treasury bill rates climbed yesterday to their highest level since August 1979. Threemonth bill rates, however, declined slightly and the credit markets generally were stable and unusually quiet as they waited for some signal this week of any change in Federal Reserve policy.

title: Perjury Charges Are Dismissed Against New Jersey Rice Dealer
description: NEWARK, April 16 (UPI)  Perjury charges against a New Jersey rice dealer were dismissed today at the request of the Government prosecutor, who said that Tongsun Park, the South Korean rice dealer. had changed his testimony.

title: Running
description: AT BOSTON

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: ONE, TWO, THREE Any record collector who has happened to put on Brahms's Liebeslieder Waltzes lately knows that the enticing lilt of these songs, rendered by a vocal ensemble, is about as springlike as you can get, with gray weather still holding fast. Part One of this intoxicating music will be offered live tonight at 8 in the latest free concert for visitors and neighborhood residents presented by the Manhattan Savings Bank, 86th Street and Third Avenue.

title: Taxes
description: EVEN though the Energy Department is entangled in President Carter's controversial proposal to tax any windfall profits on oil, it has been scathingly accused of failing to play an active role in determining what effects national tax policy has on energy matters.

title: 5 Killed as Car Crashes in Ohio
description: CINCINNATI, April 16 (AP)  Five persons were killed and a sixth was critically injured today when a car went out of control and smashed into a guard rail and a tunnel abutment, the police said. The car apparently lost control due to the high speed, estimated by the police at 100 miles an hour, said Bill Ries, an officer. Names of the victims were not immediately released.

title: A Spanish Politician Is Wounded
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain. April 16 (Reuters)  Gunmen believed to be Basque guerrillas today shot and seriously wounded a provincial secretary of the rightwing Popular Alliance Party, police sources said. The secretary. Gerardo Gomez Chaus. was shot five times twice in the head  as he was leaving home for work. The Basque separatist guerrilla group E.T.A. has claimed responsibility for killing 28 persons in Spain this year.

title: Cash Prices
description: MONDAY, APRIL 16, 1979

title: Carter Would Open Up More Land
description: WASHINGTON, April 16 (UPI) President Carter today asked that more than 36 million acres of untrampled countryside owned by the Government be opened for logging and oil, gas and mineral exploration.

title: 2+2= 3. Yes, 3.
description: Is bigness badness?

title: Salyut May Yield Permanent Space Station
description: EVERY 90 minutes a large Soviet spaceship completes a circuit of earth, as has since September 1977, and as probably will for months to come. It a home away from earth for two astronauts, and a place to work. It represents the most ambitious effort to date to understand what it like to live and work in space for long periods of time

title: Notes on People
description: Before re the signing of the EgyptianIsraeli peace pact, artists wanting to perform in both countries had a sticky time of it. If one played in Tel Aviv, for example, it was impossible to go directly on to Cairo for a concert with Israeli ink still wet on one's passport. Now it appears that a serendipitous sidelight of the peace pact works in favor of easier cultural exchanges.

title: Margo Henderson, Blues Singer And Wife of Luther Henderson
description: Margo Semas Henderson, a blues singer, died Friday of cancer at the Royal Marsden Hospital in London. She was 33 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: NoseDive Jet to Get Final Check
description: DETROIT, April 16 (UPI)  A T.W.A. jetliner that plunged to within 6,000 feet of the ground in an uncontrolled supersonic nose dive less than two weeks ago took off for Kansas City without incident today for a final maintenance check of its flight controls. Takeoff followed a threehour overhaul of all flight systems by a team of airline inspectors that has overseen repair work on the crippled jet since it made its emergency landing April 4 at iptrolt Metropolitan Airport

title: Shepard Takes Pulitzer for Drama, Baker of Times Wins for Comment
description: An Off Broadway play about a sorry homecoming, Sam Shepard's Buried Child, won the Pulitzer Prize for drama yesterday. The prize came the day after the drama closed at the Theatre de Lys, where it had played 152 regular performances and five previews.

title: Damages Case Taken By Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether certain types of damage awards to injured workers, intended to compensate for lost income, ought to be scaled down to reflect the portion that Federal and state income taxes would have taken out of the workers earnings.

title: Mime: What the Devil
description: MIME theater speaks a universal language, but sometimes, to a laggard onlooker who is not willing to work at it, it is easy to lose the thread of the conversation. This problem has been remedied in the latest production of the Richard Morse Mime Theater, piece called What the Devil! that incorporates beautiful mime with some dialogue, a narration and dance.

title: Companies List Their Sales and Earnings Reports
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Mrs. Byrne Is Sworn In; Vows Chicago Coalition
description: CHICAGO, April 16  Jane M. Byrne, in being sworn in tonight as the 42d Mayor of Chicago, paid ample homage to her mentor, the late Mayor Richard J. Daley, then made an acknowledgment that might well have been considered heresy during his 22year reign at the helm of the city's powerful Democratic machine.

title: Islanders Sign 30Year Lease
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 16  An agreement on a new lease that will keep the New York Islanders in the Nassau Coliseum for the next 30 years was announced today by county and Islander officials.

title: Deaths
description: LAFFERTYGladys. The New York Times records with deep sorrow the Passing of Gladys Latterly, associated with The Times from ins until retiring in 1969.

title: Social Security CashFlow Problem Held Possible if U.S. Has Recession
description: WASHINGTON, April 16 (AP)  Trustees of the Social Security system warned today that a recession could jeopardize the system's ability to pay retirement benefits on time, beginning in 1983.

title: About Education
description: WILSON COLLEGE in Chambersburg, Pa., a highquality liberal arts college for women on a rustic 300acre campus, will cease operations on June 30. Over spirited protests by some students, alumnae and friends who have launched a Save Wilson drive, the trustees say that even though the college is not bankrupt its prospects for survival are dim at a time of rising inflation and declining enrollment.

title: G.M. Auto Sales Climb; Others Post 10Day Drop
description: DETROIT, April 16 (AP)  Sales by auto makers in the United States fell slightly in the first 10 days of April, with only the General Motors Corporation reporting a gain.

title: Maurice J. Cohn Is Dead at 63: A Lawyer and Realty Developer
description: Maurice J. Cohn. a lawyer and real estate developer, died April 13 at Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: Post Editor Testifies on Photographs of Berkowitz
description: A top editor of The New York Post, testifying on pictures The Post published of David Berkowitz asleep in a hospital prison ward, said yesterday that he did not know at the time that a freelance writer to whom The Post paid a total of $13,000 was in turn allegedly paying source inside the ward.

title: Rhodesia Mobilizes to Guard Vote
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 16  An armed force of 100,000 men will be stationed around the country tomorrow as black and white Rhodesians start five days of voting to give this nation its first blackled Government.

title: YAKUTSK PROGRESSES DESPITE BITTER COLD
description: YAKUTSK, U.S.S.R. They are tearing down most of the old wooden houses here in eastern Siberia's largest city because they were gradually sinking into the permafrost.

title: Lee of Expos Hurls TwoHitter
description: MONTREAL, April 16 (UPI)  Bill Lee allowed only one hit  a trapped fly that was ruled a single by one of the substitute umpires  over 8 innings and wound up with a twohitter for his first National League victory today as the Montreal Expos defeated the Chicago Cubs, 20.

title: OBSERVER A Nice Place To Visit
description: Having heard that Toronto was becoming one of the continent's noblest cities, we flew from New York to investigate. New Yorkers jealous of their city's reputation and concerned about challenges to its stature have little to worry about.

title: Trade Surplus Of Japan Rises
description: TOKYO, April 16 (AP)  Japan had a trade surplus of $968.67 million in March, up 158 percent from the February surplus of $375.65 million, the Finance Ministry said today in a preliminary report.

title: Deaths
description: ADLER  Rache l(nee Garfunkel) widow of Nathan Adler of Baltimore. Mother of Sidney. Bette Guterman and Benjamin. Grandmother and treat grandmother. Services held 4/ 15/79

title: Size Mark Is Set By Merrill Fund
description: Merrill Lynch Ready Assets, a money market fund, has become the largest American mutual fund ever, reflecting the shift of investors away from stocks toward more conservative types of investments.

title: Deaths
description: STAUB  Marshal G. age 56 of 316 Trenton Blvd. Sea Girt. NJ on Sunday. April 15, 1979. Husband of Marilyn Delaney Staub. Father of Kathy. The Funeral Mass. Wednesday. 9:30am St.Mark's R.C.Church, Sea Girt, N.J. In lieu of flowers, contributions to the Redemptorist Fathers, 7509 Shore Pkwy, Brooklyn, N.Y.

title: Concert: Canby Singers
description: THE Canby Singers, conducted by Edward Tatnall Canby, celebrated Easter Day on Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall with an a capella program titled The Sons of David  for the most part, music about King Saul and his son Jonathan, King David and his son Absalom, and Christ, the new Testament's Son of David.

title: Money
description: MONDAY, APRIL 16, 1979

title: Jersey Senators Propose Woman A sa U.S. Judge
description: TRENTON, April 16  New Jersey's two United State Senators announced today they had agreed on four candidates for Federal judgeships and had submitted the names to the White House. Included on the list is Anne Elise Thompson, the Mercer County Prosecutor, who, if appointed, would be the first woman and the first black to sit on the Federal bench in New Jersey.

title: For Peggy Guggenheim, a Lifetime Of Knowing Her Own Mind
description: VENICE  As a genteel girl from rich and prominent New York family. Peggy Guggenheim set out for Europe to have an interesting life. Now, frail at 80 years old, she lives alone in a halffinished Venetian palazzo on the Grand Canal. surrounded by the memories of her outrageous days as the darling of the European and American avantgarde  and by her art collection, which has become, finally, the center of her life.

title: Yugoslavs in Quake Belt Abandon Homes for Tents
description: BAR, Yugoslavia, April 16  Tens of thousands of families along the southern Adriatic resort coast abandoned their homes today as aftershocks followed yesterday's earthquake. The Yugoslav Government said 101 persons were known dead, with the toll expected to rise.

title: Marcus B. Finnegan, 51, An Expert in Patent Law
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  Marcus B. Finnegan, an internationally recognized expert in patent law and licensing, died of cancer Friday in Houston. He was 51 years old.

title: Syria Accused of Sealing Archeology Data
description: A leading archeology journal has charged that Syrian authorities are trying to suppress the findings of scholars who are deciphering the huge cache of inscribed clay tablets discovered amid the ruins of the 4,500yearold Kingdom of Ebla.

title: PALESTINIANS FOILED IN ATTEMPT TO TAKE AN ISRAELI AIRLINER
description: BRUSSELS, April 16  Twelve people were wounded today in an aborted attempt by a Palestinian terrorist group to take over an El Al airliner landing at Brussels' airport.

title: Occidental's FirstQuarter Net Soars
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation yesterday reported first quarter net income of $87.9 million, or $1.11 a share, almost triple the restated $32.1 million, or 36 cents a share, it reported for the yearearlier period. It was the first major oil company to issue results for the quarter.

title: 3 Guards Slain in $1.8 Million Robbery in Waterbury
description: WATERBURY, Conn., April 16 Thieves shot three security guards to death before dawn today by firing rifles through the windows of an armoredcar depot, and then fled with an estimated $1.8 million in currency, coins, checks, jewelry and food stamps.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Study at Hooker Plant Found '75 Emissions Dangerous to Health
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. April 16  The Hooker Chemical and Plastics Corporation plant here regularly released mercury, chlorine, phosphorousbased gases and persistent carcinogenic pesticides into the air and sewers of the city and in spills inside the plant, endangering the health of workers and the community, according to a 1975 internal company report made available today.

title: The U.N. Today
description: April 17, 1979

title: In the Rain Forest, a Complex and Threatened World
description: CAHUITA, Costa Rica JUST ahead, stretching from the uplands to the shores of the Caribbean like a huge green tent, looms the rain forest. From the distance, it seems quiet and benign, but within its woody boundaries thousands of species of plants, mammals, birds and insects live precariously, fighting a constant struggle for food and light in one of the world's most complex ecosystems.

title: Stage: G.R. Point Story Of Soldiers in Vietnam
description: THERE is one stretch of strong and effective writing in G.R. Point, a play about American soldiers in the Vietnam War. It comes at the end of the first act and it portrays the pathology of battle fatigue in two men who have come out of a fire fight.

title: TURNER SEES A GAP IN VERIFYING TREATY
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  Adm. Stansfield Turner, the Director of Central Intelligence, has told the Senate that it will take until 1984 for the United States to restore fully the intelligence capability for monitoring Soviet missile tests and development that was lost with the shutdown of two electronic listening posts in Iran, according to Congressional sources.

title: Occidental Challenges Merszei
description: Zoltan Merszei, who resigned in February as chairman of the Dow Chemical Company, has been hired for a top position at another major multinational corporation. The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced yesteday that Mr. Merszei had been appointed its vice chairman.

title: Dayan Assailed for Golan Remark
description: TEL AVIV, April 16  Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel was criticized today for having suggested that, just as Sinai had to be given up to make peace with Egypt, the Golan Heights might have to be ceded some day in an effort to reach a peace accord with Syria.

title: Guided Missiles Can Aid Targeting Of Drugs
description: A NEW guided missile method of administering drugs shows promise in delivering powerful doses of anticancer chemicals to specific targets in the body while leaving normal tissues largely untouched.

title: Poor Schools Attack the Budget
description: ALBANY, April 16  Criticizing what he called the immorality and arrogance of the Legislature, a lawyer for 40 property poor school districts asked State Supreme Court justice today to enjoin the state from implementing its new budget. The lawyer, Robert E. Sapir, said the budget did not comply with a court decision that education spending be equalized throughout the state.

title: Stocks Fall Amid Fears On Interest
description: Interestrate worries depressed stock prices yesterday as the Dow Jones industrial average dropped 10.05 points to 860.45. There were more than 1,100 declining issues and fewer than 400 advancing issues on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Haley and Lear Teaming On a TV Series for 1980
description: LOS ANGELES, April 16  Alex Haley, the author of Roots, and Norman Lear, the creator of All in the Family, have joined to make a television series about two 9yearold boys who grow up in a small town in the South during the Depression.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, APRIL 17, 1979

title: Song: A CaboIl'e Evening Of Donizetti, Cherubini
description: FROM the first song on her program at Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, which closed with leap to a breathtaking high pianissimo, Montserrat Caballe made clear that this was to be a night to send the vocalism enthusiasts straight to heaven. Even before the Spanish so- prano's opening gambit, Donizetti's Amore e morte, the audience was in a mood to raise the roof, giving her a long, drawnout ovation of the frenzied sort that only opera stars seem to arouse.

title: Blast at U.S. Center in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 16  An explosive charge went off early today in front of the John F. Kennedy American Center, causing structual damage but no casualties. A second charge failed to go off. The explosion was believed to be another protest against the Americansponsored EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty.

title: Safety Expert Testifies He Warned In '78 of Possible Reactor Mishap
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  The senior nuclear safety expert of the Tennessee Valley Authority said today that almost 11 months before the March 28 accident at the Three Mile Island power plant, he warned the manufacturer of the reactor that there was a possibility that a similar accident could occur.

title: U .S. OPENS A DRIVE ON PRICE GOUGERS IN RETAIL GASOLINE
description: Starting in New York, It Accuses One Station of Overcharging on 93.9 Premium Fuel

title: Peck Processes Written Words
description: Arthur Peck has been working in the officeproducts field during his entire business career  at the McGrawEdison Company, at the Dictaphone Corporation and, for the last seven years, at a company he founded, Keyboard Communications of Carle Place, L.I. Now 53 years old and the company's president, Mr. Peck sees changes emerging in his field that are more significant than any in the past.

title: The City
description: Two New York City Council members announced the introduction of legislation to combat what they called serious abuses in the guarddog industry.

title: Westinghouse Nears 7th Uranium Accord
description: PITTSBURGH, April 16  The Westinghouse Electric Corporation agreed in principle today to settle a uraniumsupply lawsuit brought by the Virginia Electric and Power Company. Westinghouse estimated that the settlement would cost it $200 million. But the utility said it would receive $361 million in cash and uranium.

title: Detergents Lead to Handcuffs
description: Two Long Island men were arrested the other day, taken to a courtroom in handcuffs and released pending a trial that could lead to 15 days in jail or a $250 fine. The charge: selling Tide, Fab and Cheer in their grocery stores.

title: EARNINGS
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company reported yesterday a 97.8 percent gain in firstquarter earnings.

title: The Region
description: WHITE PLAINS  Two passenger cars and two locomotives had to be removed from service on the Upper Harlem commuter rail line because of serious safety deficiencies that were turned up in a special state inspection of the line's trackage, passenger coaches and locomotives, according to the State Department of Transportation. In general, however, the department's inspectors judged the line serving stations in northern Westchester and Putnam County to be safe and adequate.

title: Industry Concentration Called FoodCost Factor
description: A rapid shrinkage in the number of companies in the food industry may account at least in part for the steady upward march of food prices, according to the authors of a report released today.

title: Most Branches Of OTB Reopen As Strike Ends
description: Most of the 156 offtrack betting parlors in New York City reopened yesterday after striking clerks ratified a new twoyear contract and returned to the betting windows.

title: Pakistan Is Offered a Choice on A-Arms
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  The Carter Administration, fearing a nuclear arms race on the Indian subcontinent, has offered to sell Pakistan fighter planes and to give help on nuclear power if it agrees to restrictions against the production of nuclear weapons, Government officials said today.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether transcripts of Henry A. Kissinger's telephone conversations, compiled by his secretaries while he was national security adviser and Secretary of State, are subject to disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act.

title: Chenier of Bullets Cool to Bench Role
description: These are not easy times for Phil Chenier, who once was one of the National Basketball Association's premier guards. Chenier has had to swallow his pride as he sits on the Washington Bullets' bench, waiting for Coach Dick Motta to find an opportunity to send him into a game.

title: Q&A
description: A. Einstein showed that any ma terial substance moving at the speed of light, be it atom, man or star would have an infinite mass. Even speeds much less than that of light rapidly moving atomic particles in crease enormously in mass.

title: City Opera: Le Coq d'Or
description: NO tenor has ever thanked RimskyKorsakov for the role of the Astrologer in Le Coq d'Or. It is short but it lies almost exclusively in the uppermost part of the voice, eventually ascending to E above high C. The composer suggested that it be sung by a tenoraltino, whatever he may have meant by that.

title: Unbeaten Davis Says He Hates All Facets of Boxing Except One
description: Howard Davis Jr., a 23yearold millionaire bachelor from Hempstead, L.I., will again practice the trade he says he hates Friday night when he carries his unblemished professional lightweight record into the ring at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum against Giancarlo Usai, the lightweight champion of Italy.

title: U.S. Ending SixYear Rift In Its Links With Uganda
description: WASHINGTON, April 16 (UPI) The State Department announced today that the United States would reopen its embassy in Uganda. ending a sixyear freeze in relations between the two countries.

title: Crowd Captures Suspect Fleeing Queens Shooting
description: Led by an armed passerby, a group of outraged Queens citizens chased and captured a holdup suspect yesterday afternoon, moments after he allegedly shot and critically wounded a young woman on her way to make a bank deposit at a busy Woodside intersection.

title: Joe King, 70, Sportswriter Here And Editor of New Jersey Chain
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.J., April 16 (UPI) Joe King, a New York sportswriter for nearly 40 years, died here Monday. He was 70 years old.

title: Carters Ask Extension For Filing Tax Returns
description: SAPELO ISLAND, Ga., April 16 (UPI)  The President and Mrs. Carter have filed for an automatic 60day extension on their income tax returns for 1978, a White House spokesman said today.

title: JOHN BIGGS JR. DIES; ON 3D CIRCUIT COURT
description: John Biggs Jr., Senior Judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit in Philadelphia, died Sunday at the Wilmington Medical Center in Wilmington, Del., after a heart attack. He was 83 years old and lived at Wooddale, an estate near Wilmington.

title: Rodgers, in 2:09:27, Takes 2d Straight Boston Marathon
description: BOSTON, April 16  There are steeper hills, but only one has been named Heartbreak. Someday it might be renamed after William H. Rodgers. Widening his lead on Heartbreak's back slope, Rodgers won his second consecutive Boston Marathon today, and his third in the last five years.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: DESPERATION IS SEEN IN IRAN AIDES MOVES
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 16  The resignation of Foreign Minister Karim Sanjabi yesterday and the temporary departure from Teheran of a popular religious leader appear to be a lastditch effort to salvage the provisional Government of Iran and lay the groundwork for a crackdown on the Islamic councils of Ayatollah Rnhnllah Khomeini.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Prices of metals futures tumbled again yesterday as potential buyers' kept to the sidelines. But live cattle futures soared to another record high, and grains and soybeans meandered lower as their markets awaited the first plantings report of the season.

title: Flyers, in Overtime, Beat Rangers by 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 16  The Rangers did everything right tonight in the first game of the quarterfinal series against the Philadelphia Flyers  until the last 5 minutes. In that time, Bill Barber scored for Philadelphia to send the game into overtime, then Ken Lineman followed with a suddendeath goal at 44 seconds to give the Flyers a 32 victory and a onegame lead in the fourofsevengame National Hockey League playoff.

title: Bridge:
description: If one could arrange a tournament for teams from commuter railroads throughout North America, the New Haven representatives would probably be strong favorites. The standard is very high, as witness the diagramed deal, despite the high speed of play and the confusion generated by ghoulie dealirm, in which the cards are distributed in bunches without shuffling.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: The recipe for trade protection greed, selfrighteousness and a dash of oldfashioned flagwaving  makes a potent brew. Both the steel and textile industries have recently found that it induces a sense of euphoria on Capitol Hill. And Presidential hopeful John Connally is said to be getting an enthusiastic response to his calls to send those Japanese digital watches and cassette recorders and trail bikes back where they came from.

title: Bank Earnings Results Listed
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicases stock Is listed co the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: DecadeOld TV Music Question Still Open
description: Yesterday's Supreme Court decision concerning the licensing of music used on network television involves one of the knottiest issues in the whole field of broadcast law. It is so knotty, in fact, that the case the Supreme Court decided yesterday has been in the courts since 1969, and a CBS spokesman said yesterday that his side would definitely pursue the matter further.

title: Man Is Arrested in RapeRobbery Of a Woman, 73, at, Coney Island
description: A Brooklyn man was arrested yesterday after he allegedly raped and robbed 73yearold woman under the boardwalk at Coney Island.

title: Flyers Lead Series, Benefiting From Foes' Timidity
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 17  Consistency, thy name is Rangers. However, the kind of consistency the Rangers have been producing against the Philadelphia Flyers is not exactly what wins National Hockey League games, much less playoff contests.

title: Israeli Schoolboy Saves People on Bus From Bomb
description: TEL AVIV, April 17  A watchful schoolboy bringing Passover fare to his sister saved a busload of people from death or injury today when he spotted a time bomb under a seat. The vehicle blew up moments after the passengers left.

title: Q&A
description: Q. When I make oyster stew, the milk almost invariably curdles or separates. Do you know of any way to prevent this?

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: WHETHER or not much thought is given to it, everybody knows that eating well has psychological components: The conversation during a meal, the colors of a room, the harmony of the food served and, at least as important, the overriding sense that the cook cares about the guests and has taken pains to be graceful.

title: St. Louis Bank Cuts Prime
description: ST. LOUIS, April 17 (UPI)  Southwest Bank, which led the nation in the last reduction of the prime interest rate, today lowered its rate from 11 percent to 11. Since our last nrime rate reduction Jan. 30, a number of key indicator rates have experienced the decline we anticipated, said I.A. Long, chairman of the bank, in announcing the reduction.

title: U.A.W. President Holds Wage Guideline Is Shot
description: DETROIT, April 17  Douglas A. Fraser, president of the United Automobile Workers, said today that President Carter's antiinflation wage guidelines had selfdestructed and would not play. any part in the union's wage and benefit demands when it begins negotiating a new threeyear contract for its 1.5 million members this fall.

title: Notes on People
description: Where once they were a mixed double, they now are one. Or something like that. Whatever the tennis metaphor, Chris Evert, a top star, and John Lloyd, a notsotop player, were married last evening amid considerable fanfare in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: New Yorkers,etc.
description: MOST real New Yorkers, whatever and whoever they may be, take pains to act unimpressed with just about everything. One of the few exceptions is old money. Old money doesn't buy anything more than new money but it has class. The possessors of old fortunes are also known as old families. a description that conjures up households of breeding, manners, old school ties, worn chintz, and parents with wellmodulated voices. Age has even smoothed over the backgrounds of the robber barons who were responsible for some of the original piles. After several generations, the most notorious are referred to as characters rather than crooks.

title: Soviet Aide Gives Up Party Job After Getting Key Planning Post
description: MOSCOW, April 17  Yakov P. Ryabov, a 51-year-old Communist Party offiIcial, was removed from the secretariat of the party's Central Committee in a plenary session this morning after he had been given a key government job. the Soviet Dress agency Tass said.

title: 2 IRANIAN LEADERS MAKE SHARP ATTACK ON KHOMEINI UNITS
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 17  Two major political figures in Iran today openly criticized the Revolutionary Council and the Islamic committees helping govern Iran for Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: Pennsy Settlement Is Sought on Unit
description: The Penn Central Corporation said it has filed a petition with the United States District Court in Philadelphia requesting approval of a proposed settlement with holders of outstanding secured notes of the Pennsylvania Tunnel & Terminal Railroad, a wholly owned subsidiary.

title: Bank Earnings Results Listed
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: A Farewell to a Mercedes With Portfolio
description: ON Friday, Feb. 10, 1978, my wife and I picked up our car from the garage around the corner and took our last ride in it. The ride was a fourandahalfhour one, all the way from New York to Clinton, Md., a suburb of Washington, where a friendly mechanic who had worked on the car in years past was going to sell it for us.

title: Canadiens 5, Maple Leafs 2
description: MONTREAL, April 17 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire scored two thirdperiod goals and Guy Lafleur had a goal and three assists as the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 52, last night in their playoff series opener.

title: SAFETY PANEL URGES MANY NEW DEVICES FOR MOST REACTORS
description: WASHINGTON, April 17  The Government's senior advisory committee on the safety of nuclear reactors recommended today that a broad range of new instruments be installed on more than half the nation's 72 reactors.

title: Technology
description: WITH heating oil prices climbing sharply, the 12 million or so homeowners who heat their homes with oil are in a particularly uncomfortable bind. At a time when many of them are just now paying off last winter's heating bills, they are facing even higher costs next winter as the likelihood of a heating oil shortage grows greater. So any new technology that reduces fuel oil consumption even little bit would seem to have a bright future.

title: EARNINGS
description: Philip Morris Inc. reported yesterday a firstquarter profit rise of 25.6 percent, less than its revenue jump of 36.7 percent, marking the 59th successive quarter of increases over the year before.

title: Amin Foes Seize Key Jinja Bridge
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, April 17 (Reuters)  Tanzanianled forces pushing eastward against remnants of Field Marshal Idi Amin's army have seized a vital bridge across the Nile at Jinja, a minister in the new Government said today.

title: At Coast Weekly, a Day of Rejoicing at Press Time
description: Tuesday is the day of reckoning at The Point Reyes (Calif.) Light. It is the rather frantic day when the owners, David and Cathy Mitchell, and the staff (otherwise known asthe reporter) edit the articles, lay out the pages and prepare the 16page weekly tabloid for the printer.

title: Dr. Henry D. Taterka Dies at 75; Ear, Nose and Throat Specialist
description: Dr. Henry David Taterka, an ear, nose and throat specialist, died of a heart attack Sunday at St. Luke's Hospital in New York City. He was 75 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: RESERVE CHIEF SAYS ECONOMY IS SLOWING
description: G. William Miller, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, says an economic slowdown is in progress and he has no intention of tightening credit policy further.

title: Lightweight Title Won by Watt
description: GLASGOW, April 17 (AP) Jim Watt, a 30yearold Scot, stopped Alfredo Pitalua of Colombia at 1 minute 55 seconds of the 12th round tonight and won the vacant World Boxing Council lightweight title.

title: Safety Panel Adds to Dryers List
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (UPI)  The Consumer Product Safety Commission today added more than 90 hair dryers to its list of those that were made with asbestos and could pose a hazard if the substance is blown in the users face.

title: Merger Stocks Gain in Weak Market
description: Takeover situations produced the best gains on Wall Street yesterday as the general stock market retreated slightly. The Dow Jones industrial average slipped 2.52 points to 857.93 after a 10point drop Monday.

title: Skepticism Is Voiced on Therapy Used to 'Reverse' Homosexuality
description: Skepticism, anger and enthusiasm were among the reactions from the homosexual community and psychiatrists yesterday to reports of successful therapy for homosexual dysfunction or orientation by Dr. William H. Masters and Virginia E. Johnson, the St. Louis sex re searchers.

title: Cosmos Still Decline To Support Walkout
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., April 17  An attempt by the directors of the soccer players' union and players from three teams to persuade the Cosmos to support the players' strike proved fruitless today.

title: Deaths
description: SILVERBen. Beloved husband of Hannah, devoted father of Stuart. Dear brother of Norman and Al. Adored grandfather of Mindy and Paul. Funeral services Thurs. 12:45pm Riverside Chapel, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave.

title: For Greek Easter, A Hungry American
description: ATHENS THE sevenweek Lenten fast practiced by the pious of the Greek Orthodox Church is complicated and rigorous, a fact made clear to me by my Greek Orthodox sisters-in-law, who every spring would describe at length the agonies of hunger they were suffering.

title: Entertainment Events
description: MANNY, a Play by Raymond Sera, directed by Harold J. Kennedy; starring Mr. Serra. At the Century Theater. 235 West 46th Street, 7.

title: Advertising
description: THAT heavenly choir that goes to work whenever a savings bank customer announces, I'm a people, does nothing for the New York State Bankers Association, except grate on collective nerves.

title: Recipes From Ancient Kitchens
description: Asafetida is available at Indian grocery stores and at Aphrodisia, 28 Carmine Street, where rue, pennyroyal and hundreds of other herbs and spices line the shelves.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A comment by Criminal Court Judge Bruce McM. Wright, about Jack Greenberg, a white lawyer who heads the NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund, was quoted incorrectly in Metropolitan Report yesterday. The correct quotation is: I've got nothing against Jack Greenberg. But we've got lots of good black lawyers. When B'nai B'rith has a black lawyer as its head and the AntiDefamation League gets Yasir Arafat as its lawyer, we'll be ready for Jack Greenberg.

title: Delta Blues: Lockwood and Shines
description: ROBERT JOHNSON, the celebrated Mississippi Delta blues man who was a significant influence on later blues and on rock, taught few younger musicians before his early death. For the most part, his influence spread through his recordings and the work of musicians who copied him. But Robert Lockwood and Johnny Shines, who were at the Lone Star Cafe Monday and Tuesday, learned directly from the master and are his only living musical heirs. They are also stubborn individualists. Mr. Shines's solo set was full of Robert Johnson melodies and guitar patterns, but every song he played bore his personal stamp. And Mr. Lockwood ranged all the way through modern blues history, from country blues in the Johnson idiom to James BrownInfluenced funk.

title: Murdoch Denies Role In Paper's Obtaining Of Berkowitz Pictures
description: Rupert Murdoch, the publisher of The New York Post, testified yesterday that he was out of the country and had no knowledge of the arrangements made to obtain illegal pictures in a hospital prison ward of David Berkowitz, the socalled Son of Sam killer.

title: South Korea Sets Plan To Slow Rising Prices
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 17  The Government of President Park Chung Hee has announced a series of measures aimed at controlling inflation and slowing the rapid pace of the country's industrialization program. The steps include reduced investment in heavy industry and sharp reductions in Government spending.

title: Market Place
description: TO some analysts, the F.W. Woolworth Company's effort to acquire Revco D.S. Inc., announced yesterday, is an attempt to evade takeover through acquisition. Similarly, Marshall Field & Company made acquisitions little more than a year ago when Carter Hawley Hale Stores, the aggressive department store chain, attempted to acquire the Chicagobased retailer.

title: Mondale Assures Oslo on Defense
description: OSLO. April 17  Vice President Mondale pledged American support t(iday for the courageous Norwegian resolve in the face of increased Soviet pressure on the northern flank of the Western alliance.

title: 2 Agencies Start Program to Aid Potential Volunteers Education
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (AP)  The Government began a new pilot program today to find out how to help young volunteers correct educational failures that block their enlistment in the armed forces.

title: Caliber Joins Contest By Bronx Democrats For Borough President
description: With a slap at the new leadership of the Democratic Party in the Bronx, State Senator Joseph L. Galiber formally declared his candidacy for Borough President yesterday. He promptly received the endorsment of the black political establishment.

title: News Summary
description: There was rising opposition in Iran to the Islamic committees of Ayatollah Khomeini. Ayatollah Taleghani, the leading religious figure in Teheran, warned against a return of dictatorship and despotism. A rally of 50,000 people protested brief arrests of members of Ayatollah Taleghani's family by Islamic militiamen and demanded the return of the Teheran leader to active politics. [Page A1, Column 1.]

title: OPEC Move On Prices Seen
description: KUWAIT, April 17 (AP)  Kuwait's oil minister, Sheik Ali Khalifa as Sabah, said today that members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries would reconsider oil prices when they meet here in June.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: IT is my custom to walk from Penn Station my place of employment at Park Avenue and 46th Street, writes Walter F. Baumann, and I vary the route each day to make the stroll Interesting. Nevertheless, I walk the stretch on 42d Street between Broadway and Sixth Avenue at least two or three times a month.

title: Deaths
description: ??LOREA  Mildred B. Died on April 14, 1979. Survived by her children, Karen, Robert and Alan and her tour grandchildren. Services in California.

title: Woolworth In Talks For Revco
description: The F.W. Woolworth Company, locked in a legal fight to stave off a takeover bid by Brascan Ltd., a Canadian holding company, said yesterday that it had been having preliminary talks to acquire Revco D.S. Inc., the country's largest chain of drugstores.

title: Song: Phyllis Hyman, Peabo Bryson
description: THE pairing was perfect: two young singers whose most successful records in this disco day and age have been old-fashioned ballads. But the promoters of Monday evening's concert at Avery Fisher Hall had the billing backward. Phyllis Hyman, who opened the show, has a big, strapping voice, while the headliner, Peabo Bryson, has a big, strident one. And the roof that Miss Hyman raised with her bravura performance fell in when she surrendered the stage to Mr. Bryson's crashing boredom

title: Stage: Whose Life Is It Anyway? From Britain
description: WHOSE Life Is It Anyway? is a battle of ideas and a battle for life. It is a rare successful effort to fuse a tense and provocative argument, carried on in unashamed vigor and prolixity, with a play that lives and moves.

title: The Region
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  Twenty students were arrested after they allegedly took over the administration building of the State University of New York at Purchase. They were charged with obstructing governmental administration and were summoned to appear in court May 4.MIDDLETOWN, N.Y. (AP)  Officials at the Middletown Psychiatric Center began cleaning up dangerous chemicals that had been dumped about a mile from the center. State health officials said that the site posed no danger to the public, but that the chemicals, which included sulfuric acid, hydrochloric acid and formaldehyde, should be disposed of in a proper landfill.

title: Books of The Times
description: WOMEN model their own betrayal in the advertisements for which they pose: This is Vivian Gornick's position in her introduction to Gender Advertisements, by Erving Goffman. Mr. Goffman would seem to agree. One might just as well say, he writes, that there is no gender identity. There is only a schedule for the portrayal of gender. When he observes that we are socialized to confirm our own hypotheses about our natures, he appears to he referring to that schedule.

title: Quixotic Italian Politician Enlists Pope in His Cause
description: ROME, April 17  The Italians have long bestowed recognition on him as the country's No. 1 gadfly.cause of the inefficiency of the Government apparatus, may go a long way toward making up for the scarcity of funds and organization.

title: Sinai Oil Transfer Discussed
description: CAIRO, April 17 (Reuters)  Oil Minister Ahmed Ezzeddin Hilal met today with Israel's Minister of Energy, Yitzhak Modal, to discuss arrangements to turn over Sinai oilfields, the official Middle East News Agency said.

title: Price Peril Seen in Oil Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (UPI) Proposed Arab sanctions against Egypt for signing the treaty with Israel could further increase the price of oil in the United States, according to Energy Secretary James R. Schlesinger.

title: Koch Says City Will Prepare Its Own Hospital Plan
description: Saying that he had failed to get Governor Carey's cooperation on a citywide hospital reduction plan, Mayor Koch announced yesterday that New York City would draw up its own plan to eliminate an estimated 2,914 excess hospital beds.

title: Second Female Patient Files Suit Alleging Sexual Abuse by Dentist
description: A Manhattan dentist convicted of sexually abusing a female patient while she was under medication was sued by another female patient yesterday for $40 million.

title: John C. Roberts, ExHeadmaster Of Upper School at Browning, 83
description: Dr. John C. Roberts, former headmaster of the upper school of the Browning School in Manhattan, died Sunday at a nursing home in Trumbull, Conn. He was 83 years old and lived in Tenafly, NJ.

title: Rhodesia Reports a Fifth of Blacks Voted on First Day of the Election
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 17 Blacks all over Rhodesia voted for a new government today, some casting their votes eagerly, many unsure of what a ballot or even an election was. Almost all were hopeful that somehow the voting would bring an end to the country's sixyear guerrilla war.

title: How Much to Count on the Saudis
description: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee has provoked instant controversy by releasing a gloomy assessment of future Saudi Arabian oil exports. The State Department and the oil industry believe that the report's use of proprietary technical information has angered the Saudi Government. But in the debate over whose feathers were ruffled, the issue underlying the report should not be obscured: Can the West count on the Saudis to produce more oil?

title: Music: Wolpe's Quartet, Works by Crumb, Foss
description: THE Group for Contemporary Music offered a strong, oddly symmetrical program Monday night in Cooper Union's Great Hall. The strehgth came from the quality of the three pieces on the bill; the symmetry from the fact that all three were composed by important compos- ers Detween 1955 and 1969, in four movements involving some theatrics, with an instrumental quartet. That last bit of congruity was upset by the addition of a percussionplaying soprano in one work and a tape part in another, but you get the idea.

title: An African Jet Lands in Rhodesia After Being Shot at Over Zarnbia
description: VICTORIA FALLS,,Rhodesia, April 17 (UPI)  An executive jet with several; Gabonese and Vali officials aboard madel a forced landing at the airport here after begins hot at over Zambia.

title: Utility's Net Up in Jersey For Quarter
description: NEWARK, April 17 (AP)  Earnings of the Public Service Electric and Gas Company rose 27 percent In the first quarter of 1979 compared with the similar period a year ago.

title: Chrysler, Mitsubishi In Australian Accord
description: The Chrysler Corporation said it had agreed to sell onethird of its Australian subsidiary, Chrysler Australian Ltd., to the Mitsubishi group of Japan for $30.2 million.

title: Mild Earthquake Shakes Maine and New Hampshire
description: PORTLAND, Me., April 17 (AP)  An earthquake described as the strongest to hit the area in at least a decade shook southern Maine and coastal New Hampshire tonight, but there were no reports of major damage, the authorities said.

title: Maillol's Model Makes Art Her Life
description: PARIS NOW 60 years old, Dina Vierny is still merry, enamored of art, and well rounded, even if the famous curves have sagged and bulged in spots and her mission has changed from inspiration to commemoration.

title: More FM Radio Sought
description: WASHINGTON, April 17  The top communications authority in the Carter Administration called on the Federal Communications Commission today to change its rules in order to increase the number of FM radio stations.

title: Landlords and Union, With Friday Deadline, Seeking New Contract
description: Apartmenthouse residents in New York City face the possibility of a drastic curtailment of services this weekend it the union representing more than 20,000 doormen, elevator operators, porters and handymen fails to reach a new contract agreement.

title: Canada Plans Subsidies To Spur Technology
description: OTTAWA, April 17  Canada announced business subsidies of $185 million (Canadian) over the next three years to attract new products and technology to the country, in the wake of warnings that it was becoming industrially backward.

title: Phone Number Set Up For Carey TV Program
